text: I had been here 2x before and I had wonderful experiences. I am not sure if they had switch the chef, but the food no longer wonderful. Almost all the dishes I order no longer "wow" me. What happen?

On a Friday afternoon service was fantastic. We got seated right away and our server tended to us kindly and appropriately. But the food is not what I remembered it being a few years ago. I got clams and linguine it was basic, flavorless (needed more salt & garlic... maybe the addition of some lemon). The pizza my husband had looked under whelming too if your looking for Italian I'd say you can give this one a pass.
Really good food especially if you are vegetarian. The service was amazing aswell. One of the best trendy late night food in Chicago. Def recommended!

Delicious lunch time deal during the weekday! We got a nice lunch for $25 for 2 people. We started with veal meatballs (nice big portion in the white wine sauce with golden raisins that were very sweet and complimented the dish perfectly) and a 0.5 L bellini (very fresh and refreshing). For the pasta dish, we rooted for the one with lamb (forgot the name) and it was freaking amazing. The portion was huge for the tapas style and very cheesy. Last but not least, we had the dish with bread and an arrangement of seafood (octopus, clams, calamari, fish) and it was so yummy!! I dipped the bread in the soup and it's the italian version of tomato soup mmmmmm  getting hungry as i type this tbh
Horrible service,  Food is not good at all.  The food runners literally slam the plates in front of you so rudely.

What a wonderful setting in a beautiful city. Outside of a light rain on our way to the restaurant, the weather was perfect for outdoor seating. The wait would have been pretty extensive had we not decided to sit outside. The service was pretty good and the meal even better. The prices are pretty decent although the portions are small, so it is comparable. This is family style so they bring the food as it is cooked so I got my dish before my husband's dish. He received his pretty soon afterwards so no issue with that.

I love this spot!!! I would come here for shared plates. You can eat a dish on your own, but it's so much better when you get a group of 4-6 people and order different pasta, 2 bottles of wine (pretty fairly priced instead of all just $25 and $30 bottles) and having one big, Italian dinner! I especially liked their Margherita pizza. It was so fresh. This place is huge with a nice upstairs. If you can, go during summer for their patio - I always run into people I know here.

I want to start by saying that the pizza (that finally got to my table after waiting for 45 minutes) was fine. What wasn't fine was the service. I sat by myself outside and was ignored rather serviced. The kitchen apparaently made a mistake on my order and I was not told nor assured that my food would be coming out soon. Note to manager: there's an amazing opportunity to train your wait staff to be attentive and compensate customers who are on the receiving side of a kitchen mishap. All good....training needed!

I've never written a bad Yelp review. But my experience at Quartino tonight was so unpleasant, it has unfortunately merited my first one.  I've been to Quartino a number of times. Until today, I would have given it a solid 3.5 stars. Pretty tasty food, good place for a group. I went for dinner with coworkers tonight and we were having a nice enough time - our server was very pleasant, food came out promptly, most of it was good (fettuccine alfredo was weirdly soupy...).  Quartino always has a loud, bustling vibe but as we were nearing the end of our meal, the very large table of young men next to us had gotten so obnoxiously loud it was hard for us to even hear each other. They were drinking so much that we were surprised they hadn't been asked to leave. And keep in mind, this was a Monday night. One guy in my direct line of sight had gotten so drunk he was swaying and actually looked ill. You could tell he was about to throw up...and then he did. AT THE TABLE. It was absolutely disgusting. His friends just screamed and laughed and took videos of it, until finally some of them walked him outside. This was the very end of our meal, and now WE all felt sick just from watching this.  We asked for the manager who came over a few minutes later (meanwhile, the vomit still had not been cleaned up). He apologized and explained that the guy (and presumably others at the table - they were all being very friendly with the staff) is actually an EMPLOYEE!!  How unbelievably inappropriate to allow your employees to be overserved to the point of getting sick (at the table!!), in their place of work, while the restaurant is open and the dining room is packed with customers. Not only did it ruin our meal, it was SO unprofessional and shocking that it has completely turned me off from Quartino.  It used to be a go-to spot for group outings and work dinners. I will absolutely not be going back.

This is a consistent place where I have enjoyed many of the classic Italian items on the menu. Great pizza and pasta.  Very nice bar area to enjoy a cocktail. The cheese platter is delicious. Service is prompt. Can be noisy but definitely worth a visit.
From start to finish everything was excellent and reasonably priced  Can't wait to bring family and more friends to enjoy the homemade cuisine here

Best Downtown Chicago Italian late night food. On a date, don't want it after drinks, out with friends or just want to explore a new place? Go to Quartino's! They have a variety of options, shareable, great tasting and also has a bar.  They have some basic familiar dishes but the rest is a journey you've got to explore! It'll keep you coming back without burning holes in your pockets.  I've never been disappointed here! I love how their pasta is always perfectly al dente! It's as close as you can get to authentic when you're having a late night out! Be aware, you'll get food coma for sure!
Keep on doing what you're doing (except, maybe shut up yelling customers). Place is top-notch, but sometimes customers yell. They are probably tourists.

Pros: didn't have to wait long to be seated for my 7:30pm reservation -prices are decent Cons: -it was way too loud in the dining room. I had to practically shout across the table so that the person sitting 1 foot away from me could hear me -BAD service.. wait staff was rude, no introduction and recommendations offered, only came by once after our meal was served to check on us, had to wave down another person to get our bill, no dessert menu offered, had to pay with host bc noone came around for more than 15 minutes after we received our check, it was a special occasion and it wasn't acknowledged -too crowded and tables are way too close to one another The hostess unknowingly relayed our concern to the GM, but by then it was too late. He offered to give us complimentary drinks and desserts but we didn't want to go back and give it another shot. We had enough. It's too bad, I love italian food and I really wanted to like this place. I think service is equally as important as the food.  I gave this place 2 stars for the decent food.

My friends and I were looking for a nice Italian restaurants that's also affordable so we came here. Our waitress and service were amazing! They were so kind and the food was brought out in a timely manner. The dishes here are meant to be shared with your table but they aren't large portions. Food: we ordered the fettuccini alfredo (creamy and yummy), the shrimp risotto (amazing with so many flavors), a margarita pizza (perfect crispiness) and bruschetta (kinda messy but still delish). Ambiance is nice and crowded and busy - classic Chicago.  A great experience and I would definitely come back.

Ate outside which was nice, extremely loud inside. Food was fantastic. Best linguine with white clam sauce I've had in a long time. Bolognese was excellent as well. Will definitely make this a regular stop on our visits here.

Excellent homemade pasta!! Totally recommended!!  Our waitress from the bar we were before said is like a gem! Very casual! And the outdoor seating area is very cute! I had the Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo(braised beef marinated for hours) delicious and my husband the Tagliatelle alla Bolognese very good too! They are open until late night

Consistence is the name of the game. Quartino's will forever have my heart! Each time I am in the area, I make it a point to eat at Quartinos. From the house cured meats, cheap wine and amazing service, this place will always be my favorite restaurant!  Be sure to try the meat and cheese platter. It came with your choice of meats, cheeses and small salads. My friend had the sausage and peppers dish and that was so very tasty!

Came here on a Friday night, very interesting crowd, everyone was either incredibly casual or very dressed up. Seating was way too crowded for me; very difficult to navigate in between tables. When I go to Italian restaurants, I mostly look forward to the freshly baked, warm bread to come to the table. Why I give this place 3 stars? The bread was dry and cold, no no no Quartino! BUT the highlights of our dinner were: -House Made Goat's Milk Ricotta served with warm honey (amazing) and REALLY good bread. The ricotta was so fresh, and so tasty with the honey. -Porcini and Truffle Risotto was to die for. Rich, thick, and flavorful!! Side note: the other two dishes we got were the Gnocchi with Pesto and the Cavatelli with Tomato Sauce. My girlfriend loved the gnocchi but I wasn't a fan of the gooey consistency. The cavatelli was also unsatisfying... not enough flavor. The dishes came out warm, but I like mine served straight out of the pan and piping hot. Altogether, I would come back for the ricotta and honey appetizer again. I would consider trying other pastas to see if they turn out any better. I would also take the patio over the insanely crowded dining space.
Amazing. Just great pasta and service. Fabulous house wines. It's probably one of my favorites in the city. It's certainly a Chicago staple.

We had the most amazing service !! The manager and wait staff was so attentive and had wonderful recommendations !!Went there for happy hour and food and drinks where outstanding!!! Will definitely be back!
Love this place!  We have our office holiday here every year and the staff is so great to work with, the food is always great and we love the atmosphere.

Very nice place. The wait can be long. I advice to reserve it on open table. Portions are small and do not come out at the same time. So be ready for that. Prices are normal. Would totally recommend bruschetta and tiramisu.

Great spot in River North for some Italian, with a big group or on a date. Everything is tapas style and great for sharing and trying everything. Everything low priced including wine. Been here multiple times and will be back!

I like the style of this restaurant, how everything is meant to be shared. I was worried we would all leave hungry because of small portions, but all of us left full and happy. It was cool getting to try a bunch of different things! I tried the caprese salad, gnocchi, marinara pizza, vegetarian pizza, and pasta pomodoro. My favorite was the pizza with vegetables, delicious! We also all shared zeppole for dessert which was pretty tasty, I especially liked the chocolate sauce. I got a grapefruit limoncello as well and it was good. Prices weren't too bad I thought!  Service wasn't the best. It was super busy so I understand, but it would've been nice if she would have checked on us because there were times where we needed things and she was nowhere to be found haha. Also the restaurant is like jam packed, like the tables are kinda all squished together. Overall cool restaurant though and I'd be down to come back!

Very good restaurant . We sat outside , which was very nice . Our server was wonderful , explained to us about the menu and was very attentive throughout the meal.  We ordered the pasta with pesto and fettochini alfredo, and for dessert we had the Tirramusi that was amazing ! The entrees were both delicious .  Overall very nice experience . We would definitely go back there.

Excellent wine choices! Our server brought 3 tastes so we could try before purchasing a bottle. We loved the wrapped dates, penne with vodka sauce, amazing tortellini, everything we tried was awesome! Each plate is a decent size for 4-5 people to taste. Only complaint is the tables are tight! Poor servers are fighting to get thru. But great service! Great food! Great wine!
The food here is really flavourful and inexpensive, they also have a pretty nice wine selection. It might be a little noisy inside specially on weekends so I would suggest sitting on the patio.

We went here for a date night. The place was packed, but service was great. We started with polenta fries, which I really liked, but wish it had a different dipping sauce. The pizza was also amazing. The only drawback for me is that they bring each item out as it's ready, so no formal courses. That being said, it is more of a family style restaurant and they're up front about it when they seat you. We will definitely be back!

This place has a great atmosphere and good Italian food. There's lots of options for outdoor seating but it gets pretty packed so definitely make a reservation. It's tapas style so the dishes are small and meant for sharing. Fun for a big group of people.

We love to eat here . Great pizzas ... delicious pasta and a huge wine selection . Waiters are always in soccer jerseys and tvs are always playing soccer or Italian films . Gelato and sorbet are good too

My favorite place when in Chicago!  I love the crowded, loud ,  aromatic fill of this place.  Everyone is buzy eatting, drinking, and enjoying their family and friends.  You need to expect the crowd, and welcome the close tables...and you can check out all the dishes your neighbors are getting!  We always try new dishes, and are never disappointed.   The short ribs topped this last trip.  Grab a bottle of the house red and enjoy the event!  No matter what we order, how many we come with, we always end up @30$ a person...every.time..Worth the trip!

I made reservations for a Bachlorette party, and made it clear that we were there to celebrate someone, sadly when we arrived we were crammed into a table with other tables on all four sides, making it nearly impossible to get in or out of our table without disturbing strangers around us. The main room was so incredibly loud we struggled to even have conversations at our table, it even resulted in the bride loosing her voice because she had to speak so loudy that the table could hear her.  We are informed that the portions were more family style and that we should order multiples to share, which we did. Our table of four order threes pastas to share and we were very surprised when they brought out the first pasta, as it would be enough for one person. I would recommend each person ordering the pasta dish of their choice, as the serving is not family style in my opinion.  The food was just okay, nothing spectacular.

Great to order a bunch of food to share and the seafood comes in a good portion. The bread is amazing and comes with practically everything. The patio is nice during the summer, & definitely recommend the red sangria. Friendly & attentive staff. The only downside is the tables are a little jam packed together

Oh. My. Gosh. After multiple recommendations from locals and regular Chicago visitors alike, I booked a corporate dinner here this past week. A gorgeous building with vintage details, we walked into the private room with a wonderful bar set up and nicely set tables. I was greeted by Manny and his staff who took care of our every need with a smile. And oh the food. Everything was absolutely delicious. We had calamari, polenta fries, white bean dip, caprese salad, romaine salad, tagliatelle bolognese, fettuccini alfredo, beef filets, sautéed shrimp and tiramisu.  My group requested from now on we host our corporate dinners at Quartino's!
Amon was a fantastic server! Very knowledgeable & provided outstanding customer service! Overall great experience! Food was tasty & the red sangria was yummy!

In a city with so many great Italian options it can be tough to choose the right place to go, and continue to revisit. I think I found that in Quartino. It is extremely busy so make a reservation, especially on weekends! You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and it is encouraged to share plates. Our server was super friendly and knowledgeable, without being overbearing. The food and wine are affordable without sacrificing quality. I can't wait to go back again!

Great find!  Everything is small plates and meant to be shared.  Lots of choices for all kinds of appetites.  Waiter  was friendly but not overbearing.  Decent wine list.  The restaurant is hugs and has outdoor seating, but the size does not impact the food.  Manager as also helpful when we requested some additional condiments.  Highly recommend.
Excellent late night eats! Food was amazing, Pasta, pizza and coffee! Service was excellent. Cannot believe I've never been. Love the tapas for Italian food..

Honestly this place was a let down on our visit to Chicago. We were looking for some Italian food and came across this place from reviews and google. The restaurant allows reservations which is nice, considering the wait was quite long Friday night. The aesthetic is nice however the restaurant is so cramped and very noisy. Our waiter was often never to be found when we wanted something and we had to flag down another waiter to get our order in and more bread. Also while there were four of us and we all ordered, they tended to be stingy with the bread -_- overall when we got our food nothing was remarkable, the vodka sauce was pretty good but the Alfredo was average.  Our waiter had told us everything was portioned as family sized so we expected leftovers, the portions were actually pretty small and we were left wanting more. We decided to do dessert and that was delicious! We had the tiramisu and it was such a creamy consistency and such a strong flavor. Definitely recommend the tiramisu

My wife and I ate here while visiting Chicago last week.  I can't say enough good things about it.  It was the perfect start our greatest night there.   We had Ensalata Caprese, Gnocchi, Salmon, and Chocolate cake for dessert.  I had an inexpensive red, and my wife a white.  Everything was perfectly delicious!  I always say you can judge a restaurant by their gnocchi, and Quartino's did not disappoint, nor did the rest of our order.  We are big on chocolate cake, but picky.  We both loved theirs, even though we couldn't finish it.  We stuffed every last bit we could fit into ourselves, but we were too full by that point and had to surrender. I prefer to drink wine out of a wine glass, so I was a bit skeptical when they served my wine in a small carafe with a little juice glass.  It turned out to be a great idea because you could only fit a few sips at a time in the glass, so I got a fresh pour every few sips.  Lame tangent, still relevant. We wore jeans and t-shirts, and sat at the bar, but everyone there treated us like royalty.  The bartenders were all super friendly and accommodating, and even the manager came and greeted us at one point.  Everyone made us feel very welcome there.  Not only were the food and wine delicious, the whole experience was great, and certainly a highlight of our trip.  It was our first time in Chicago, and we plan to return someday.  When we do, we will definitely be stopping back in Quartino.
Just amazing. Get the pizza, get the pasta, get the house wine.
the food is great and the staff is very attentive. i was here for a bachelorette party and we were well taken care of. I'll def being coming back

This was the very best of Chi town... from the Italian tapas and wine to the very BEST Espresso martini ...best saved for dessert.  Absolutely loved this authentic Italian restaurant.... the manager Scott was fabulous as was our waiter. The 3 sisters from San Diego

Oh my goodness. Authentic Italian food galore. My fiancé and I came here on a Saturday night thinking we would have to wait awhile since there were crowds outside (always a good sign), but we were seated right away! For those who are gluten sensitive like me, the gluten free pasta is absolutely mouth-wateringly delicious and we enjoyed every bite of our meal! I'm taking off one star just because of the long wait for the pasta (over 30 minutes), but it was overall a very delightful experience with our waiter checking in on us constantly. Highly recommend!

My flight landed at 11:30pm so I was looking around trying to find a top notch restaurant that was still serving food around 12:30am and stumbled across Quartino.  When I called to confirm that their kitchen was still open, they were kind enough to allow me to place an order on the phone so that the food would be ready for us as soon as we arrived.  And lo and behold, within a few minutes of being seated in the bar area (the main restaurant was closed), we were already eating :) The pizza that we ordered was fantastic, as was the cavatelli dish but unfortunately the gnocchi dish that we ordered was bland and flavorless.  We didn't say anything to the staff, but our waitress noticed that we had polished off the first two dishes and barely touched the gnocchi and expressed concern when we didn't want to pack it to go.  When we received the bill, she told us that she had taken the gnocchi off the bill (completely unasked for), which I really appreciated.  What a great introduction to Chicago hospitality!

We stumbled upon this restaurant near our hotel the last time we were in the city. It was so good that we had to go back this time! You cannot go wrong with whatever dish you order. Everything is delicious and quality. Not only is the food tasty, but the service was good, the tapas (sharing) concept with Italian is smart, and the wine was also nice. I highly suggest trying to get a table on the upstairs balcony - good view, fresh air, and away from the cars and pedestrians. Definitely share a bunch of dishes - the more delicious food to try! We enjoyed the wild arugula salad with hazelnuts and orange, the mixed olives, the (green) gnocchi, and veal meatballs. All the dishes were amazing and fresh. My favorite were the veal meatballs with red sauce and riccota. They were tender, sweet, and yet savory. Quartino is a must try when in Chicago! Enjoy

This place is pretty good. I went here with some family on a Saturday night, and boy was it packed. There was seating outside, there was a seating inside. Looked like there was seating on the 2nd floor. Looked like there was seating outside on the 2nd floor.  On a saturday night, at 7pm, make sure you have your reservations otherwise you will be waiting for a while. This is an Italian Tapas... small portions which were meant to be shared with your table. They had a huge wine list, various Italian sodas, coffees, and normal coke/pepsi. This place is a little big, our server was very friendly and accommodating but he disappeared many times and we only saw him for a few minutes at a time. Keep in mind that this is Tapas. The food will show us as it is finished so you will get random items at random times.  I ordered D'Anitra Pizze with Duck Prosciutto which is cured in house I beleive, with onion and wild agugula. Overall, the pizza had a nice flavor, was able to hold up to the ingreidents well without falling but it was a little charred on the bottom. Duck Prosciuitto was delicious and had a lot of good flavor and it was enjoyable.  Polpette al sugo di pomordo aka: veal meatballs in organic tomato sauce with fresh basil and homemade ricotta were very tender and juicy. The cheese was hidden but it gave it a nice balance to the overall flavor.  Polenta Fries left a lot to be desired. I expected them to be a little crispier and were a little bland.  Rigatoni was delicious. Pasta was nicely cooked, lamb sugo had good depth and balance. I did enjoy the stacciatella di burrata which is basically buffalo mozz.  Asparagus Risotto was very bland. Asparagus was a little rawer than I prefered. Risotto was lacking in flavor and depth. It was just mushed and wet rice. It was not creamy.  Broccoli Rabe was bland and I had to add some salt to it.  Braised Pork Shank was amazing. The presentation was basic but it was delicious and it allowed the meat to talk. Very tender meat and seasoned nicely. Fatty shank which gave it a good rich flavor that melt in your mouth.  Overall, the food was delicious but a few things were lacking. Some needed salt or more depth to it. I could see why this place was very busy but they almost need more servers otherwise you wont see your server for a while. The bill was a lot cheaper than I thought. It averaged to about 35 per person in my group and we all left with full bellies. I could see myself returning in the near future and it is a nice place to eat at.

YUM!!! Came here for a bachelorette party. (So we already pre ordered everything) and their was TONS of food. We started off with bread and 2 types of salad. Then cheese and pepperoni pizza. Then 2 types of pasta. Bachelorette got a special dessert ;) service was fast and excellent. Definitely recommend this place for a bachelorette party dinner!

Go!  And get a table outside! Homemade pasta, creamy burrata, great wine selection, what more can a girl ask for?! This is the type of restaurant where it's okay to leisurely nibble on food while sharing a few bottles of wine (we were there for 3 hours!) Book reservations in advance since it gets busy!

Great Tapas Italian restaurant but always super loud and crowded . Service is hit or miss sometimes because of huge crowd . Tables are little too close for my choice . They meatballs are really good and so their !  Noise levels during summer are really annoying ( typical river north restaurant problem ) ! Patio is also pretty okay on busy state street ( doesn't have a good vibe to it )  5 starts for the food though !
Quartino is the best place for girl's dinner! Yes! Great price, thin pizza and good wine!

The only reason I have given this restaurant to stars is because of the great service.   Besides that, I didn't really enjoy the food at all.  With my friend we got the beef carpaccio, the bacon wrapped dates, the tomato sauce cavatelli, the shrimp and the chicken.  Out of all those dishes I can tell you the dates and the cavatelli were good but not exceptional. All the rest lacked flavor and the shrimp specially tasted like plastic.

TLDR: great food at a reasonable price.  I'm not a connoisseur of Italian food but the beef carpaccio and duck prosciutto pizza was amazing. I had an espresso martini which was good. The wine list looks good. Service was solid, our waiter was a little surly but food came out quickly. The bathroom was also adorably old. Great place I'd come here again.

Came here last night on a whim, didn't realize that it was tapas all around. Never been to a tapas restaurant that didn't have at least a few entrees that weren't tapas so I thought it was interesting. Me and my father shared eggplant, linguine and Clams, and shrimp risotto. The eggplant was just alright compared to the risotto and the linguine and clams. My dad gets linguine and clams almost every Italian place we go and he said it was the one of the best he's had. I loved the shrimp risotto full of flavor and I loved the zucchini and sun-dried tomatos in it. My little brother (16) wasn't a huge fan of the menu but everything we had was good.
Recommend going straight to the bar if you don't have any reservations and grab any table. Amazing, delicious pasta! Order the meatball sliders
One of the most authentic Italian restaurants I've been to. Service and food was out of this world.
Really great pasta all around. Tried the linguini with clams, eggplant parmesan, spaghetti and meatballs - all freshly made and really well done.

+  w/  (8/10) The pizza was a bit on the blander side. Overall an average tasting pizza that could probably obtain from a pizza chain. On the other hand the pasta was really good which makes up for the lacking in points. It was well mixed and not too dry. It wasn't too cheesy while still having the taste of the ingredients permeating though.

This restaurant was recommended by the concierge at the Palomar hotel (another five star recommendation).  The fresh bread that greets you when you arrive is amaze.  Basked in the fresh olive oil and vinegar provided only makes it all the better.  I ordered the salmon and my friend ordered to octopus!  We both had soups to start, I had the minestrone and my friend had the minestrone!  Everything was super fresh and amazing!  Service was quick and courteous.  Sitting out on the patio is recommended - a great place to people watch.

Oh my goodness this place is fantastic. We came for a large party gathering up stairs. The food and drink started early and kept coming often. So delicious: 3 kinds of pizza, then a great antipasti platter, I had proseco, then two kinds of pasta followed by two fish dishes, then the meat chicken and beef. It was a lot of food followed by some the best Tiramisu I've ever tasted. It was a magical meal that demanded a nice evenings walk back to the hotel which turned out to be so pleasant and delightful. The staff here are so pleasant. And I loved the bathroom attendant. We, in California, don't see restroom attendants very often and I thought she was : a squirt of soap, hot water running and a towel, followed by a breath mint or stick of gum on your way out; delightful.

My second time in the restaurant, we were sitting outside and a torrential downpour started that caused us to move inside. Even though they were packed, the management was very quick to get everyone new tables inside the restaurant. Very friendly and accommodating staff.  Not to mention the pizza and the cavatelli are both excellent options. Would highly recommend not only because of the food, but also the atmosphere and the unparalleled service.

I visited Quartino while attending a business conference in town.  I extended my trip by a day just so I could experience a bit more of what Chicago has to offer.  At the suggestion of a bartender at another establishment, I walked to Quartino for dinner and I really should have tipped him a little heavier because I came away very impressed with the food, decor, and service.  Since I was solo, I chose to sit at the bar, first ordering a Negroni which I highly recommend.  Very nice!  I was unable to decide on a dish or two so at the suggestion of the bartender, I ordered three half plates.  My Gnocchi came out so fast that I told the server that it wasn't mine when he brought it.  I also had the Veal Meatballs Napoli and the Orecchiette.  All three were fantastic. Ordinarily, I like to try different places when I visit the larger cities, but Quartino is most definitely up for a return visit on my next trip to Chicago.
Good Italian place close to the embassy suites hotel. Good food and nice outdoor dining. Recommend.

Went to quartino for our anniversary, had the pleasure of Ramon serving us. Have been to quartino on multiple occasions but this time was blown out of the water! My favorite place in the whole city. Ask for Ramon and you will not regret it!

This is one of my favorite places for dinner in Chicago! They have an extensive wine list and as the name implies you can order wine in sizes of 1/4 liter and up, which allows you to sample a variety of wines if you're there with a group rather than having to choose between a glass or a bottle. Their menu includes Italian tapas, thin crust pizzas, salads, pastas, and charcuterie, and everything is really good and fairly priced.  I also love the atmosphere here - servers wear European soccer jerseys and the tv's inside play old Italian movies and everyone appears to be having a good time. It's often very busy so I recommend making a reservation in advance, trying to grab a table outside or at the bar, or going at an off time. I recommend starting with a couple carafes of wine, the veal meatballs, and the goats milk ricotta and then go from there!

One of the fewer places that have late night kitchen hours in the vicinity we were in for the night....the food was amazing, the service was sub-par. Luckily the Manager, Derek, was attentive, understanding and very generous with his time to listen to our service concerns and took care of us.

Food is consistently good. Prices are pretty amazing for the area and the quality. Definitely get a reservation if you want to come on a weekend. Staff is always super accommodating and friendly. Only turn off is the bathroom attendants they have on busy night. Just completely unnecessary and I hate places that try to squeeze more money out of you. It's tacky. I don't need help washing my hands and I certainly shouldn't have to tip you because you're hoarding the paper towels and I have to get one from you. I understand these people need jobs but perhaps have them do something more useful.

Great organic choices, delicious food and not ridiculously expensive. It was so good, on our trip to Chicago we went twice so we could try more of the offerings. Really really nice atmosphere, great service, and to top it off, outrageously wonderful desserts.
I love this place. It is wonderful. I have eaten here upwards of 10 times over the past 4 years, and I have never had a bad experience.
Oh my goodness! Fantastic food! Great atmosphere! Wonderful customer service - Amanda was awesome! Highly recommend!

I love Italian food and this spot was a great choice for our last night in the city.  Their olive oil is amazing and truly organic. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo and my boyfriend ordered the penne vodka pasta. We demolished our plates. For dessert we ordered the Italian donuts. Wish we had more powdered sugar but so so so yummy!

After walking around trying to find this place, I came to the conclusion that Chicago is similar to New York City (in terms of weather) but with bipolar GPS navigation system.  Seeing the high reviews for this place, my friend and I just had to stop by. We ordered the Quattro Stagioni pizza ($15) and Burrata salad ($9.75). Our server was super attentive and came by often to check up on how we were doing.  The burrata salad came with burrata the size of my fist and beet salad. The burrata was so so so creamy and really paired well with the refreshing beets. Unfortunately, (fortunately for me, hehe) my friend is lactose so she only had a couple of bites and I had the honor of finishing the rest. The pizza was A M A Z I N G. I feel like you really can't go wrong with any of the choices. The one we got, all the veggies were fresh and cooked only so slightly to the point where it wasn't too mushy.  All in all, def a spot to check out if you're not feeling the deep dish!

This place has been a treat to go to for me every time I have family come into town visiting.  Everything just combines into a fantastic food/drink experience that combines good presentation with delicious food. Everything I've had on the menu is delicious.  From the homemade pastas to the in-house cured meats.  There is clearly hard work put into each dish.  I highly recommend the Tagliatelle a la Bolognese which provides a deliciously textured house-made noodle that is thick enough to hold a rich red sauce that is donned with a variety of meats, you will not be disappointed.  I have only had delicious things on the menu but usually cannot pass up the Bolognese.   The presentation of the dishes is sporadic and keeps your pace of eating at a moderate tempo.  Everything is brought out as it is completed in the kitchen so you can pace your meal to a unique food melody every time you go there.  Combine this with the tapas/family style approach where everything is shared and  you get a delicious well-rounded meal.   Finally, the Soccer Jersey clad service staff are always enthusiastic and knowledgeable of the diverse menu.  Almost every time I've been there a manager has come by asking how the experience is. Both are aspects of a restaurant I appreciate, and combined with the delectable and affordable culinary experience I can highly recommend this restaurant.

Been to this place twice, and PROBABLY will never be back again. Why 3 stars?  First time I went with my date, we ordered 2 pasta dishes, the tables are so small and the space is so tight, and when you are walking in and out of the restaurant it felt like you either need to lose 15 pounds or suck in your stomach 5 times to get through. We waited for a long time for the pastas to arrive, my pasta was way too watery and they got my dates' pasta sauce wrong (he wanted white sauce and got red instead). The price isnt bad for a river north restaurant but my first time experience was not very pleasant. Second time we came for a friend's birthday since one of my friends was working there at the time we got special discount for the amount of food we ordered the price was great, and service was obviously great since my friend was dining with us there. I enjoyed their calamari a lot but some of the pasta dishes did not really stand out. Probably wont come back now that she no longer works there... however, if you are looking for a reasonably priced Italian restaurant in river north, definitely give it a try.

This was the perfect place for our family of five. We have one dairy allergy in our group and two picky eaters. All of us loved our food and drinks. Kids liked the Italian blood orange soda. Our group had shrimp risotto, penne with vodka sauce, spaghetti pomodoro, calamari and fettuccine alfredo. Everything was served steaming hot and tasted great. Service was perfect. Prices were reasonable, too. We will be back on our next trip to Chicago.
We come here every year on our trip to Chicago. Food city scape and location can't be beat

Quartino has a good Rating with north of 3,500 total reviews for multiple good reasons. The food is delicious, the prices are reasonable for a go to restaurant in River North and the atmosphere is electric. Tell me someone who has a bad meal here and I will question all of their decision making. With the pitchers of wine, you know you are in for a good time. The classic Italian offerings and European soccer focused theme, Quartino delivers delicious Italian eats. The octopus, pastas, pizzas, chicken entrees are a handful of the better dishes and options on an ever plentiful amount of Italian options. The fish stew is also a special and superfluous seafood meal meal. The pizza and orchoetti pasta are both incredible too. Go to Quartinos with a little room because you are going to order and enjoy a lot of meals here.

Came here with a group of 10 and they placed us in our own little room, which was great for 10 loud girls, but not great for service. We ordered two large pints of the house wine, and ended up ordering two more about half way through our meal. We had both red and white, and for the cost, it was both delicious and cost effective. About half of the group ordered pizza and the other half entrees. One of the girls ordered salmon and received it about 10 minutes after we ordered. However, our pizza did not show up for about another 30 minutes. The pasta dishes did not show up for about 15 minutes after our pizza. It was really awkward because one of the people in the group  did not receive her food until almost everyone else in the group was finished, even though she had ordered the same dish as other individuals at our table. I ordered the Campania Pizza and really thought it was delicious. I really enjoyed the food, but I think the service just really lacked.
Terrible service. If you are looking for a mis-diagnosis, this is your spot. They will serve you exactly what you didn't order and tell you why you don't want what you ordered.

Shocked by how down hill this place has gone! Or perhaps it was a bit of an off night? I used to bring out of town guests regularly for solid food and ambience.. found none of this last night. Rushed, uninformed and absentee waitress. She promised to return with an item that was missing/wrong on our charcuterie board and simply never brought it.  They were out of 3/4 things I tried to order. Many of our orders were either completely wrong, bad tasting or took an hour. Quality of food seems to have decreased majorly. I echo what others have said, for Italian food in chicago there are much better places to go!!
Excellent on all. Only exception was our waiter forgot to tell us about the specials.  I love the Seafood Carbonara.
Haven't gotten my food but can barely hear myself think. Way too loud! If your looking for a relaxing meal with good conversation good luck if it's busy.

I heard excellent things about this restaurant, do I decided to go on a double date here. Our table was next to this obnoxious group of people who were clearly to drunk to behave appropriately. They almost hit me in my seat a few times. The waitress seemed annoyed and did not provide good service: the calamari was very tasty, so I give them that. The alfredo pasta I had tasted like Ragu sauce. I think they try to squeeze some many tables in this restaurant that they do not realize how uncomfortable it can be.  I would definitely go to another spot for Italian food than here. It was ok tasting but not what it is cracked up to be.
Beautiful restaurant, food almost home made and prices are normal. The variety is very helpful and the service very good.

Wow this place was terrible.  Food was bland, mistakes with our order, absentee and unhelpful waitress, our group of 4 received our entrees at a variety of times spanning 40 minutes.  The ambiance was terrible, busy, loud, disorganized staff.

I am baffled at the vast number of high reviews for Quartino's. Want good Italian? You won't find it here. This place is a tourist trap. Chicago is home to so many great restaurants and is one of the top cities known for having great food, I mean, it IS the third largest city. So do yourself a favor - check out any restaurant other than Quartino's.  The restaurant itself is rather large. It is two stories and has tables indoors and outdoors on both floors. They pack in as many tables as possible so you will find that you are sitting very close to strangers. It is very loud inside - better luck dining outside where you can actually hear yourself think. Anytime I asked the waiter about a dish he would say "oh I love it, it's amazing." Yeah, lies. The bread SUCKS - don't even bother. Yeah, it's free and "free food is the best food" blah blah blah, but Quartino's bread is some of the worst food I've had. Quartino's states all their plates are meant for sharing. Hmm...okay. If we are meant to share the pastas...why are the pasta dishes so small? The size of one pasta dish here would satisfy your hunger but not fill you up. Their house-made pasta, the tagliatelle all bolognese, was awful. The texture of the pasta was just all sorts of wrong. The flavor of the meat sauce was no bueno. Think salty cardboard. How ironic that their imported pasta dish, the linguine with clams, was better than their house-made...but only barely. The flavor of the white sauce was decent and the red chili gave it a good kick but the flavors did not seep into the linguine at all. There were plenty of clams but were they fresh? Highly doubtful. The crisp calamari was expensive and average. I was really not impressed and extremely disappointed I wasted a meal at Quartino's during my 5-day trip to Chicago. Save your money, folks.

After visiting for the fourth time in the course of 3 years, I realized I had to write a review of this amazing establishment. Working as a chef and also as a server in the past, I have a passion for delicious food, a delightful atmosphere as well as excellent service- Quartino in Chicago delivered on all three! The ambiance makes you feel as if you just stepped into Italy- with meats and cheeses hanging from the ceiling, wooden floor boards and vintage collectibles arranged throughout that were delivered straight from Italy, the decor enhances your experience to no end. The service is delightful, friendly and knowledgeable and the management (thanks Brenden!) is absolutely top-notch in hospitality, friendliness and professionalism. With a menu filled with wonderfully authentic Italian fare, your choices are endless and aim to please any type in the crowd. Meats, cheeses, olives, antipastis, salads, pizzas, pastas, entrees... it's perfect. I'm in love, Quartino. Thank you!

Incredible Italian food. The pasta is so dense and the sauce is so creamy and wonderful.  I had the fettuccini Alfredo and I wish I could bathe in it. The lunch portion was a little small, but they give you a side of bread. Highly recommend. Great quality.

Everything was okay. We had a large party so we had a bit of everything on the menu. We had to wait for over 30 minutes for our reservation. The food is all a little bland and would not be where I would be spending my money on Italian food in Chicago. However, it is a good value for large groups.

The place has a nice Italian feel. A good ambience and decent quality food. The staff is welcoming and friendly. Some of the dishes are really good and others decent. They have a good selection of wine. Go for the ambience, wine, food is good(can be better)

First off, this place is way bigger than I had expected. 2 stories with tons of seating and even has some special event space on the 2nd level. We made reservations for 5 o'clock and it wasn't that busy yet but when we left at 630 pm it was filling up quick so make reservations!  Food: They serve as soon as the food is ready so your dishes come out at different times which I personally liked since I was starving. We got the margherita pizza, tortellini with prosciutto, parppadelle al sugo, and truffle salame. Pizza was decent - thin crust and good balance of cheese and sauce. Tortellini was good but didn't amaze me. I will say the prosciutto was good and normally I don't like prosciutto. But the tortellini itself was lacking in flavor for me. Parppadelle was also pretty good although the meat was a bit salty to me. And lastly, the truffle salame was good from what my boyfriend said - not a salami person so I didn't try it! Service: Very fast which is surprising for how big and busy the place is. The server also was good about checking in but not so often to be disruptive. Overall: Enjoyable dining experience and would definitely return. I personally like Balena a little bit more for the taste but I thought prices and ambiance here were better. Very reasonable prices for the dishes ($10-13) and a great location in the heart of the city.

Came here on restaurant week so we had a four course meal for $44 that left the two of us stuffed. Quartino is super popular but they take reservations. The inside is incredibly spacious and it was packed when we went on a Thursday night. Since there are so many people in one room, it was loud. Quartino offers a large menu that is great for vegetarians and it is also on the less expensive side. They have a large selection of pasta, soups, and seafood options. We started off with the polpette, which are veal meatballs in tomato sauce with fresh basil and ricotta on top. This was absolutely delicious and I cannot say good enough things except that you have to get this. The sauce was incredibly flavorful and the meatballs were soft and fluffy. Everything was perfectly seasoned and I found myself taking spoonfuls of the sauce because it was that good.  Next we had the tortellini, which was my least favorite dish. It came with peas, alfredo sauce, and prosciutto. I'm not a fan of alfredo sauce, so that could be why I wasn't a fan. The brodetto al frutti di mare was this giant dish with shrimp, clams, calamari, octopus and whitefish. It was similar to a soup with a rich tomato broth. Wasn't what I expected but I enjoyed it nevertheless. My favorite dish was dessert. They also have a large dessert menu so it was hard to pick just one. We ended up with the zeppole, which are hot Italian donuts. I was so surprised when they arrived because the plate was filled with donuts. Each one was perfectly light and fluffy. They came with honey and dark chocolate, which both complimented the donut so well.  With reasonable prices and so many dishes that it's hard to go wrong, I will definitely be back at Quartino!

Despite being on the busy State Street in the busy modern downtown of Chicago, Quartino Ristorante feels like a piece of Italy that has been imported from overseas! Even out in the outdoors street side patio with cars passing by, sitting there certainly reminds of my time at the quaint, slow living Rome thanks to the decor with very details (down to even the salt and pepper) that were obviously meticulously chosen to deliver the most authentic Italian experience in the midst of a bustling American city. The vibe alone was enough to win me over. One thing I found strange though was that all the waiting staff wore football jerseys (soccer in America) when no restaurant I went in Italy did that, but oh well. Anyway, more importantly, the food here is great as well and definitely adds to the Italian experience! Although slightly smaller than expected, my choice of risotto was on point with the taste and the texture. The rice was simmered well that it struck the perfect balance between soft and firm, and the creamy sauce was also perfection in delivering flavors to augment the rice without being overwhelming. You can definitely taste the high-quality ingredients that this restaurant uses! On the side note, I also love the olive oil that they use to accompany complimentary bread because of its nutty undertone. Okay, enough with the tangent! The prices are reasonable compared to other Italian restaurants (about $20 per person for entree and dessert), but the experience is well worth it. Despite of its high-quality food and well-decor environment, the restaurant is super casual so you won't have the pressure of fine dining. If you are seeking an excellent Italian meal with great vibe and good food in downtown Chicago, go to Quartino!

OMG, order as many cicchettis, formaggis, salumis, spontinis as your budget allows - you can only go awesome here. The tapa style dishes are very good tasting and absolutely worth the try. For the more familiar ones: carpaccio, prosciutto, cotton, mortadella, fontina Val d'Aosta, pecirinos, artichokes, ... and then a pizza, veal, clams, beef filets. We're about to embark on the dolce: zeppole, profiteroles, ...  Service is very friendly and attentive. Seating is two floors with the 2nd floor for dining and first floor more of a tapas bar ambience. On the 2nd floor is an outside seating area on a first come first serve basis. Otherwise you can get reservations.
absolutely the best food!! and staff where so fun and friendly !!!wish you where in north carolina
I love this place. Try the fondue and be sure to add apples. So far we've tried the ravioli, the fettuccine, and several pizzas. They were all great! Try this place out

Took girlfriend and her parents here for their visit from California. The food was great from top to bottom. The best was the knife cut sausage. It tasted like the true Italian sausage that I ate at my grandmother's house growing up. One of the nicest parts was the food coming out staggered. It makes sharing easier and is definitely necessary with the limited table space. All the servers were nice and always willing to take an empty plate away.

This was one of the only restaurants open super late night after my coworkers and I got off work-so we decided to stop by based on the Yelp reviews. The menu is surprisingly diverse and great Italian food open late night in the middle of Chicago amongst all of the people going out in a popular area. I was happy with the food and I was very happy that it was fresh late-night, you could tell my vegetables had just been grilled and it was very tasty.  The service was great and the price points were deserving. I ordered the lemon curd desert based on the yelp reviews and it was pretty good. Def shareable !

Went here for a friends' 20th birthday and only had to wait 10 minutes to be sat at our table that we had made a reservation for. It's a very crowded place, but we weren't bothered by that and it was still easy to hold conversation. The service was very good considering how busy it was and our waitress was attentive. They started us with some bread which was nothing special just a baguette, but it was enough to snack on. We ordered the pear and baby spinach salad to start with the fried calamari, both were very good. The portions are small so they recommend about 2 per person. There were 4 of us and we all ordered one entree and an extra to share. It was enough for us and we all ate a little from each plate. The prices aren't bad and the food was all very good!

We arrived at this restaurant around 11:30pm for a late dinner on a Saturday night and got seated right away for a party of 2.  We ordered the San Daniele pizza and it was pretty good. It was a thin crust pizza and came with a lot of the toppings. I liked it because it wasn't too greasy/heavy and was more on the healthier side. The other dish we got was the linguine pasta with clams. The pasta noodles didn't seem fully cooked, but we didn't feel like waiting for them to remake it. The clams, on the other hand, were SO GOOD. It had flavor to it and it was very soft and easy to eat. They also put a lot of clams in it, which was a big plus! Overall, the restaurant has a nice ambience and perfect for those who want a late night bite since they are open until 2am. 4 stars because of those clams, but if the noodles were more cooked- it would have been perfect!

This place is my fav.  The food is great. I'd start with the salumi/cheese starters, all their pasta is great, dessert is awesome. White wine sangria on point. It's super reasonably priced, and very casual and low stress for how awesome the food is. Highly recommended, especially for lunch or early dinner.

I've been staying at the connected Embassy Suites hotel for the last two nights.  The days have been so long (work) that I've opted to eat at the bar both nights.  The first night the bar was very slow and the bartender took care of me, but he was extremely slow!  Sincerely a very nice man, but he didn't do anything quickly and a couple of us waited for service.  The food on night one was good and the drink I ordered was $13. Now, on to the second night, again the same gentleman was working the bar.  Yet again he was very pleasant and friendly, but extremely slow.  I ordered the exact same drink as I did last night, but tonight the drink was $26.  The food was also very tasty tonight, but I didn't get my bread and oil/garlic until after the meal was presented. For a hotel bar/restaurant this place is top shelf, but the bar is a bit lower for me than a regular restaurant.  Food is good....drinks are overpriced (but it's Chicago) and non-consistent!

The place is seriously so crowded all the time because the food is too notch for not being ridiculously expensive.  We came for dinner Friday night and it was completely packed. They did some finagling but they were able to put two round tables together for our party of seven around 7 PM. The eggplant parm is just amazing. I've come here once before and it wasn't that great but maybe that was a fluke because today it was exceptional. The eggplant was perfectly cooked. I couldn't stop eating it. I was supposedly sharing it with my friend but I ended up eating most of it. Sorry not sorrrry.

Fast service and great location but I would not come here solely for the pizza because it is not anything special. Vibes were good here. Bruschetta and chicken soup was fantastic. Can see sports on tv here.

I have struck it rich again! I love it that the portions are not huge because we are in a hotel  And cannot heat leftovers. We adored the food here in Chicago. This was one of the best experiences yet!  Homemade pasta, pork shanks, pure  deliciousness. . Chicago, I'll be back to eat!!!!!

What a disappointment.  First I am confused why if I have a reservation it does not count for outside seating.  At arrival I wanted to sit outside and had to check in separately outside, and was placed on a waiting list behind people that had no reservation. Is this the same restaurant. Food was really bad.  The fondue of "5 artisinal cheeses" was so watered down it was more like flavored milk than fondue.  The figs happened to be good,.  Then the Gnocchi was beyond disappointing.  Tasteless and dense.  Octopus was a plate of small tentacles that were tough and had a chemical taste.  This dish was inedible and had to be sent back. Perhaps some people are enamored by the chipped plates, old glassware that need to be replaced and overpriced, small, and poorly tasting food, but with so many other options in the area I can't understand how Quartino draws such crowds.  The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because our server was very good.

Hidden Chicago gem.  Not really hidden, but you may not have heard of it.  Quartino's is a really nice Italian style restaurant perfectly situated in near Michigan Ave near the hotels and restaurants. Great place to have dinner or sit out on the patio for drinks.  We had a wedding today at Quartino's and they did an excellent job with everything.  They were willing to put in extra time and effort to help set everything up, as well as pack everything up when it was over. Servers were on-top of everything, ensuring to stop by frequently to every table.  Glasses were always filled, and the food was delicious. You have to try Quartino's if you're in Chicago.

One of the best restaurants in the city, hands down! Everything we had when we visited about two months ago was simply delicious from the pizza to the handmade pasta we both ordered and even to the blood orange sorbet. I have been dying to come back, especially in the beautiful weather we have been experiencing. I live all of the way in the Northwest suburbs and I have needed to stop myself from making a special trip into the city just for their pizza and some pasta to take back home. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone! We will definitely be back very soon! Thank you for having us and giving us an amazing experience with food and the service!

Great food and the service is always quick. The small plates is great because you can try a bunch of stuff. We got pepperoni pizza, linguini alfredo, shrimp risotto, veal meatballs and Brussels sprouts. All sooo good. The espresso martini was amazing too.  It is kind of loud inside so go if you are looking for a more rambunctious atmosphere.

Food was great, service was a joke. 11 of us on a Friday night is tough but 2.5 hours to have a meal is crazy. If our server is also working a private event, get us another server. Random food showed up to our table multiple times, it was great food, but we had to ask for everything. Took 20 minutes to get our first round of drinks, and it was down hill from there. After the last plate that we didn't order came, he told us he would box it for us and take it off the bill.  20 minutes for desserts, and then our server who was apparently too busy, never came back. $400 bill and he didn't even say good bye. At least a manager could have ran our check for us. Just a mess, again, great food but he got a 20% tip he didn't earn tonight.
I love this place. The food is always good and the service is perfect. One of my favorites restaurants in Chicago
They were the only restaurant open on a Sunday night around 10 pm so major props  The veggie pizza, Eggplant parm and tortellini were all delicious and very affordable  Server was pleasant and kind

There are so many good restaurants in Chicago, and this is not one of them. Terrible food, terrible service, and a chaotic atmosphere led to an awful experience. I would highly recommend avoiding this place, especially if you are in a large group or if you value a clean environment.

Quartino is located in River North and a great option for a fun night out on the town. I would recommend this for a spot to check out with family or friends if you are in the mood for small plates. I had the burrata beet salad and tomato basil soup. It was amazing! The food was delicious but the service a little slow!

Quartino offers a full range of high quality Italian food and prices which are reasonable for the quality you are receiving.  This is what one would expect from a restaurant in the Gibson's family.  The service is always prompt and courteous, and the food speaks for itself.  Eating at the bar is always fun as the bartenders never fail to be friendly and very willing to offer up suggestions on what to eat, or for drinks.

We really enjoyed Quartino for lunch! They had so many gluten friendly options. Not to mention super authentic Italian food! Everything from the menu to the champagne was absolutely amazing! We will be back!

I went here for a late lunch with my dad mid week. It was quiet, but the wait staff was just as attentive and friendly as if it were a Friday night. The menu items are made to share, so we order the calamari, the gnocchi and the beef short rib. We also got the Italian donuts for dessert, which is basically fried dough. The calamari was great, lightly fried and very tasty. The gnocchi was okay, but too salty for my taste. I would have liked the gnocchi in a different sauce. It came in a pesto sauce that was just so salty. The short rib was delicious. It was cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor.  Next time, I would get a pizza, the calamari and the short rib, but skip on the gnocchi. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful!
This is hands down my favorite Italian food in Chicago. The place is always busy. The bar is always packed. The food is always good. You will not leave there disappointed

Ate here with a very large group, and Quartino pulled it off like a champ.  Food came out at a rapid pace despite the fact the restaurant had every single table full.  Our server was knowledgeable and helpful and took care of us expeditiously.  Very well done! The group shared so many plates.  We had the charcuterie, fried calamari, tortellini, meatballs, brussel sprouts, shrimp, ravioli.  Probably even more than that, but I couldn't bring myself to eat it all.  Everything was good, especially the tortellini.  The sprouts needed more flavor, but I was fine passing it off to someone else in favor of the next plate that got passed around. I did have a minestrone soup that I did not share, and it was delicious!  I wanted to eat the whole bowl of it, but had to somehow save room for dessert.  Chose the blood orange sorbet for something nice and refreshing - and it was! Overall, a great choice for the group. It was pretty chaotic and noisy in there, but we never lacked for anything.

I don't know why there is one bad review about this restaurant. I have been coming here for 9 years and the food is wonderful. It is always crowded so I recommend a reservation, I think the crowd says something about how great it is. The ambiance gives you a feel of what it's like to be in a crazy loud  authentic Italian household with mismatched silverware, and proper glasses to drink wine and beer out of. Highly recommend the veal meatballs, penne alla vodka, and the meat and cheese board which is a really decent size. The means and cheese are so fresh as well! Profiteroles are the best way to go with dessert! Highly recommend

Came here on a Saturday night and the place was packed! The bar always had a few open seats so I would highly recommend heading there if you're with a small group and everyone's over 21. We were visiting from Seattle and if we're ever in Chicago again, we'd be back for sure!  Fast service, all the servers were so nice and helpful. Food comes out as it's ready and they're decent portions especially when you're drinking. We had a bottle of wine, rigatoni, bruschetta and sausage risotto - so flavorful and true Italian food! We had these donut pastry things (forget the name) with Nutella and honey on the side for dessert, so yummy would definitely recommend.

Its good! We usually go there for group settings as its wonderful in accommodating Spain's dishes at its best. Its loud, always packed. Make a reservation on weekends unless you will come after 10:30 because yes they open late.

Been here twice and it's just ok. Not sure why they are always crazy busy. There's nothing special about it. Been here twice. The first time because people have told me it was so good and their favorite Italian place. I was not impressed. There's nothing special about it and the pasta was like a downgrade of Barilla that you can get at the store or something. The second time for a birthday dinner with the girls. Again, not impressed. Just ok. The red sauce was pretty good. They just need to work on their pasta and some of their servers. Most of them were very good, but there was this one girl who ruined it for the rest of the team who were pleasant and worked hard. She was super bitchy. Granted we were a group of 6 girls. With any larger party, it could be chaotic. But as a server, have at least some sort of game face. It's your job! Have a better attitude or maybe find a new profession! Lose the stink face!

Loved loved loved this place.  This was a date night for my husband and I. Score heading to a friend's birthday party. Although the restaurant was sooo busy, we were accommodated really well, a small table for two by the bar in the back for privacy, attentive staff and served as well.  My husband and I are vegetarian so the server was very patient and accommodating to our requests. Just added cherry on the top to our date night.  Would definitely return if ever in the city with Italian food mood.
It's a really nice Italian restaurant. The bread just so soft. Everything we ordered just so yummy.

I truly don't understand who all of these people are writing these great reviews...the food is AWFUL. People, if you have any bit of respect for Italian food you will not go here. Trust me on this. All of the pasta dishes taste like nothing except pure salt. Disgusting. And with a group of 10 of us, we were able to try it all. Pizza- bland and basic. Pasta- Cavatelli, Gnochi (worst dish of the night), Vodka Sauce, Eggplant...all way too salty. The mushroom risotto that the waitress said was the "best thing on the menu" was pretty much inedible due to salt content. And we even had to send the fruit back that they gave us with the fondue because it was old ("fresh" apples were brown and SOAKED in lemon juice). All ten of us walked out of there hungry and extremely disappointed.  Before we event went, my friend warned us that this place was nasty. The last time she had been there, she found plastic wrap in her calamari. Instead of management comping the calamari off the bill, they gave her a free shot...wtf? Absolutely bizarre.  We went against her advice as it was my other friend's birthday and she really wanted to go there because she heard "great things" on Yelp.  I use Yelp a lot, and generally trust the high reviews I see. I have only been lead astray by Yelp a few times, and this was sadly one of them. If you want great Italian in the River North area, try Sienna Tavern, RPM Italian, or il Porcellino. Even Eataly!! All so much better than this place.

We came with a business group of 8, that's always a hard number for both everyone loving the meal and conversational flow. Star--right off the bat for service!  I loved our waiter! He explained everything even more so because it's a unique experience.  Our group was so large that we received one dish at a time (so nothing was served cold). If this style of eating bothers you, do not come here, in fact go to shake shake and fill up and don't go to anything great! Star for the veal meatballs!  They are really good.  I wasn't overwhelmed by the pasta as the dough had a whole wheat texture.  I've made better at my home. I could give five stars for desserts alone!! By far the best desserts I've ever had in a fancy restaurant!  We had the doughnuts, chocolate cake, tiramisu and cannoli. Outstanding!!!!! Biggest downer by far is again the noise level.  If you love shouting for everything, then please come here but again, Chicago restaurant owners have got to address the noise levels in those places!

I've been coming here consistently for the past 6 years and I will continue to keep coming. The prices are reasonable The service is amazing The drinks are exceptional The pappardelle is to die for The place is open late The employees make you feel special Go and thank me later!

Amazing place. Italian food of all kinds, most plates are for sharing. The cavatelli & veal meatballs are delicious, as is everything else there! Great wine at affordable prices (and available in all different sizes - you're not stuck with a bottle, nor do you have to buy by the glass). I've never been disappointed!

The food: 3/4. I tried a caprese salad and a charred octopus. The salad was fine, it could use more balsamic, but octopus was a little disappointing. The serving was not very generous and the greens it came with were overcooked and tasteless. My friend tired eggplant parm and said it was too mushy. I didn't like that you couldn't order just one glass of wine and their smallest serving was almost two glasses.  The service: 3/5. Fast but not very personable.  Overall: 3/5. Decent for tourist packed River North, but pretty meh for Chicago overall.
Service was good but food was ok. Some dishes were way too salty. You can find better in Chicago.

The drinks were wonderful, service was good.  The food, well, I guess it would be okay if you like your food swimming in so much oil and butter that you can't taste any other flavors but those two.  Also, everything needed salt, and I never need to add salt to things.  If you are a foodie, save your money and go somewhere else with flavors.  Oh, and the small dinner plates in the stack at the table were all dirty.

So as a whole this place is pretty wack. It tastes like chain food. Had the octopus and it was rubbery. Had the broccoli rabe and it was coated in butter. No go. The calamari was tasty.  Though the waiters all though differently about how the batter was applied. It's soaked in whole milk and then breaded. The olives were good and the bread freshly cut. But the Brussels salad is rough. Like large leaves. Little sauce. Rough. The customer service from the managers when I sent the octopus back was good. So they get a few stars for that. But otherwise.  Not worth ya money.

I came here with a group of 7 on a Friday night and was impressed at the decent service and food. We had a reservation and I think that was a good thing, since it was super crowded (and on the loud side). We were warned that the pizzas would take half an hour, but it didn't seem like it took 30 minutes before they came out. Here's what we ate:  - House made goats milk ricotta: really creamy and easily spread, I would definitely recommend this appetizer  - Gnocchi: the texture was okay, not as bouncy as I was expecting, the flavor was kind of lacking  - Stracci di grano arso: broccoli rabe (my favorite part of this dish), tomatoes, onions, garlic and large strips/sheets of flat pasta that I wasn't a huge fan of  - Margherita pizza: mozzarella, tomato sauce, and a basil leaf on top, it was pretty basic with a nice crispy thin crust  - Quattro stagioni pizza: artichokes, roasted peppers, grilled zucchini, portobello mushroom, I could eat this pizza all day! My favorite dish that we had here. I did have to eat it with a fork and knife probably because the ingredients  weighed heavily on the pizza and made it wet and harder to hold its shape, but it was very delicious  I liked that there were containers of water at our table so we didn't need to flag down our server, but when we needed him, it didn't take long, even though it was busy. Overall, I had a good meal here!

To start off, I'm extremely disappointed. I walked in to a group of 40 people waiting to be seated thinking that this place was going to be incredible solely based off the crowd. I've had some of the best food in Chicago while traveling the country so my expectations were high. We decided to sit at the seats by the bar... a regular high top. For an appetizer we got the goat cheese ricotta cheese, which was fine. Not the best I've had, but ok. We split 2 of their "homemade" pastas, lamb rigatoni and pappardelle bolognese, both honestly tasted like a mixture of whole wheat pasta and cardboard. If this is "homemade," please give me De Cecco brand every time. I won't be going back... If you want Italian food go to RPM Italian.

HANDS DOWN THE BEST RESTAURANT ITALIAN I HAVE EVER HAD! I grew up with a Nonna and several Aunts who always made the BEST home made Italian from scratch. This restaurant is the closest I have ever tasted to any of their cooking.  They suggest ordering an assortment of plates to share around the table because the portions are "small", but I honestly thought they were the perfect size if paired with a salad or soup! I went with my parents and we ordered 3 dishes (1 per person) along with 1 soup and 1 salad and it was almost the perfect amount. We had a small amount of left overs to take home which were still just as delicious the next day.  They are open super late which is also really nice, so its a great option for a late evening. The service was also amazing as they provided team service (they each helped with each others tables) and we never went without empty glasses.  Over all this was one of the BEST dining experiences I have ever had in Chicago! Highly suggest!

Seafood Brodetto was very good. Perfect amount of spice. Service was stellar. They corked my wine so I could take it back to the hotel. I would love to come back and try the house made pasta. Sorbet for dessert was just the right amount.

it's good for what it is.  Dishes are tasty.  Service can be very spotty.  It's solid average food.  No all star plates, but when you just want something to hit the spot, it does the trick.  Lines can get tremendously long. If this place weren't so central to offices, hotels, subway, it would never get these lines.  Put it in a neighborhood where you'd have to travel to it and it would close within a year.  So it hits the spot for the volume of people near State/Ontario.  So when I go, it's because of convenience, but I'm never wowed by the food.  Sometimes you don't need to be wowed.  So it's as yelp says:  A-OK.
Service was great! Wonderful wine list. The pasta was homemade and outstanding, but the sauce was less than I expected. Gelato was yummy. Definitely would return.

First regarding the food- there are lot of options for vegetarians. The food plates are right sized. The outdoor seating area is very comfortable and desirable. The reason for low rating is the service. There was no one to attend us for first 10 minutes. Once the drinks ordered was taken no one for next 10. The place was not packed when we visited. The waiter gave an expression that he didn't wanted to serve.  Will return for food with lower expectations of customer service

Went again and didn't disappoint. The spaghetti with meatballs was phenomenal. And the tortellini....forget about it (as in order it it's amazing). Sat outside with a bottle of wine what more could you ask for. Will be coming back again and again.

Sadly, we moved nearby over a year ago and always thought that we'd never get in as the place always seemed packed.  We did try once and turned around.  Not to be completely deterred, we recently decided to try once again with a reservation.  Brilliant idea, I know. Anyway, we ended up grabbing a seat at the upstairs bar on the way to our table where we were greeted by Chris who was tending bar.  Not being up on our Italian cuisine, we asked Chris to help get us started with some meats and cheeses.  He did a wonderful job of helping us decide what we'd like to try as he served up some very tasty red wine Sangria.  In the end, he delivered a wonderful plate that we really enjoyed.  The duck prosciutto was to die for.  Everything on the plate hit a spot for us.  The Gorgonzola Dolce, the Asiago Vecchio was soooo good! We ended up wanting to try one of everything, but settled on a fennel sausage pizza.  It was delicious!  Still wanting to keep going, we ordered the Tortellini and the Rigatoni.  The Tortellini was covered in a great Alfredo sauce with peas and sat on a bed of Prosciutto.  I'm pretty sure that we would have licked the plate dry if the room was empty.  Our Rigatoni (with lamb) was equally delicious.   What really stuck a chord with us was when a manager (Michael) made his was over to say hello and ask how everything tasted.  Classy move.  We then noticed that they have a few managers who are constantly checking in with customers.  Then another gentleman walked over and introduced himself to us and to see how we liked everything.  Turns out it was Executive Chef John Coletta.  Who does that?  Clearly, it's people who are passionate about what they do day in and day out.   Do yourself a favor and make it a point to visit them.
We all enjoyed this place.  It is great if you go in a group.  A bit loud.  Service is good.

It was good. Tasty and pleasant but nothing out of this world. The vodka pasta sauce is not the best I've had. While the caprece salad did taste yummy and fresh. The pizza was okay as well. I liked the cheeses they use.

Super fun dining experience. Great for groups. Highly recommend making a reservation. Plates are meant to be shared, so they are smaller. Also, for a nice restaurant, the prices are extremely reasonable. You can go with friends, try tons of dishes, be super full, and not break the bank. The wine is also delish and reasonably priced. I recommend trying the chocolate fondue for dessert.
Gnocchi flavor is lacking but texture is good.   Cavatelli is much much tastier and awesome texture.  Also the Stracci was tasty!
Really nice Italian food with great service and friendly staff. Ambience is a bit loud.

Place was crowded, service was good, very noisy as close tables. Many large parties. One of our dishes got lost in the shuffle of orders in the kitchen but we were in no rush. Food was ok not outstanding, but the tiramisu was the best. We had a nice time anyway.
Worth a second try. Menu was decent. Service was not bad. Massive place, good wine options, not too pricy and the location is good.

The staff and food are excellent. We sat at the bar having delicious cocktails - especially the expresso martini! We also had carpaccio, polenta sticks and house made ricotta that we enjoyed very much. The bar and restaurant are lively and the interaction with all the staff enhanced our experience a lot.

Great reviews, but we definitely did not find the place as amazing as stated.  Came into town for the day. Ate and upon leaving a few hours later the children were feeling ill and now the adults. Called to let the manager Derek know. Derek was insistent that food poisoning takes 24 hours to set in and he inquired as to what we ate yesterday. I did not want to be argumentative with the manager who had all the "right answers."
