When in doubt YELP it out and GOOGLE food poisoning which MedPub, Medline and Wiki all state two to six hours onset of symptoms. Photo is attached.

Good food, service, nice place. Casual, small plates to share. Veal meatballs for appetizer, great taste perfect for sharing. Fresh basil. Had Tuscan sausage risotto for entree, it was great. Bottle of wine followed by cappuccino, nice casual dinner.
Amazing night on the balcony . The food was a amazing and the service was top notch. Can't wait to go back.

We had a dinner here with 18 friends and we tried a lot from the menu. Everything was great! All the deserts and appetizers were especially delicious. Among the desserts I liked Torta al Cioccolato the most (chocolate cake with gelato). Salumeria Tasting is a great way to try different appetizers. I'm not a wine lover, but Bianco was good. Pizza was fine, especially the one with duck. Waiters were very nice and professional. The only thing I didn't like here is the fact that we had to wait until the majority of our group came to finally get to our table.
This is one of our go to places when family visits Chicago! Italian tapas that are tasty and fresh. During the day it's a great kid friendly environment.
Great tapas place. Food was great , as a pizza fan I really enjoyed their crust. Octopus was really good. Service could be a bit more attentive. All in all a very nice place to grab dinner.
The bread was really cold and doesn't taste good, but the main dish was alright. Their dishes only serve one person,, and if you eat an Italian way, make sure to get another side.

This review is very belated... I came here with my college girlfriends (about 9 of us) around a year ago. It was the perfect place to share plates and consume massive amounts of wine! The food was pretty good. Service was not the best. The restaurant is super tight inside so getting around is tough, which might somewhat explain why our server wasn't very timely. Ultimately it was a great spot for a girl's night out.

This place was hoping on a Wednesday night, reservations were not hard to get three hours before. I noticed a lot of collared and button up shirts, just not on the service staff! Who all seemed to be wearing Soccer jerseys and their back servers we wearing kitchen whites. Our server was Lauren, and this review is because Lauren earned the review for this Resturant. Attentive, great to help with our choices, informative, and friendly. I ordered an Esspreso Martini, which I absolutely suggest everyone try, even with the 9 pm hour approaching I joked with Lauren I shouldn't have another, she offered to make me a decaf, in which we both laughed and I said, no i'll have it the same way please. My girlfriend ordered the Bellini and really enjoyed hers as well.  We also had the Salumeria Tastings, which was surprisingly not finished between our table of four. I ordered the Tagliatelle alla Bolognes from their house made pasta section of the menu, and enjoyed every single bite of it!  My girlfriend ordered the Pappardelle, which I was offered a bite of, and after she mentioned it, I then agreed we both thought it may have had a pinch to much salt. This was our second visit to this restaurant, and will return if we are in the area again.

I can't figure out why this place has so many stars - it was quite possibly one of the worst restaurants I've ever tried. The service was fine, our waitress was nice. We were able to get a table despite not having a reservation on a Sunday evening, even if it was all the way in the back of the restaurant. We had read all the reviews and were stoked to try this place as many people said the food was good. We started out by ordering a couple small plates - ordered the mushroom risotto, garlic shrimp, and a salad. The mushroom risotto was undercooked, the garlic shrimp was not like traditional garlic shrimp( I wish I could describe the shrimp dish but there are no words, also didn't help that they used tiny little frozen shrimp instead of fresh real shrimp), and the salad was overly doused in dressing. We let our waitress know we just couldn't bare to eat any of it. She was nice about it at least and offered to recook the risotto and offered to switch out our food for something else. We thought we couldn't go wrong with a pizza and selected one to share off the menu. While the pizza was edible, it was certainly far from being anything like a real Italian pizza.  We honestly couldn't take being there anymore and let our waitress know we just had to leave. We paid for our wine and the pizza and left. I will NEVER come back. Not sure what standards other people have for Italian restaurants, but this certainly was far from living up to any good Italian restaurants I've been to.

I had heard a lot about this place before I had visited and arrived with high expectations. We quickly found a small table in the middle of the room. Quite a lovely place, old Italian styling, and a slightly loud ambiance. We ordered the Gnocchi which is very famous here and found it to be great, a must-have item. Then ordered the spinach pasta (I forget what it's called) which was slightly undercooked but the maitre d'hotel prepared another plate quickly and it was great.  I will visit once again to try more traditional Italian fare such as the pasta and pizza and update my review.

I just ordered food to go. The short ribs are amazing!!  Also tried a rigatoni with lamb dish, it was outstanding. Staff was friendly and helpful. This place has a great vibe. I wish I would have been able to stay and dine in. Affordable parking right across the street. They also valet for like 15$. I will absolutely be going back.

The menu is great, and the staff is well versed in the food and drinks. I've been with large and small groups, but actually prefer larger groups because of the space. They really pack people in, which is really annoying because there's hardly enough space to get up. But if you're in a large group there seems to be a little more space. The staff also sometimes seems to be going through the motions, likely because they have so many tables at a time.

This place was packed when my date and I got here, and very loud as a consequence. It would be understandable if it was just busy, but every table is practically placed a foot apart. Frequently during dinner I ended up back to back with the person at the table behind me if I leaned back at all. It felt like a high school cafeteria with the noise level. My date's chair had an actual puddle of water in it when we sat down. To make up for it, the waitress comped our first round of drinks, which was great - she was a sweetheart and seemed to be trying her best with all the people. She had to step out of the way while taking our order multiple times because of how little room there was for people with plates to get past. The food itself was alright. Not amazing, not horrible.  So much could be improved, but nothing that could have been fixed immediately. They did end up taking $54 off of our check (we ordered drinks and three small plates), I think they saw how unhappy we were with everything. So I'm grateful for that.

Oh my god, the food is amazing. I don't even remember what I ordered but me and my friends ordered a bunch of plates and all the plates tasted really good. If you're looking for a restaurant open late which is hard to find if it's passed ten this is a place to go to. They open late. I wanted the whole menu. I'm pretty sure everything was amazing. We ordered some pasta and had them throw in some stuff it didn't taste too well because my friends totally changed everything and told them to throw in some different stuff they effed up and should have never done that and just ordered everything with the set ingredients. Well anyways, didn't taste good, the waiter asked how it was and I vocally said well it didn't taste that well, but we ate it anyways like all of it. He asked should I remake it better and we said no we are it already. He came back with the check and said he took it off the tab. That was really nice of him. If you order the Italian soda order the blood orange... it's really good. Try the veal meatball sliders they are amazing and super cheap like three dollars for three huge sliders. There was no wait, we didn't make reservations we walked and and they sat us right away it was like 10 at night. It's a really huge restaurant. Some of the best Italian foods, must try!!!!!

Omg where do I start. This place is amazing. Probably some of the best Italian food I've ever had.  It's always super busy so make a reservation to make your life easier. That being said, it's a little cramped and very loud so sit outside if it's nice out and you're on a date.  I had the rigatoni. Our waiter said it was his favorite and I agreed that it was my new favorite too. The sauce was so good and the pasta was perfectly al dente. We had the bruschetta for an appetizer and it was so delicious. I tried some of my friends eggplant parm and I would definitely order that next time.  Service was great, food was great. Eat here.
Absolutely exceptional customer service! Amazing food. Fabulous service. If you're in the area Quartino is a must.
Delicious food and tapas at a very reasonable price. Highly recommend for dinner with friends. The service was prompt & attentive too.

This place is about as overrated as it gets. The food was not cooked well, our pasta needed 3-4 more in the water. To top it off the flavor was very bland.  Their old fashions are $16.50 and not worth $8... I've gone to plenty of steakhouses in Chicago with much better and cheaper old fashions (Boka, RPM, Bavette's)  Honestly the best part of the meal was our server who was awesome, but the food lacked flavor or identity and was overpriced to top it off. Do not waste your time

My friends and I had come from out of town to celebrate some birthdays and we chose Quartino to celebrate.  It was a disappointment.  Firstly, the restaurant was both incredibly crowded and incredibly LOUD.  As someone with mobility issues, it was difficult to navigate through the room or to be comfortable on the hard wooden seats.  We were also seated in the middle of the room, right next to the bread cutter, so our shouted conversations were interrupted every few minutes by the even louder rumble of the machine and everyone walking by managed to bump into me, including the waitstaff.   The food was also nothing to write home about.  It's a tapas style restaurant and, between the six of us, we got to sample a lot of the menu.  Nothing was awful but nothing was really great, either.  Don't think I'll be going here again; Chicago is a city full of great restaurants.  Too many to waste my time on the mediocre.

Excellent choice. I recommend the bar area we walked in to an hour wait but the bar 1st come1st serve.we were lucky got a table and a great server named .Shenade it was a perfect experience for us .... fresh goat cheese ricotta delicious n pizza we did 1/2 4 cheese n 1/2stefano wine list is very good . I hope you try it you will be happy you did. We are coming back for sure

The scene: The place was crowded with an hour+ wait on on a rainy Wednesday night. It is really LOUD inside with an obnoxious speaker calling "Robin, party of 3 your table is ready!" every few minutes. I was able to grab an open seat at the bar. Though you can order food at the bar, be warned, the stools are REALLY close together so you'll be bumping elbows with your neighbor and hopefully not sitting next to someone with a lot of big hair! :-) Food and Drink: Everything sounded good, but was just OK. I always think a spritz sounds good, but per usual, they put so much ice and soda water that the end result is watery with barely any hint of aperol. The free bread is fine, but nothing amazing. I did like the olive oil in a groovy canister that came with it. The arugula salad ($9.75) was a nice pile of greens with a good amount of hazelnuts and slice oranges, oddly hidden at the bottom of the plate. The goat milk ricotta lacked flavor and if there was any of the promised farro, I couldn't find it. I also tried the burrata and roasted beets ($10.75). The burrata was beautiful and had perfect texture, but needed more salt. The beet presentation seemed odd to me. A few raw slices on the bottom of the plate lacked flavor (as raw beets tend to) and the roasted beets came in tiny little cubes. The dish needed some acid and salt to bring it together. Service: Super friendly bar staff, 5 stars!  Though other things on the menu sounded good, and I love the concept of a small plate Italian place, my samplings weren't tasty enough to bring me back.

It's so good that it you don't make a reservation you may not get in.  Don't expect a quit dinning room!  They have the best sauce that I've had in a long time.  I had the eggplant and chicken parm...get your grub on!  By the way, the chicken parm is not on the menu.  Ask for it.  You will not be disappointed!  JM

Can't begin to explain how much enjoyment was received from dining at Quartino's recently.  This place is a can't miss for great food and even better atmosphere and service.   Don't go as a single, two or three, but a party of four or more is perfect for this loud, raucous, Italian kaleidoscope of options and surprises. Our waitress Amanda (and trainee Rebecca) were the perfect hosts to match our tipsy, chatty table and help us fund our way thru the menu.   The concept is small, shareable plates that feed 3-4 comfortably....as long as you know many more plates are coming.  The beauty is you don't get bogged down eating one, large, rich Italian dish but get to try so many.  You're not struggling to clean your plate, you have a good portion and wait for the next dish with the stack of clean plates on your table. New dishes were timed PERFECTLY to not overcrowd the small 4 top we were trying our best to overload.  The service was so attentive that empty plates were gone quickly, bread was plentiful as was water and wine.  The pace was amazing.   Were having too much fun to not try desserts which also did not disappoint.  Just an all-around ASTOUNDING dining experience.  Thank you Amanda.  You should ask for her if you can.
Good food, we ordered pasta and pizza. Really good! Nice atmosphere, it feels that you actually are somewhere in Italy.
What a great surprise! We r here from NY and were invited for a get together. I didn't order anything, they just kept ordering food and everything I had was soooo good. Pizza was solid for sure.

5 stars all around.  We came here after my daughters graduation - at her suggestion as she has been here before with friends.  The atmosphere, the service and the food were excellent.  Will definitely return.

We came here looking for deep dish pizza but they only had thin crust. It turned out to be really flavorful. I ordered the green, red, and black olives which were stronger than I expected and full of flavor. Prices were affordable. I'll be back next time I'm in Chicago.

Different but still tasty. I decided I'd come check them out since I saw on the menu that they had pesto, which is my favorite. Although I ate in the bar, the restaurant looked quite spacious. For it being 4:30 in the afternoon, the crowd sure was lively. So the pesto dish I'm referring to is a gnocchi with potatoes, green beans, and arugula. I was a bit skeptical about the green beans but the waitress assured me that it's really popular that way in Italy... Sidenote, I've been to Italy many a times as well as lived there and I've yet to see green beans in a gnocchi but to each their own. The gnocchi itself was a bit disappointing. If it weren't for the pesto and arugula, it wouldn't have any flavor. The gnocchi was really chewy, which I didn't care for. The service was ok but could have been better. All in all, it was alright.

Pretty place with delicious food. Wine comes by the bottle, liter, half or quart. Food is lovely; the gnocchis were great, but my sister asked for a custom pasta (the seafood that's on the menu but with fettuccini in a butter, garlic and oil sauce), which was splendid. Actually, they should put that in the menu.

The best Italian restaurant we have eaten, a wonderful place! We had a great time, Grace, the waitress was very nice and kind, we had an amazing Burrata, we definitely recommend this place , is a must in Chicago!!!
Have never had anything but a great experience at Quartino.
Looks like a tourist trap, but it's some of the best Italian cuisine I've ever had. Just go.

The house wine was solid.  The bread service.  Our anti pasti ensalada was fresh.  The gnocchi tricked us again. It was a bit bland for our liking. However, the steak and Limon sorbet really left us happy as can be. I've had success with the linguini and clams before.  Love their outdoor patio and their Manager was attentive to guests needs between bringing a guests dish and making sure the pedestrian traffic out front isn't interrupting their guests' experience.

On this night of Biblical rainstorms, three of us Funksters ventured to downtown Chicago for a meal of Biblical tastes and copious amounts of the crushed grape! First, the joint is huge...two floors with a constant relaxed movement. Walls of white subway tiles intermixed with fine wood panels and trim. A beautiful hand crafted bar and bar-back cabinets on one side. White shirted servers with aprons rolled at the waist deliver plates of meats and pastas to all points within. The ambiance is a throwback to Prohibition. Plates jostling and glasses clinking. I Close my eyes and any moment I expect to see "Papa Johnny" Torrio head of the Chicago Outfit sitting at a corner table twirling Tagliatelle alla Bolognese on the end of his fork as he quietly dines with Michael "Hinky Dink" Kenna one of Chicago's most corrupt politicians as they discuss their next bag drop!  We are delivered to that corner table just off the top of the stairs.  Our backs to the walls, we watch the evening move in front of us. Over the course of the next two hours we simply "dine" in the best sense of the word. Coppa and Prosciutto San Daniele, Taleggio and Pecarino Romano, Roasted Beet Salad and Giardiniera Romana and an assortment of red, green and black italian olives; plates of Tagliatelle alla Bolognese and Tuscan Sausage Risotto, a fine loaf of sliced ciabatta. All accompanied by a liter of Sangiovese IGT Santa Cristina - Toscana 2014. To finish the the evening a shared Coppa alla Banana - Caramelized Banana, Vanilla Gelato, Biscotti, Whipped Cream, Chocolate Sauce & Shavings.  Did we burn through a few dead presidents this evening? Yepper... and even one guy who was pretty famous just for kite flying! Would we do it again? In a John Lee Hooker Boom Boom Boom! Wait a sec... is that a Ark floating down State street?!? Crap, we gotta go!
Amazing atmosphere, fantastic Italian food and the best manhattan I have ever had.  Maybe a little loud when crowded due to the gorgeous white tile.   But still fantastic.

Wasn't terribly impressed.  Sangria was delicious.  Unfortunately, my brother and I both thought the food was particularly bland.  The short rib was nice and tender, just needs more flavor.  The tortellini with prosciutto and peas was alright, also bland tasting.  Shrimp risotto was watery and very bland.  Kind of disappointed. The atmosphere is busy and loud, which was okay for us, would be a good place for a first date where there's action happening.  Great place to people watch.  I doubt I will return though.  Much better Italian food in the city.  Our server was friendly and outgoing, which is always appreciated.
Absolutely the best Italian I've ever had....plain and simple! Great service and great food!

Matt, the general manager, called me personally to apologize about the incident. I think this says a lot about how this establishment is run - they could easily just ignored the problem, but they went above and beyond to make sure that I knew that they were sorry about the incident and that they were going to take care of it. He even took care of the cake, even though the other manager Joe had personally brought it across the street for delivery. Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant - I have eaten here in the past and the food as always been excellent. Now I know the management does right by their customers, which you cannot say for all places.

Quartino entirely changed my expectations for what a good dining experience entails. First, the food is exceptional, every dish is delicious and a good size to share. What I love most though is the people that work there. Somehow Quartino has accumulated an entire staff of the most friendly, accommodating, and interesting people you'll meet. I'm always disappointed when trying new restaurants because my expectations are for a complete and enjoyable dining experience, something I've had with every Quartino visit. Maybe I should take off a star for that?

Absolutely one of our favorite restaurants when we visit this city. The food is always consistent and the staff and mangers make our dinning experience easy and enjoyable. We have great conversations with the staff and love that the company promotes within, so the managers really know the ins and outs of this restaurant and knows their clientele. We had the pleasure of speaking with Derek and Brendan both managers who were promoted within this restaurant and delivered excellent customer service. They actually love talking to the guest which we believe managers should have contact with their guest and not hide in their office! Our server's name was Lauren, wonderful personality and always had a smile!  Now let's talk about the food- lots of different types of meat and cheese boards to choose from. One of our favorite dishes is the Organic Veal Skirt Steak, so tasty and tender like a baby... delicious  I highly recommend this dish, also the veal Meatballs Napoli.. yummy.  Even their pizza was delicious, definitely worth the calorie splurge here and we finished off dinner with an espresso martini, tiramisu and homemade gelato!! When in Rome.....
Really nice spot! Took my lady here for Valentine's Day and she really loved it. She said no to my proposal but yes to the impressive dessert spread. I would highly recommend this place.
Service was great. Meal was spaced out well for small plates. Everything was delicious. Recommend the calamari, truffle risotto and polenta fries.
its a nice place to go to catch up with friends during summer time. The food is okay

We had a wonderful experience with the private even staff at Quartino for my bridal Shower. The party was for about 35 people in the Venice room and the two men who handled the party, Benny and Santos, were AMAZING. They took care of everything and were so gracious. Everyone had a drink before running out, the food was served on our timeframe, and they even prepared a gluten free option for a guest when we forgot to tell them ahead of time! And they helped us break down gift boxes, open boxes and bring everything downstairs to our car. Truly a smooth running machine and we are so grateful for their help and making the Shower a huge success. Everyone raved about the food and Benny/Santos!

Best Italian I've had in the U.S. The other best Italian was in South Korea. Best italian meaning a balance of both amazing pizza and pasta.  Dinner: It's small plates to share, tapas style. New York or Chicago pizza? New York if I have to choose. But Italian thin crust is always my favorite. I've tried a few pizzas, all are good. The gnocchi, and pastas all taste hand made.  Ambiance: I came here looking at yelp's star rating just expecting another basic Italian restaurant with fancy chairs and plates but wow, it was so much more than that. The service is always great despite how busy they are. I'm happy they staff enough people to have good service. Last time I went, they were all wearing soccer jerseys which was cool and the waiters were playful instead of stern or strictly polite. It toned down the vibe of being very fancy to fun.  I've always sat outside so I'm not sure of the noise level inside.

Never been to an Italian style tapas restaurant. A local friend decided to take us out there during our first night in Chicago. I saw Chianti Classico on the menu and instantly ordered some for myself. My other friends ordered a 1/2 liter of Malbec from Argentina. I took one sip and instantly regretted ordering my Chianti.   We ordered a few tapas and shared them amongst the three of us. The concept is great. Only 1-2 appetizers are out on the table at a time. We started with gnocchi. The flavor was nice but to be honest it was over cooked and on the harder side. This was our least favorite item on the menu. Next came out the eggplant parm. Asides from it being on the saltier side., the taste was great. There was a nice balance of sauce and eggplant and the mozzarella cheese on top was melted to the right consistency. I was personally a huge fan of the dish.  Next we got the only chicken dish on the menu. This was my favorite dish we ordered (asides from dessert of course). The flavors were great and the chicken was cooked to the perfect temperature. I highly suggest this dish as well! We also ended up getting penne vodka and it was like any other penne vodka. Nothing bad or extraordinary about it. Tasted great.  For dessert we had tiramisu (not listed on dessert menu) and torta al chocolate, essentially a hot goey scrumptious chocolate cake served with gelato! This chocolate dessert paired really well with the wine!  Wish I was able to take pics of the food! We devoured everything so fast! Another place I highly will suggest to those traveling to Chicago.

I had been to Quartino's several years ago, and I recall loving the experience. I have found it to be one of the more affordable sit-down dining options in downtown Chicago, and I love the tapas-style pasta manner (because who doesn't want to snitch bites off of someone else's plate?). Quartino's was literally a stone's throw away from our hotel, and the atmosphere and staff were warm and inviting. We had reservations so we were seated quickly - I definitely suggest making reservations, because even though the two of us came in on a Monday night, it was non-stop busy. It was our last night in Chicago so we pigged out and over-ordered. Our server was Miguel, and he was excellent: very attentive and kind without being overbearing. Their Italian sodas (we had the raspberry and the blood orange flavors) were absolutely delicious. The first pasta plate we split was the tagliatelle with Bolognese sauce. We are more used to the ground meat-type of Bolognese sauce (i.e., a mix of ground veal, pork, beef, etc.) and this sauce seemed like more of a shredded pork ragout. It wasn't bad but we did not love it. Our next shared plate was the porcini and truffle risotto. Again, this plate was a little disappointing, since I remember ordering it several years back with two girlfriends and we had LOVED this luxurious, rich dish. The risotto was VERY over-cooked, my daughter said it was too mushy. And every bite was oddly gritty, like the mushrooms hadn't been properly rinsed (it literally felt like I was crunching on sand). We next split the fettuccini alfredo and the sauce was extremely delicious and silky. HOWVER, the problem I had with both the tagliatelle and the fettucine was that both pastas were extremely chewy and dense (not al dente, but undercooked/chewy) and needed a heavier hand with the salt. I wanted to salt both dishes but resisted since this seemed sacrilegious...but someone back in the kitchen really forgot to salt the pasta water.  Our last shared course was the steamed clams and these were STELLAR. The broth was gorgeous and tasted delicious but unfortunately we were too full with the mediocre pasta dishes to fully enjoy this excellent dish! I really think this was an off night for the kitchen, pasta-wise. I still love Quartino's and I fully intend to come back the next time we are in Chicago. The total bill for TONS of food and two Italian sodas/refills was about $60 (before tip for the excellent service) which you will be hard pressed to top elsewhere downtown.

From the incredible service and neighbourhood welcome its hard to be happier anywhere other then here as a local.  One of our daughters just cam back from Italy to beg for their tortellini, we just love the atmosphere and the warm welcome every time.  The food is wonderful, the wine "cheaper than water" and we have become family.  Love this place, cannot go wrong.

Came back for a second time and had a better experience. No reservation this time and just walked in and sat at a bar table with no issue. Got a good bottle of wine and this time, we did order a pizza which was great (though needed salt). We also got some pasta dish that came recommended by the waitress that I wish I could remember because it was really good and a decent size and price for a tapa. Good mix this time.

Small plates and phenomenal food I go here with friends all the time they have all kinds of varieties to choose from including a great wine list is always packed. The wait is typically minimal would highly recommend it if you have never been to this place

Have been here twice before, and came back again since we were staying nearby. It's loud and warm and packed as always, but the service was wonderful and the food was absolutely delicious. I ordered an Italian 75 cocktail which was cold and fresh and so good, I loved it. Followed by fresh and colorful caprese salad and then the server recommended house made papperdelle. The pasta and beef sauce were perfectly cooked. Only complaints are that my white wine with dinner could have been colder, and my chair kept getting bumped due to the table being so close behind us.

This place came highly recommended on Yelp but I was personally a little disappointed. Pasta was really bland. The place was super crowded and very noisy. I've heard the pizza is good but we didn't order it. If I go next time, I'll probably just play it safe and order pizza

Chicago has definitely got some pricey restaurants. Went here on last day because there were so many positive reviews on yelp. Wine was decent. Food was average. Prices are very cheap. This is an ok place but would definitely recommend something else if it's your last day. And if you listen to me on one thing and one thing only.... do not get the risotto. It came out in like 2 seconds which is never a good thing and tasted like it was under a heat lamp. If your trying to dine out on a budget go here and go on the balcony to people watch.  I won't go back but I wouldn't say totally avoid
Wow.. such excellent service and what's even better is the food. The eggplant parmigiana is a must have! And the chocolate fondue is to die for. I will definitely be coming back.

The place is okay. My wife is a vegetarian and this place has good options for vegetarians. The reason that I am giving this place 3 stars is because of the service and an incident. My wife and I went to this restaurant in non busy hours, around 4pm. We waited for good 5 minutes before a server gave us the menu. The server seemed busy with his friends and would check upon us only if I gave him a "can you serve us plz" look. When our entree arrived, the dish was very hot and the server, who was actually using a towel to hold it, put that dish in my hand instead of putting it on my side of the table. When I yanked my hand off the dish after putting it on my table then the server says - "please be careful, it's hot". Thanks for letting me know???  Should have at least apologized for it. Poor service and manners.

Great place for a big birthday dinner or just a dinner with friends in general. It's tapas style Italian food. Can't really go wrong with much on the menu. It's not gonna be the best Italian food you have ever had, but definitely good quality! The wine is also DIRT cheap, surprising for the area. Which is what makes it such a great option. Also, it's open until 2am, so good late night dinner option. Reservations are definitely necessary for dinner though, because it's usually pretty packed!

A trip to Chicago is never complete without a stop at Quartino. Went on a super busy, crowded Friday night with a line out the door, but we were still seated quickly. Our cheerful waitress and fast service perfected the experience. Thanks again!
Great food and service! The calamari was by far the best thing we ordered! The linguini and claims was also very good. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a family friendly environment

I went here for my 21st birthday, and it was a wonderful experience. The food was amazing (I absolutely recommend the Tortellini) and priced incredibly well. My party included myself and 10 other friends, and they seated us in a private section, which was very nice of them. The lighting was a bit dark, but our server was awesome and even gave me a shot of limoncello for free! Overall, I will definitely be back for the food and customer service alone.

We had a late appetizer here on Saturday night! What can I say, the service and food was incredible. We were told to go here buy a few locals and get the antipasto. Great choice. You get to select 2 meats 2 cheese and a mix of other great goodies. Everything looked so good and we couldn't decide so we had our server pick for us! He brought out the platter with aged parm, Gorgonzola and some smoked duck breast with truffle salami. Everything was amazing and next time we are back in Chicago we will be back!

Had brunch here today on what was the 1st pretty day in Chicago in 2 weeks. We chose to sit inside just because the outside patio was so crowded. Walking in, the smell of the garlicky and peppered salume kind of hits you in the face. It's delicious-smelling once you realize what it is but definitely strong. For cocktails, I ordered the supersamic, which is a Hendricks cocktail with balsamic and strawberry liquer. They had me at Hendricks, to be honest, but the taste profile was unlike anything I've had before. Perhaps, the balsamic made me think of a wine? Next up were the polenta fries, which are served with a tangy red sauce. These are really something. They're crispy but not greasy because they are baked and the sauce is a red pepper purée so I wanted to pour it on everything! We also had a split pizza - 1/2 fumo and 1/2 suprano. The suprano had a house-made giardniera , which will turn you off from any jar-stuff for the rest of your life! Finally, we had the papardelle. Whoa! Delicious but salty so go in cautiously! All in all, I loved it! And the prices were reasonable considering that all food items were house-made! I'll definitely do it again!

This place is always a great spot for good Italian food and fitting for large groups. The plates are on the smaller side, generally good for 2-3 people. We ordered various different items for people to share and each dish we had was wonderful. One of my favorite dishes was the eggplant primavera. The service was excellent. The noise level was a little louder than normal, which at times made it unpleasant. Make sure to make a reservation prior to going!

One of my favorite gathering places in the area! I love that they are open late. Service is always great. The place is jammed packed every time I've been. This is americanized Italian food and they do it well. I love the house wine. The octopus is excellent, the risottos are good I've had them all but the portion is way to small.

Never had a bad meal here. Every pizza has been good, the food tastes fresh. The bartenders are good at recommending a good wine with your meal. The tortellini with prosciutto is excellent. The veal meatballs are too die for. The polenta fries are crisp and fresh. The zeppole for dessert is wonderful. This is a great night out restaurant!

Been here a few times, always a good experience. Tried the soprano pizza today and was a fan. Amazing how pickled cauliflower, carrots and veal meatballs balanced out so well. The best part is when you get the bill. Quite inexpensive for the Gold Coast area. Good place to grab a drink  especially on a nice day, make sure to sit outside.

My husband and I came here for dinner and had an ok experience. First of all-it's a large restaurant with bright lighting, so more like a family restaurant rather than a date night. We were shoved in a back table feeling really claustrophobic to our surroundings. Everything is shared small plates so we ordered eggplant Parmesan, broccoli rabe, gnocchi, and porcini and truffle Risotto. The eggplant Parmesan dish came out piping hot and no one warned my husband. He burnt himself. The dish tasted great though, and the marinara was really fresh. The next dish that came out was the broccoli rabe. It was fantastic-definitely our favorite. Then the Risotto... we LOVE risotto! Theirs however was terrible. The rice was undercooked and the porcini mushroom dirt overpowered the dish. There were several gritty bites as if they put the rehydrated water into the dish and didn't discard the dirt debris. Lastly the gnocchi-it had undercooked potatoes and green beans that overpowered the dish and the gnocchi tasted grainy like it needed another minute to cook.  We gave the place a 3 for the broccoli, eggplant, the wine, and the service. The ambiance and the other 2 dishes were bad enough that we probably won't be back. Next time we will stick to Osterio across the street.

This restaurant was very good.   It is meant to order multiple pastas and share them, but the people in my group just got their own.  The sizes were small compared to normal pasta dishes, but still were more than enough to eat.  Everyone enjoyed their dish. Overall, a very good restaurant

It was packed when we got there but we got lucky and there were two seats at the bar for my cousin and I! The food was delicious and our bartender, William was amazing!! Super great service and very sweet!! Will definitely be coming back soon!

Loved it! Food and service was amazing. Between the 3 of us we ordered the burrata, kale salad and arugula pizza. Everything was fresh and delicious. For dessert, we got the tiramisu, which was good but I've had better, and profiteroles, which disappeared really quick! Would definitely go back.

First time I've ever been there and I was blown away! Tapas Italian is outstanding. The restaurant has a great buzz-the food was amazing-plenty of choices to share!!(I highly recommend the fettuccine alfredo and the tiramisu-best EVER!!! Could have platefuls of both!) fun place with a small group!! Loved it and will be back every chance I get!!

The food was awesome! There was about a 2 hour wait for Saturday night dinner, so my friend and I opted to wait for a table to open up in the bar area. It was worth the wait! Both Chris and William were bartenders who served us and they were awesome! When I go back, I'm requesting Chris as a server. We asked about his favorite dish and he suggested the short rib. It was legitimately THE best short rib I've ever had in my life! We were liking the plate clean. We also had the shrimp (delicious), brussel sprouts, and broccoli rabe. This place has great food!!
Been here a handle of times and I do not have one complaint! I always recommend this place to anyone looking for good Italian food in river north.
It was fun to sit al-fresco. I was not too impressed with the food though. Good place to sit and convenient location. Food was average.

I was tasked with choosing a restaurant for my family to meet at for a quick visit & dinner.  Quartino was near my hotel and has great ratings on the usually reliable Yelp so I figured we'd give it a shot. The menu, and the idea behind the menu (Italian tapas!), both set my expectations very high.  We ordered 10-12 items off of the menu for our party of six and we all left very full.  With that said, none of us were very impressed...in fact, I'd say we were relatively disappointed, but fortunately hungry enough that it didn't matter too much.   I thought there was a real lack of seasoning pretty much across the board and, for an Italian joint, some really surprising issues with the pasta.  There's al dente pasta, and then there's way undercooked, gummy pasta.  The gnocchi and penne pastas were both waaaay underdone which resulted in very disappointing dishes.  The carpaccio was paired with something completely forgettable other than the fact that it wasn't a very good pairing(I believe radish?) .  The pizzas were bland with sparse, uneven toppings.   There were two good items we tried; the artisan sausage with peppers and onions was tasty, as was the duck prosciutto.  The restaurant was loud, tables were very close together, and as we were finishing our meal there was a busboy hovering which was not appreciated being this was the only time we all had to see one another.  Our waitress forgot to put in an order and was overall very, eh, kind of just going through the motions.   There is too much good food in Chicago to recommend this place...I have no clue how this has 4 stars on Yelp.

This is such a fun restaurant. The service is great and there is really something for everyone here--the food is fantastic. It's loud and crowded, but that is part of the charm. Suggestion: start small with your order. You can always add!

We've been going to Quartino weekly for a few years now.  The food is amazing and underpriced.  The service has always been exceptional.  Liz, our server, knows us by name and remembers our favorite orders!!!  The steffano pizza, pork shank, salmon, shrimp, and sausage risotto are my favorites ;)
Great small plates. The wine menu is decent but could use a little more variety. The cavatelli were delightful and filling.

Very solid Italian restaurant.  Nice antipasto  selections.  Apricot Rosemary butter was very notable.  Was sharing with the family so very standard main courses but all was done well.  I consider myself a meatball snob as I make the best at home and the meatballs here were quite good.  Wine selection was decent.  Deserts were enjoyed by all at the table.  The espresso was quite good.  Wait staff was informarive and attentive.  Managers stopped to check in throughout the meal.  Tough to get five stars out of me but we'll worth the stop.

Great meal. Love the family style. We had a pizza, a couple pastas and multiple appetizers. Service was good but not extraordinary. I love how they offer wine in carafes in case you don't want an entire bottle. Definitely a great spot for a family dinner or big group.

We almost didn't eat here because of the ridiculously long wait, but we snagged a table in the bar area. I'm glad we did, because it was great. They were so busy but our server still made sure we were taken care of. From the wine & bread to pasta and dessert, Quartino did not disappoint.

Been there a million times! Great menu with large selection for any kind of mood. It's open late, food is delish, there is always something good to try from the wine list, and you get the best service at the bar! Today tried a charcuterie platter, and it was amazing. Their pizzas hit the spot all the time. Beef medallions and potato puree will satisfy your hunger, but that chocolate lava cake with vanilla ice cream will take you to heavens!

I have to go 5 STARS for Quartino for one main reason, customer service! The food was tasty too but... I had been out and about solo for quite sometime - exploring the zoo and my phone died so I couldn't uber here even if I had wanted to. I suppose I could have flagged down a cab but I stuck it out and nearly froze my fingertips off. Turns out Hermes is nice, but my gloves did nothing to actually keep my fingers warm in freezing temps and wind. As soon as I arrived, about 10-15 minutes before my reservation I asked the gals at the host stand if I could please have a table near an outlet if they possibly had one in the restaurant. They had a good feeling they did, walked to the table to check then back to get me and I was seated to thaw out my hands over a nicely lit candle on the table (on their front inside patio terrace area) and charge up my phone with their electricity! :) I really appreciated the service right from the start. Enjoyed a 1/4 Litre of their Donati Ezio 13 Cab and the following:   - Polenta Fries (the sauce was awesome the fries themselves ok, maybe not my fav version of polenta) - 1/2 order of their Baby Spinach salad (very good) - Pappardelle dish (very nice) and... - 1/2 order of their tiramiso (soooo good!) All in all this was the perfect warm spot to tuck away at for a fulfilling solo dining experience while in the city. I'd recommend it! The place was abuzz by the time I left. Great energy and great service.

One of the few small plates places I will continuously go back to in Streeterville! I think the whole small plate concept has become a bit overdone, and can often yield itty-bitty portions for a hefty price tag and mediocre food. Not Quartino! Everything I've had here has been delicious, from their meatballs to their fondue, salads, meats and even accompaniments with the cheese plates!  Some personal favorites: the fondue is a MUST!! It's sooo good!! It's a couple bucks up charge, but it goes great with apples!! I'm not a veal eater, but I will make an exception for their veal meatballs! The initial intrigue of this dish was that it has raisins and sun-dried tomato....weird, but it worked splendidly to the point where I'll set my ethics aside to eat a few of these bad boys! White bean and garlic spread is good! It's a simple dish, which sometimes can yield the best dishes. The short rib is also a must! It's hearty and very well-prepared! I love it!  Even their salads are worth ordering! The Brussels sprouts salad is my absolute favorite! It's super-light, but incredibly flavorful!! Love it!! The kale salad is pretty great, too. One of their cheese plates at one time came with green grapes with parsley, lemon juice and EVOO. Weird, right? Wrong!! DELICIOUSLY WEIRD! I've replicated it at home, because it was so yummy!  This place take a lot of pride in their attention to detail, variety in food, and more importantly, consistently tasty food!  A bottle of wine at this place is a must! Ask the wait staff if you're not a pro at picking wine; they know their stuff, and can usually make recommendations based on your palate. They also offer full bottles of wine, or a smaller amount (1 liter? 1/2 liter?)  This place can add up with the price of food, and does get quite crowded when all the tables fill up, but the food and great wine makes it a worth while trip!

My team had a work dinner here recently.  The food was overall very good.  There was so much of it.  Very big portions all served family style.  I think we did the 6 course menu from group dining.  There was a little bit of everything. Here is the long list of items. Chef's section of cured meats and cheese Assorted bruschetta Crisp Calamari Veal Meatballs Napoli Caprese salad Baby Spinach salad Gnocchi with Arugula Pesto Taglieatelle alla Bolognese Shrimp with EVOO, garlic, wine and lemon Roasted Tuscan sausage with onions and peppers Farmhouse chicken with lemon & herbs Chocolate fondue with fruit and biscotti I really enjoyed a lot of this - the meats and cheese and bruschetta at the beginning were flavorful and fresh. Lots of different flavors.  The taglieatelle was good.  Loved the meat sauce.  Shrimp were huge.  The chocolate fondue at the end was awesome.  All different kinds of fruit with yummy melted chocolate. We had very good service.  Always refilling drinks and wine glasses.  Food came often.  We had a nice private room upstairs near the bathrooms which is always nice. Definitely a great family style Italian restaurant.

Great food and even better service! Scott took great care of us. We didn't even have to look at the menu, he said he would handle everything because we were so indecisive. He brought several different dishes (all very delicious) and treated us like royalty. I would highly recommend checking this place out!

This place doesn't disappoint. Coming here was exactly what we needed that day. My husband's first time there was during Chef Week and now any time we're in town, this is one of the places we have to visit. Their osso buco and risotto just melts in your mouth. All the pastas and desserts we've tried receive top marks. Our reservation that day was to celebrate a birthday (mine) but we had just lost a pet, and in no mood to celebrate. My husband convinced me that we should go, if only to get a momentary reprieve. I changed our reservation for a later time and apologized for the last minute change. I hadn't meant to mention anything else but the verbal vomit came out and it was too late to delete the message. The service here is always outstanding but that day, they went above and beyond. It was a busy day but they reserved a quiet corner for us, helpful when I went teary-eyed, and had the semi-privacy to wipe them away in peace. It seemed like the entire serving staff expressed their condolences. We truly appreciated the compassion they showed us and hope they continue their all around excellence
Everything was great. I tried 7 different things, all of them tasteful and well cooked. From the appetizers to the dessert, all five stars. Highly recommended
Enjoyed great drinks! Polenta fries - awesome.  San daniele pizza - awesome.  Cavatelli - awesome.  Penne aka vodka - awesome.  Service - great!

Went here for an early dinner, place filled up quickly. There were 6 of us and we all shared a variety of dishes. The pizzas were great and the pasta dishes were very tasty, Prices were also decent. We will definitely go back to try some of the sausage platters and other appetizers.

I've been here a few times now and have never been disappointed by the food. They have a great selection and I always love a place that starts you off with a basket of bread! My only dislike is that it can get a little pricey and loud, but it's great for a night out to celebrate something!  I love going here especially in the winter since it's so cozy and easy to get to from anywhere downtown. Definitely worth checking out!

Came in for dinner on a weeknight and the place was packed which I took as a good sign but was definitely glad I'd made a reservation! The tables are definitely in tight quarters but weren't terribly uncomfortable. Just wouldn't recommend if you need a quiteter environment. We had excellent service - our waitress was just the right level of attentive and made great recommendations from the menu. The food ranged from great to just okay - we really enjoyed the goat cheese ricotta appetizer and the tiramisu but their house made pastas weren't anything to write home about. Overall, would recommend if only for the great service we received.

As there are numerous reviews, I am adding a brief entry. Every experience I have had has been phenomenal, from arrival to departure. Staff is very friendly and accommodating and food is exquisite. No, it is not a quiet atmosphere but I have had two incredibly romantic dinners and will be returning again as it is now our 'special spot'.
Came here a year ago during restaurant week and it was amazing to be amble to sample the menu!  I have been back multiple times and love the flavor of the menu!!!!

I was planning a birthday celebration for my extended family (16 people) and Quartino Ristorante came very highly recommended.  After deciding that we wouldn't spend enough to warrant a private room ($2000 minimum) we booked a table in the main dining room for 6:30 on a Friday night.  Things started out poorly when our table wasn't ready when we arrived but a few of us headed to the bar to kill time (the rest hung out by the door...not the most convenient waiting area) and about 20 minutes later we were seated. Unfortunately, the table set up was more appropriate for 14 people than 16 so I went to speak with the host.  To their credit, they said that they would take care of things right away and about 5 minutes later, after a table next to us freed up, they pushed it over and we settled in, more comfortably this time. While a bit irritating, I put the initial issues down to the fact that we were at a busy Chicago restaurant on a Friday night...unfortunately, things did not get better.  I had pre-ordered 3 Salumeria tasting (antipasti) plates.  A few minutes after we sat down the first plate arrived.  Maybe 5 minutes after that, the second plate arrived.  Probably another 6-7 minutes later , the 3rd plate arrived. So it was almost 15 minutes before some people had food!  These were pre-ordered and consisted of a mix of charcuterie, cheese and assorted pre-made vegetable antipasti (which were good)...there was no reason that all of the plates could not have been prepared and delivered to the table at once.  Very strange. Then we ordered the mains.  The waiter warned us that the dishes would be brought out as they became available...which was fine.  That said, I was not prepared for the fact that my linguine with clams came out about 3 minutes later...and probably 7-10 minutes before anyone else got food.  I guess I could have understood it if everyone at our table who ordered linguine with clams was served at the same time, but that was not the case.  The best I could figure is that they had an extra one from someone else's order so they gave it to me. Needless to say I was finished before most people at the table were served. Again, all of this would have been forgiven if the food was good, but it was not.  My linguine was way over cooked and bland.  My wife's shrimp risotto tasted like lightly seasoned rice that they put a couple of shrimp on top of.  I had a slice of my nephew's pepperoni pizza and it could have been something from the freezer section.  My daughter said that her tagliatelle alla Bolognese was also meh.  I have been to Italy numerous times and I know what good Italian food tastes like...this was not it (To the people who have written Yelp reviews saying that this is the best Italian food in Chicago, I have news for you - it is not even the best Italian food in River North). On the plus side, the wait staff were competent and friendly.  They generously gave our table an extra pizza that was going to go to waste in the kitchen and they took a soda off of the bill that my young nephew ordered but didn't like. And the prices are very reasonable (most pasta and mains are between $11 and $15)...although the portions are not huge (the waiter said that things were family style but they were a little small to share between 2 people). Despite what I had heard about this being a chef-driven Italian restaurant, I would categorize it as more of a mass market Italian-American restaurant minus the overwhelming portions. Food is okay but not especially memorable...certainly not if you have ever eaten in a real Italian trattoria or enoteca.

We went here on a busy Saturday night. The place was packed. It was for a friend's bday. She liked this place a lot a few years ago. But unfortunately, it didn't hold up to expectations. Side note: they have a really bad waiting area. They should remove the two tables by the front and place benches here or something. There is no where to stand after you enter the revolving doors and it turns into a sumo wrestling match with servers, hostesses, people trying to get to the packed bar and patrons. Really bad setup that makes no sense. The people seated at the two front tables cannot possibly enjoy their meal because they have people standing right on top of them, and they have a door constantly opening letting in cold air in their faces. The food was mediocre largely due to a lack of seasoning. Everything was under seasoned including the gnocchi with arugula pesto and shrimp risotto. I have never had to put salt and pepper on everything that came out of a kitchen before, but we had to on 4 of our 5 items we ordered. The only thing that I'd consider to be really good were the dates (with pancetta I think). The short rib was OK but kinda tasted like pot roast.  Strongly suggest some sort of quality control on what goes out of the kitchen. There's no reason a risotto and a pesto should be under salted, those are two basic things that need a lot of salt in the kitchen. We have better tasting Italian food from a little joint in our neighborhood in Lakeview. Maybe it was an off night, but for the price and location, you should have a higher standard.
Yum! We were lucky to get a reservation. We came in town from Dallas and wanted a real Chicago Italian experience. Perfect spot. Great service too. Ask for Jessie (Jesus)

Food and service is always consistent and great. I miss being able to walk down the street to grab a bite for lunch. Favorite meal is the Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo-YUM!! In the spring its great to sit outside and enjoy a glass of win and people watch while eating delicious food.
Amazing atmosphere and food. I felt like I was in a restaurant in Italy. Amazing drinks and tapas style food.

Great place for sharing food! My bf and I ordered three plates and it was just enough. We had calamari, beef filets and tortellini and they were all good. One of the best Italian places I have ever had!

First time visiting this restaurant for lunch and my wife and I really enjoyed it. The service was very attentive and extremely friendly.  Manager also paid a friendly visit to our table as well. I had the marinara pizza and my wife had the meat sauce spaghetti. Both were very good. We are planning to visit for dinner next.

I've loved this place for years. Beautifully made traditional Italian cuisine. Very welcoming environment. Always great service. Even when wall to wall occupied. Excellent service staff & great bartenders. Been going for years. Always will

I've been to Quartino a handful of times now and it never disappoints.   1/2 liter of wine, some cheese/salami, Rucolina Pizza, salad, and their off-menu TIramisu all for under $80 including tip = great deal.   the menu is all share plates and the food comes out at a good pace.  Great place to go for a dinner with friends or family.

Excellent. Old school. Affordable. Seated promptly for our reservation. It is loud in this place and it's rather casual but that's part of the experience. Pasta and pizza were amazing, plus the affordable wine selection was great. Too many Italian restaurants in Chicago try too hard or are too expensive (it's pasta after all), but quartino does not fall into that bucket. Will definitely be back.

Go for the pasta, seafood, and service!  We loved the gnocchi, one of their home made specialties.  Also, I'm not sure what they do to the mashed potatoes, but they are the best!  Large restaurant great for bit groups.  Bustling and staff running around quickly to get orders out.  My only complaint would be the pacing of the tapas.  Both times I've been they seemed to bring them out almost simultaneously when we specifically asked for a little room between each course.  Otherwise, love this place and will be back with a group of friends or family!

Service was good. Food was mediocre . We were pissed that this "Italian" restaurant didn't have lasagna . Chicken fettuccine was a disappointment. Pizza was decent . Ribs were weird yet flavorful . Menu nor food was satisfying. I will not return

Pretty good, high energy italian joint in River North.  The food didn't really blow me away, but it didn't disappoint either. It was rather crowded and loud, so expect that. As a pizza snob, I found the pie tasty but underwhelming.  They claim Neapolitan style, though the crust/dough is clearly not made in the same fashion that most proper Neapolitan pizza joints do it.  I almost suspect that the crust here is frozen. Some interesting drink options, I think I may come back in for a drink and an appetizer sometime, but will seek full dinners elsewhere.
Lively place with pizza, olives, big wine selection, etc. Super crowded on a Wednesday night but found a spot at the bar for the 3 of us. Awesome!

If you like sharing food then you'll love this place. However, if you are like me and sharing food tapas style stresses you out then you are in for a hard time. Overall, the actual was was pretty good. The octopus was bomb, but the pizza was meh. Also, they serve the wine in pitchers and give you a small non wine glass to use. I have big hands and it made me feel like a giant.  When it comes to ambiance the place has a cool vibe, that might be good for a first date. Our table was way to small for 4 people and people kept bumping into the back of my chair.

This is a great place to go to when you're craving Italian but aren't ready to commit to just one dish.   I came in with 4 other people and we ended up ordering an array of pretty tasty dishes.  For me, the best deal and best tasting dishes were the cheese and meat board, tortellini, and the artisan Italian sausage.  The tortellini had just the right amount of creaminess and the sausage was seasoned well.  And of course, it's so much fun making your own cheese and meat board and I would imagine is a huge hit for most tables.  My least favorite were the octopus and the portabella risotto.  The risotto was gritty to me like the mushrooms used were still a little dirty.  The octopus was definitely chewy and not something I would get again.  Overall, a great restaurant option and a very fun place to come with a group of friends.

The pastas and pizzas at this place were a bit disappointing. I got the pesto gnocchi, which was a little bit overcooked and tasteless. Came here with a big group, and based off the reviews, definitely expected more.

Quartino's is great for a group looking to share a bunch of smaller Italian plates.  We always bring our family here when they visit- it has a fun vibe and the staff is always nice and attentive.  The pizzas are yummy, burrata is nice and fresh, and wine list is great.  A good staple to have closer to downtown!

OMG. The food here is so delicious. The Fondue was so tasty - sweet apples and bread for dipping similar to pizza dough but better. The Green Salad was covered in fresh shaved Parmesan. We also enjoyed the spare rib which was marinaded well and very tender. The dessert consisted on Tiramisu, Vanilla Gelato and Doughnuts with chocolate and honey dipping sauces.
This is one of my go-to restaurants here. I live near the 36 bus and it stops right in front of the restaurant. The food is always very good. The outdoor seating is great when the weather is nice.

The absolute best restaurant in the entire city of Chicago. You can order anything on the entire menu and it won't just be good it will be amazing. Home run of a spot. John Colletta is a master chef, everything his hands touch turn to gold. I go her at least once a week and I still can't get enough. I would give it 10 stars if I could!
I really enjoyed the food this restuarant had to offer. Specially the desserts. Highly recommend this place. Its also very affordable and the service is top notch.
This is a great place to go with a large group.  A lot of different options for sharing.  Wine is very reasonably priced.  Food wont knock your socks off, but it is still pretty good.
The food was great! Service was ok - super long wait even after being seated!  But I like that it's open late.

The character of the restaurant is what I enjoyed best. The lobby was brimming full of people trying to get a table. Coming to this restaurant with good friends was the main draw for me. The wait staff was pleasant and very helpful for first timers understanding the flow of the dinner. There are many small plates that you can order as you go through your meal. It was a great way to try a lot of the dishes and share with friends. Overall, the food was good although the risotto seemed to lack flavor.

On a packed Friday night with a large group, we still had good service. Food and drinks came out in a reasonable time, and were all tasty. On a large group with lots of sharing plates, we had a bite of probably a third of the menu. This place is also a great patio spot in summer.

Love this place! Always one of my go-to restaurants when I have visitors in town. It's very accommodating for large groups. The servers are used to taking care of lots of people, so you don't have to worry. I've been here many times and tried countless dishes and haven't had a bad one yet. Plus, they have fairly priced wine in every size carafe you can imagine!  Note that it's a loud, fast-paced restaurant with lots of people, so it's not the best place for people who are hard of hearing.

The pasta, sauces, etc. are freshly prepared in-house. The fettuccine alfredo is really tasty. My husband got the tagliatelle and he wasn't a fan, so they let him switch to a different dish. The prices are awesome and the wait staff is great as well. We will be back next time we are in Chicago.
Food is great, very tasty and well prepared. Service is pretty fast. Small plates to share.  The restaurant is big so a little loud but perfect for group events.

This place is really good and not too touristy. When I lived in Chicago this was deifnitely my go to place in the downtown area. The italian tapas are really good and the wine selection as well. They also have a nice terrace.  The waiters wear soccer jerseys which is cute. I think anything you get is good, I remember meatballs were especially good.

Hands down to one of the best Italian restaurant I've ever had. At least better than what we have in Dallas. Food, price and service is definitely worth the bang for your bucks. My friends and I were vacationing in Chicago and we came across this place through Yelp search. So glad we decided to stop by.  Everything was delicious from appetizers to dessert. To start off, we ordered the salumi taste board and the calamari. Both were two thumbs up. The calamari is addicting! One order just wasn't  enough. And so we ordered a second. The clam pasta dish was divine. We also tried their pizzas. My favorite is the duck prosciutto pizza with arugula drizzled in olive oil. I usually don't have room for dessert but I was glad the waitress suckered me into trying their beignets. They were fluffy and airy. Dip it in the chocolate dipping and you will fall in love. I am salivating as I am reminiscing about this restaurant.  If you can get a chance to sit on the second floor patio, I definitely recommend asking. The atmosphere is perfect. Let's just say everything was so good we came back the next day before headed home.

My favorite restaurant by far and I'm so sad it's half a continent away.  The concept is so much fun...Italian tapas!  We had four people dinning and I think we ordered 2 salads and 4 entries.  It was enough for each of us to have 3-4 bites of each dish.  We also shared 3 desserts.  The Tora al Cioccolato was the best.  The Panino al Geltao Limone was a  close second.  The only thing we didn't try was the pizza.  They have a wide variety of wine and beer available.  It's loud so don't think of this as being a quite fine dining environment.  The only thing I would have wished for is a slightly bigger table.  It was a little difficult serving when you have 6 plates on a rather small sized table.
Great place to brings friends for tapas and wine.  All seasons, great atmosphere inside and out.  Very consistent.
Absolutely terrific.  Salmon, fettuccini alfredo, sausage risotto, bruschetta, calamari, caprice salad  , Italian donuts, chocolate cake thing.  All outstanding !!!!!
This place is fun and always great when you need a place to go as a group!  The tapas are delicious, the atmosphere is lively.  I've always had great service, excellent wine and so much fun!

Pretty decent Italian food.   Pizza was the highlight.   Pasta was hot and good    The way the restaurant works is a little confusing.   Our server was a trans gentleman who basically put on a show but did no work.  Thank hod for the lowly staff that brought food and drinks.   Manager was present but uncomfortable.  Almost 4 star meal
Nice place with lots of options. I will say I was disappointed in the porcini and truffle risotto. Average at best. However the past meals and antipasti plate were excellent.

This place is amazing  Food is delicious and such a great price !  We order many appetizers all of them deliciousness. Risotto as main dish and small portion but good really good !  frutti  D mare was a big portion and amazingly good

Easy meal at the bar during my short visit to Chicago.  Came after 9pm and atmosphere was still lively without needing to wait for a seat.  Bartender was attentive.  Many great cocktail options and everything sounded delicious.  My top picks were polenta fries, gnocchi, tortellini, and the shrimp.  Opted for less expensive white wine sangria and my favorite tortellini.  Was not disappointed.

Visited on Valentines eve as all other places were full. Got a corner table for two, the light was dim, the place was congested.. Food was okay, not that great. we ordered a Fettuccini Alfredo Pasta and Gnocchi (got it customized with chicken). Limoncello martini was great though.. must try for vodka lovers. I am not a fan of Italian cuisine.

Had the margherita pizza, pappardelle pasta, linguini with clams, and osso bucco. The margherita pizza was terrible-- it literally looked like a one dollar gas station pizza with basil leaves. We sent it back, and our server very gracious about taking it off our bill. The other dishes were only sub-par. The best was the pappardelle, but the portion was so small for a pretty steep price. Super crowded venue, but great service. Probably won't return though.

The perfect place for a lively gathering. The best bet is to be comfortable settling in for a lengthier, shareable meal. Dinner becomes a bit of an adventure as you sample a bit of everything. The waitstaff is friendly and eager to provide helpful recommendations. You never feel rushed, but always feel welcomed, as if by a jovial Italian family.

First off, I really really really wanted to LOVE this place. What I loved about it: the ambience, the prices, the pasta bolognese, the diversity of the menu, the wine, the bread and olive oil.  What I didn't like so much, the veal skirt steak, the pizza, the calamari.  Most of the food was just okay to me. Nothing at all special. The pizza was fresh and had great ingredients, I know, but it lacked in flavor. It didn't taste like anything! The calamari was okay but the fried chunks were to big and there wasn't much of a crust because it was falling off. I was so excited to try the veal skirt steak! It was so tender but again no flavor whatsoever. It was so bizarre to me! Were we supposed to flavor the meat ourselves? Idk just not what I expected.  I think I will give this place another try since I came here on Valentine's Day and it was pretty busy. Everyone I know that has been here before loves it!  So far, the only thing worthy of coming back for is the pasta bolognese.  Great location!
Great for groups and can accommodate easily (we were 15 people).  The food was above average, as you would expect from a restaurant in River North.

I am not sure how to rate this place because on the one hand the food was amazing! Authentic Italian, served to be shared ( although portions are not big) we ordered several pasta dishes for our family of 5 and probably got about 5 noodles each! Not joking. However it is nice because it gives you the opportunity to try a taste of everything. My family loved everything that we ordered except the polenta fries which I thought the restaurants signature thing. I should also mention we'd never had polenta before so maybe I'm not the best to judge. Also the dishes come out as they are ready,  not all at one, which I kind of liked. The only down side to this place is that is was so incredibly noisey (we went on a busy Friday night) we couldn't even have conversations across the table. We were literally shouting across the table and still couldn't hear each other. So to sum up, food was amazing. THe atmosphere is festive and reflective of Italian culture (me thinks) but not great for a first date or intimate family dinner.

Visiting Chicago with my family and decided to eat here since it was open late. Loved the share plates as it worked well for us. Gave us the chance to try different things and the portions were still a great size. Great service.  Looking forward to another visit!

Me and my wife came here on Valentines day for Dinner, it was our first time at Quartino. After Dinner we both got severely sick afterwards. We know for a fact it was the food here because that is all we ate that day. Never again!

Quarantinos lived up to all the good things that were said about it. It was unique in the sense that it was served as Italian style tapas. We got the seafood mix (so good the sauce is to die for), octopus (amazing) and two pastas. You can taste the authenticity of the pasta - it's hand made and it is the tastiest thing ever. The wine was wonderful, we strayed from our norm (Malbec) and tried something new, the waiter suggested a white that was incredible. Not only was the service great but it was also affordable. This place is perfect for a date night.

Great food in a crowded space.  We heard this place was good, so we met out-of-town friends here.  Very busy and crowded, but the food did not disappoint!  Old Italian movies playing on the tv's, good service, good dishes meant to share, kind of noisy so conversation was difficult.  Overall, we'd go back but try for an "off" time.

I think its safe to say that everyone loves this place as you can see all of the awesome reviews! I came over to meet with a friend, a colleague and another associate to grab a late lunch around 1:30pm mid week so there weren't too many people inside. We decided we should share plates as the portions would be a nice enough size for all four of us to try 4 different dishes. I went with the awesome rigatoni which in my opinion was the best dish. My friend chose the most vegan pizza he could find on the menu and it was very good my colleague/quasi-friend got the shrimp and it was delicious as well. Our 4th person got the shrimp risotto which was awesome as well! I see why this place is so popular...awesome food, prime location and good service!

Quartino is fantastic for a lot of reasons: yummy food, shareable options, ambiance, nice wine list, and good service. It works well for lunch, a romantic dinner ... it is a versatile spot.  I'm partial to the pasta and the pizza, but they have a ton of options. Only criticism I can offer is that this place is sometimes PACKED. You probably won't snag a seat at the bar on a Friday unless you get there early.

Came here for a valentine's dinner and I was a bit underwhelmed. Everyone I've spoken with has said great things about this restaurant however, my experience left something to be desired. The atmosphere of this place is definitely on the noisier side and felt crammed. Ordered a bottle of Pinot noir and 5 dishes to share: bruschette, crisp calamari, roasted baby octopus, gnocchi, and tortellini. Everything was just okay. Wasn't blown away by any of the things we ordered, to be honest. For the bruschette, I wish that they would've put all the toppings on each piece of bread instead of having just eggplant on one and mushrooms on another. It made it difficult to get a taste of each one and we ended up having to take turns taking bites. Sadly, the gnocchi was ended up being our least favorite. It was not light and fluffy like you would expect, and it would get stuck to the fork when we took a bite. The texture of it was totally off and tasted bland. Big disappointment (especially because it's a house made pasta). The only dish that we thought was worthy was the tortellini with prosciutto. Our server, Aldo, was great though. He was very personable and friendly. Overall, would give this place a 3.5.

My family came here for lunch during our staycation downtown in December. We ordered about 4-5 plates including the Salumeria Tasting. Everything was quite good!m, especially that Tasting platter. It's my cup of tea for sure and had unique flavors.  It didn't really fill up my brothers though, so either order more plates or go somewhere else with bigger portions. We were seated off to the side in the 'sunroom' type of area. It was nice and sunny that day but it was crowded and people kept bumping into my dad's chair. Overall though the decor looked warm, inviting, and cozy!

Friendly atmosphere, a few great homemade pasta dishes, flavorful braised meat dishes, the mushroom risotto is quite good. As far as the salmon goes I wasnt impressed. If it werent cut into small pieces then maybe it wouldn't be so dry and ridiculously overcooked. The menu is hit or miss depending on what you order. But the hits are very good. They have a fairly decent wine selection. The cocktail list is alright. I definitely like the fact that you can order half size dishes of most entrees, pasta, etc. That is not listed on the menu but just ask your bartender and he will accommodate you. I definitely do recommend. I always end up meeting some interesting people there.

Fantastic place to come with a group. Wonderful plates to share. Service is always top notch. Extensive wine list. They have food late night. It's a great place to meet with friends and not break the back in River North. Plus you can buy one of the amazing cheese graters! They are imported and soooo good!

Quartino is a great restaurant if you are looking for an authentic Italian cuisine experience. The food will satify any level of hunger since the choice of making your dish small or large is available. I recommend keeping the bread made in house coming to your table as they have great balsamic vinegar and olive oil to pair your bread with. If you are looking for spice ask for the spicy oil. The dishes are so delicious but don't have too much of a variety which is the only reason i wont rate this place a 5 (4.75 XD ). Overall though Quartino is one of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago. Come in and not only enjoy the food but the italian film playing throughout the restaurant, the italian soccer jerseys, and candlelit dinner/lunch. Miguel (#9 Icardi inter Milan) was an amazing server so attentive, Gratzie.
Amazing food, wine, service, and prices. It feels like you walked into Italy and it tastes like it too.
Friendly service, great veal meatballs with Ricotta cheese, and great pizza.  The crust was so good that I also ate my husband's pizza crust!

Reservation made for 6:30, but we showed up early and were sat 15 min early. Our server was fantastic, so much energy. We even got to meet one of the chefs to take a picture with our future bride! Took 1 star away only bc the downstairs was PACKED, loud, lively, but tables in such weird places, and when I went to use the bathroom (with classic powder soap!) upstairs, it was practically empty. Kinda weird. Anyway, if I crave Italian food, I'll go back!

Went back for a third visit, sat in the bar and went all out on small plates and wine. Everything was fantastic, totally redeemed from the so-so experience during my last visit. I really love how the wine is available by the 250ml/500ml/750ml/1L sizes, allowing us to try a nice spectrum of varietals/blends. Bartenders were helpful and friendly.

This place is perfect for small gatherings, big gatherings, romantic dinners, game day, basically anything! If you want to split a few plates or order two for yourself it's a great place to taste a couple different things.
