It's so decently priced anyone can walk in and out with a full belly (even leftovers) for around $20. The perfect Italian cuisine!

We had made reservations for a Saturday night so when we walked up we were seated right away. The waiter/service was great and he was very helpful with the menu. The food was delicious as well, I highly recommend the Bruschetta!

We came in to celebrate our friend's birthday who passed away two years ago. Scott, our waiter, (who didn't know why we were here until near the end) was incredible every step of the way. He was super attentive and very patient with our large group. The food was amazing but what made the night special was that when Scott asked why we were here and we told him, he brought us a candle and a lighter so we could celebrate our friend's birthday. We were all so touched by his thoughtfulness. It left us with a lasting memory on a day that is difficult for all of us. Way to go Quartino and thank you Scott!!

The lobby is entirely too small. It was very crowded and loud while waiting for our table. The food was delicious, however, it would have been great if the waiter had guided us more when we asked how many dishes we needed for 7 people. I definitely did not like that one dish was brought out at a time. It made for a very, very long dinner. Not sure if we would go back. Although it was reasonably priced.
A nice and cozy old-world feeling Italian joint on State. Great wine selection! Nice place for both small plates for sharing as well as sitting down for a nice meal. Good ambiance.

The service and food here were the absolute best. We had a private party and they anticipated all of our needs and when we asked them to make delicious drinks, they came up with their own special cocktails for us that we drank for the rest of the night. Please go here.
Packed place but we were able to find a seat at the bar and had great service and food. Eggplant Parmesan was amazing and the house made pasta was good too!

Whenever my friends visit from out of state, this is one of the top choices I choose. There are reasons for it!  This time, I tried their lunch special. I didn't notice they offer lunch special for 2-3 people till I saw the special menu. You can choose three courses from a great variety of items including soup, salad, pasta, seafood, risotto, etc. As I have been here for many times, I would share my experience with the lunch special. I had the minestrone soup - fresh, light, and hearty. People speak highly about their tapas sharing plates and pizza. You know this restaurant is a good one when they offer good soup although it's not their big items; they pay close attention to prepare fine quality food.  Truffle risotto is good with strong mushroom taste. If you are someone who loves mushrooms. I'd suggest to try. Otherwise, I'd suggest asparagus risotto or shrimps one that are both amazing. Not every place cooks good risotto but you can definitely trust this place.  The biggest compliment this place wins my heart is their seafood. I particularly recommend their steam clam and combination seafood. My picture is the combination seafood. The sauce is great, the seafood is fresh, and the bread is buttery and crispy from the grill. I know Midwest is not the best for finding seafood but you can trust this place.  If you are looking for a nice place to catch up with friends though, this place might be a bit crowded and loud for you. As their high quality food and service, lunch and dinner hours get very busy so sometimes the tables and chairs might feel a bit too tight.

W.O.W! Eat here. Done here. Experience here. Our server was literally the best ever. He was funny, patient, quick and accommodating. He literally took on the table of 7 tourists and guided us through the menu to have us sample delightful bite after bite. He even had the chefs make us Carbonara, not on the menu and it was some of the best I've ever had.  Some things of note: the meatballs and the goat cheese ricotta cheese spread. So beyond delicious. Add a little pepper to the cheese spread.  The polenta fries were ok but paired with their red pepper sauce and they went from ok to how many can I eat? The tomato soup was not what I expected but it had flavor for days and I could not stop eating it.  The wine red or white was perfection and free flowing.  Loved this place. Every employee rocked and really made the experience for us.

Food tasted great! Portions are sized for toddlers. Wish we would've known the portions were so small. Would've ordered an appetizer or a side dish. The dish was as big as the palm of my hand. Had to make a pit stop for some food to fill up on the way home.

Made reservations for this place for a friend's birthday and found it a bit uncomfortable to have not been able to sit at our table until ABSOLUTELY everyone was there. Needless to say, I do not understand the point of making a reservation if we are not going to be seated until an hour and a half later.  Anyways, since we had a group of about 10 people we were seated in a little private area which made the overall experience a bit better considering we weren't in the busy crowd outside. The limoncello martini is DELICIOUS if you love sweet and tart. I couldn't resist and needed to get another one. We went a little basic with our meal because we were in a time crunch due to the late seating and ordered a margarita pizza which was delicious. Cooked perfectly. For such a large group, I am thankful that the servers were able to be attentive and nice to us.  Definitely worth coming back to this place again. If you come with a big group.. MAKE sure you all get there the same time. In general, no matter how big the group of people try making a reservation because there are always a ton of people waiting in the front area for a table.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place during our short stay in River North since we were craving Italian food. We grabbed some seats at the bar so we wouldn't have to wait and the bartender kindly greeted us and got us started on some drinks. We ordered the gnocchi, meatballs, and two drinks. The food itself was very tasty! We love tapas and small plates so if you're into ordering a bunch of small dishes, you should definitely check this place out! There aren't many Italian restaurants serving tapas - I'm so used to having such large portions! Overall the ambiance is pretty nice. The only downfall would be the priciness of everything. I understand that tapas are supposed to be small, so if you're serving small portions the portion-to-price ratio should be more even!

How have I never written a review for Quartino before?! This is one of our go-to date night spots, and it consistently exceeds our expectations. The food is really delicious and an excellent value. It's not over priced like a lot of the other restaurants in this area tend to be. The servers here are extremely friendly, and knowledgeable on the menu. We always ask our server for recommendations since they know the menu best! The last time we came in we decided to sit at the bar and we were so glad we did! Our bartender Chris took care of us the whole time and kept us laughing! They also have homemade limoncello behind the bar which is a must. Oh, and the paperdelle with braised beef? MUST ORDER. This is one of those dishes that haunts my dreams and keeps me coming back for more!
Great customer service and food! Great portion sizes so you can split a couple dishes so you can try a few items!

Went there as a walk-in. Hostess quotes us 3hr wait or table on balcony with heaters. We took the table on balcony. Service was good, totally fine. Food was horrible. Glassware for wine was stinky. Eggplant parm had burnt cheese. The best part about it was that it was hot. Broccoli rabe was terribly overcooked.  Gnocchi was what my sisters wanted and it was the hardest pasta I've ever seen. Un-edible at best.  My son ordered pizza. I was mad at him for not wanting to eat it till my sister in laws had a bite and both said at the same time "it tastes like cardboard".  The best was the white bean spread.  If I cooked this food, I'd throw it away. Can't believe this place has 4 stars?

Holy Sh!t. Just left lunch here with a large group after having the most uncomfortable experience with a manager I have EVER had. I was sweating with anxiety. The woman seemed very emotionally expressive and was standing at our table for 5 long minutes "we blew it tell me what I can do!!!" While flailing her hands. Our entire table was trying to look into our laps. Wishing it would stop  it never stopped. She continued  and continued. It was embarrassing. I finally said "I feel very uncomfortable can I have our check?" She responds "I feel uncomfortable,"  seriously woman get a grip. This is not about you.   We were not even upset we just had been waiting 30 minutes for a dessert that we asked to cancel. Instead of just telling us that they didn't have the dessert available they tried to give us tiramisu half an hour later. We didn't want tiramisu but were completely fine with nothing.  There was some serious timing issues on our food. We received most dishes and hadn't gotten our vegetable dishes 40 minutes later. I ordered a second beef short rib and hadn't gotten in 30 minutes later so I asked to cancel it.   All the food was spectacular. Aside from the timing, but the dramatic display by this manager was just something else. I have never experienced such an uncomfortable interaction and likely will not ever return for the possibility of round two.

My husband was visiting Chicago tonight on business. He ordered pizza and apparently it slid off the plate . The pizza was replaced as well as there was no charge. My husband said it was the best meal he has had in a long time and Derek Kolb  was an outstanding manager. He plans to go this restaurant whenever he is in Chicago on business. We need a restaurant like this in Tucson if you are opening more locations.

I went at Quartino 1,5 months ago to celebrate my birthday. I had a great night, the food was delicious and everything was fitting perfect: the wine, music, ambiance and plus that i had a nice view because our table was next to the window, how i requested. Our server was great, he was checking us several time and making sure that we are not missing anything.  The night was a success

This is probably one of my favorite casual Italian restaurants in the city! My gf's and I have our annual valentines dinner here....4 years going strong! They are so consistent w/their dishes and services...I ALWAYS recommend Quartino's for those visiting from out of town too, its a great city vibe w/a tuscan feel.  Highly recommend.

Amazing food all imported from Italy with amazing staff and customer service this was such pleasant eating experience for us the second time around. The manager Alysia is one of the nicest people I've ever meet!! Definitely going back again!

Love the atmosphere of Quartino! It's fun, busy, good people watching and a good night out for a date or groups. The portions are a good size for mostly plates to share. I recommend the pasta and seafood over the pizza. I really like that you can order 1/2 bottles of wine. The problem is they are usually late seating with reservations when it gets busy. We had to wait about 30 minutes past our res time the last time we were there. Be prepared to possibly wait but it is usually worth it.

Not good. I don't know what the hype is about. The food wasn't gross just completely flavorless. It's like they've never heard of salt! We had 4 different dishes, eggplant parm, goat milk ricotta, porcini risotto and stuffed dates. The date were my favorite but nothing to write home about. Just not worth the calories or tummy space. Would much rather go else where! Staff was very nice but food was not

Yum!!! Go online and make a reservation bc it gets busy quick. I love everything about this place!!!! The bread is always great when you are starving from shopping all day. The house wine is such a bargain and delicious. I always get fondue and the octopus. Yummmmmmm I used to live closer now I only go when I'm really craving it- which is once a month.

We came here based on the reviews and quartino did not disappoint. We had a delicious dinner and ordered olives, polenta fries, the most delicious eggplant parm ever, awesome veal meatballs, delectable tortellini and delicious penne vodka. I think I will dream of the pasta and entrees they were that good. The donuts for dessert were also awesome. Everything was delicious. Our waitress could not have been nicer and multiple manager-esque people came over during our meal to make sure we were enjoying everything. The staff in this place were hustling! It was so busy but they brought the food and cleared away old plates so quickly and efficiently and everyone was so nice. We had a great time!

Every time I'm in Chicago , I try to hit this place . The outside sidewalk tables are a great place to people watch and have a bowl of seafood brodetto . Yum . Dip your bread In the broth or the yummy olive oil . The bathrooms are clean and look like they came from a different era . Beautiful place . Great service and yummy food . Prices are very reasonable too .  I Can't say enough good things about this place . I've never had a bad or even average experience there . Top notch  , all the way .
Great food (enough options for vegetarians) and wine! Ambience and service is good too.

We went for an 8:30 dinner reservation. We were sat pretty quickly. Almost immediately given bread that was amazing. We ordered the goat cheese ricotta and the baby artichokes. Delicious !! The. For our mains we had the truffle risotto and pizza. Both very good. The fontina and pesto were perfect on the pizza. We also ordered a bottle of the montelcino red . Very good and only 33 bucks. For sure going back soon
Food was decent but five stars for fantastic olive oil and balsamic vinegar, and really great service. Extensive wine selection and good dessert options.

Place is great.  Been several times.  Everything I had to eat was great.  Very crowded every time I go, but probably related to the fact that it's so good.  Bartenders Will and Maricio are awesome.  I come sit at the bar, and usually eat there, since dining room is a little cramped and very loud, and I'm hard of hearing.

This was a great way to spend lunch. My wife and I stayed downtown for a couple nights just blocks away and decided to hit this place up for lunch on Friday afternoon. We weren't disappointed! We enjoyed the prosciutto wrapped dates, beef short rib, and sausage risotto. All three were wonderful with the short rib being the highlight.  Cost was phenomenal! That is what put me over the edge of giving it a fifth star. For the two of us in this tapas style lunch it was $30. That can't be beat at this quality.
Good food. Good ambiance. Great spot for a date.  It does get busy so make reservations. Try their pizza -- delicious! Their bread and olive oil is also quite tasty. Enjoy!

Really good parts of meal and some not so great combine for three stars. Gluten free pasta is awesome - especially with the braised meat sauce. Brussel sprout salad was too tart and sugary for me. Colleague's pasta was a bit too firm. Chairs are not that comfortable and I thought the place smelled weird. Powdered soap in the bathroom is cool! Overall decent veg, and gluten free, menus.

My husband and I walked in for a reservation on a Tuesday evening at 6pm. Unfortunately there was no seating until 8:30pm unless we wanted to sit at the bar on a walk in first come first serve basis. We walked across the sidewalk to Embassy Suites where another Italian restaurant was super busy but the wait time was only an hour instead of 2 1/2. For what seemed like an eternity, we cancelled our reservation at the Embassy restaurant since there was over 3k reviews for Quartino which everyone seemed to be raving about.  Finally seated at 8:30, we ordered an app and soup each. The calamari was tender and crispy pairing well with the tangy marinara. He said the chicken with risotto soup was tasty. I had the minestrone soup which was a bit different. Full of white beans and no tube shaped macaroni. While still quite delicious, where the frick were my macaroni noodles? Did they forget it or was it Quartinos take on minestrone? Super speedy service and entrees were delivered quickly to the table. The bread was rather stale and nothing to write home about. They also think a 750ml water for 2 will do when the entrees are a tad bit salty. Rigatoni was not al dente, but rather undercooked as the kitchen was trying to spew out orders and the ground lamb was minimal as can be. The papparadelle was also undercooked and 1 long ribbon was drenched in stew like consistency topped with unforgivable Kraft Parmesan instead of fresh cheese cranked beside your table. Portions were on the small size even though the waitress insisted on how gargantuan the meals were and how most people share. I left still hungry after an appetizer, soup, and my 1 ribbon of noodle.  Overhyped "authentic" Italian fare. Perhaps it's better to just have a drink and order a charcuterie plate to share.
My go to after work restaurant. They are open late and have great service especially at the bar. Some of my favorites are: Lambrusco, sliders, tortellini & gelato with chocolate sauce.

I must confess- I judged a book by its cover, and almost left this place immediately after being seated. It was super packed and loud, we were seated at a tiny table, and I got the feeling it was going to be a chain-like Italian dining experience. I was wrong. The braised pork shank was fall of the bone amazingness. The house-cured Italian salami was some of the best I've ever had. Even the simple kale salad was delicious (although slightly overdressed). Our server Paul was great. I wasn't crazy about the first cheese that I ordered (pecorino), so without question, he brought me over my next choice of asiago (free of charge), which was perfect. He was attentive but not overbearing. The manager stopped by twice to check on us, which I thought was great considering how busy they were.  Overall, great spot! Check this place out.

Overall pretty good!  Everything is served tapas style which kind of stinks if you want to just order your own dishes because they will all come out at very different times.  Everything we had was really good. The short ribs were a good portion and was cooked perfectly. The tortellini had the perfect consistency and cheesy flavor. We had the zeppole for dessert, very soft and light, delicious!  Overall, the food and service was great! Just not a fan of the tapas style dining.

Favorite place for italian tapas. They have larger items too, but we like getting small portions. They have excellent fun atmosphere. This place is good for groups, they take reservations too. My Go-To spot for parties, meals before going out, and last minute dining that I want good food but didn't get a reservation in on time. They are open late too.  Fried calamari was cooked perfectly! Not cheat and over cooked, I could really feel the texture and sweet flavor of the calamari. Get the hot chocolate cake with vanilla gelato, it's delicious!

First of all the noise level: unbearable. We got there new year's eve and the place was obviously crowded and loud. But once seated, it was impossible to communicate with one another. Disclosure: We are Italian and we are quite picky with our food. We ordered three Margherita pizzas, one San Daniele and rucola, one orecchiette salsiccia e semi di finocchio, one polipo. Food quality was not great, pizza dough lacks, in our opinion, some salt. Pizza are not cooked over a wooden oven, so again lacking a bit of flavor. Octopus was average. Orecchiette, OK.  We arrived early and they were kind to accommodate us.  So... the ambience for us is a no go, given noise levels, but even if we passed that hurdle, we would not go for food.

I have absolutely no idea how this place received four stars. This is a tourist trap for people that have no idea what true Italian food tastes like. First of all the water glasses were filthy and the place has a dirty and cramped feel in general.  I ordered a very simple dish - spaghetti and one meatball, which had the diameter of a half-dollar coin for an extra $1.25. The only flavor in the tomato sauce was tin; no garlic, no oregano, not even a tomato flavor; completely bland.  The tiny meatball was flavorless, chewy and dry.  My Italian relatives would be embarrassed to serve this food.  My husband's Bolognese sauce was equally bland.  The pasta in both our dishes was unremarkable.  We're local and we gave this place a second chance.  If you want good Italian go elsewhere.  Even Magiano's, a national chain, is better.

Loved this place ! The ambiance is nice .. you can see the sausages hanging around. It gives you a homely kind of effect. We ordered a few small plates of chicken and seafood. All of them were great. Infact everything about this place is great. A must place to visit in Chicago !

Everything on the menu that we tried was absolutely amazing!!! The meatballs in pomadoro sauce was to die for!!! Made with organic tomatoes really comes thru in the flavor!! I highly recommend the Moloqo Plus cocktail. An adult eggnog!!!
Al Dante Italian food.  Friendly, prompt service and cute atmosphere. Gotta go for now, food is here!
Good food. Went for dinner on Saturday night with 6 friends. Shared a few plates and enjoyed it. Have only tried once. Don't know if would ever go again.

Absolutely one of the best dining experiences I have ever had! My son has a severe peanut/tree nut allergy and Chris our server went above and beyond to insure ever dish was safe!! That said we had a large selection of food everything we ate was excellent. I highly recommend this as the best Italian restaurant I've ever experienced.

I love this restaurant...I told the waiter right away that it was my favorite downtown and brought my friends from Wisconsin here to test it out...I was so disappointed with the service though...the waiter didn't come back to our table and we had to ask another lady for more bread and when we said thank you for the bill he just walked away...food delicious but service not so good

I have consistently had positive experiences here every single time I have visited. My most recent was last Friday with a small group for a friends birthday. We did let the server know that it was a birthday and they went over the top to make sure our experience was exceptional. I will always recommend this spot to anyone who asks and will be back much more! Thanks for all of your hard work and AMAZING food!

I've always like this place and still do for the service. Have tried a few things and have to say not that impressed with the food. However the service is awesome. I've tried the asparagus risotto before and that was not impressive.  So this time we ordered the charcuterie for 2. The plate was huge and pretty filling. Couple of cheeses with apricot jam. Surprisingly great combination. Chopped Beets, salami, prosciutto, eggplant pate, olives, raising bread, and something else which I can't remember. It was pretty filling. We also ordered the gnocchi with pesto sauce. Big disappointment. Gnocchi was  okay but the pesto has no taste and was borderline disgusting. I think it was just ground basil they forgot the pine nuts.  The place was super crowded on a snowy Saturday. But not sure I want to keep dealing with mediocre food even though I desperately want to love this place for the friendly ppl and great service.
Good gluten free menu. They even have gluten free crackers to serve with the cheese and meat plates. Pasta was tastey!

It was a pretty busy night so our server was a very slow. I ate my entire meal before my boyfriend got his but overall the food was excellent. The pasta dishes were smaller more like tapas style to share

Been here a couple of times with friends.  Always a good time. RSVP because is always busy, event with RSVP there is a wait. The place is huge and really loud not intimate. The food is good, nothing out of this world. The service is always good. The wine is cheap!

Quartino is my go-to for every occasion. Out of town friend...book club meeting...date night, it's Quartino.  The food is consistently on point with plenty of choices for all appetites and restrictions. And it fits my tiny budget like a glove (excellent bottle of red wine for only $15)!  Split the roasted octopus, dates wrapped in panchetta, and white bean and garlic spread with the table before diving into the Neapolitan pizza and house made pasta. You will go home full and happy (and not broke)!
It's definitely a great experience, the pepperoni pizza and seafood pasta is a great choice, martini is okay, I like their crowding and noisy environments .

We came here after a night of bar hopping, as this was the only restaurant/bar open at such a late hour and with all the reviews, we decided to give this place a try!  The place had a cozy feel to it and the host/server was very friendly. After we ordered our drinks and food, the place seemed to get packed pretty fast! I think the server got so caught up with the crowd that she forgot about our drinks! It took about 15-20 minutes for one beer and a few waters. We ordered about 5 items off the menu...and we were not impressed. :( the food was tasteless and it seemed we had to keep adding salt, pepper, or cheese to our dishes. I believe the only thing we all enjoyed was the tomato soup.  It took a long time for our server to come back to our table if we needed a refill or more napkins. We decided to just ask for the check and that even took a good 15 minutes. :(  Probably won't be coming back.

One of my favorite restaurants in all of Chicago! 1st review but I've been here several times. I've taken my Mom here, my girlfriend here, my friends here, you name it. Smallish Italian plates that are great for sharing in a very loud and lively atmosphere. You'll definitely want a reservation for a Friday or Saturday night, although the bar are is first come first serve. They can even accommodate larger groups: I was recently there with 12 + a baby and we got a private room! I'd say to aim for 1.5 to 2 dishes per person. There's lots of good things to try! Some personal favorites: -Gnocchi in pesto sauce -Tortellini with peas and prosciutto -Tagliatelle in bolognese sauce -Pizzas are neapolitan style and really good too For dessert the chocolate torta and zeppole (Italian delights) are delightful. You really can't go wrong at Quartino!

So I'm back AGAIN. Seen my fav manager Alysha again and that's always a good start to my visit coming here. She's a highlight to this restaurants forte.  So it's -5 outside today and I'm thinking pasta and coffee. I had an Uber to my condo in 20min. Our waiter Chris, always expeditious  Tantalizing Prosciutto dates  Unsurpassable paradelli  And that lava cake w/ coffee Home run for my belly tonight guys !!
Chicago staple. Small plates to share the awesome Italian dishes. The noise level is high, but adds to the energy of the place.

Really good Italian small plates - fun if you're with a group that you're comfortable sharing with, like I was. We got a few pasta dishes, the ricotta (SO good) and a pizza. We wish we had actually saved some room for more pizza, it was that good. Service was speedy and friendly, and the wine we got was delicious. I think the best part about this place is the value - everything was very fairly priced and we were very surprised at the final tab, considering we got a liter and a bottle of wine. All in all, good food and a great spot for a group that wants to be able to try a little of everything... all for a very affordable cost.

Tapas, Italian style! This was our first time at Quartino's, and it certainly won't be our last. We were seated at a small table in the room that fronts State Street. The room was dark, cozy, and intimate-the perfect ambiance for our date night. I suggest trying to get a table in here! It's better than the main dining room, in my opinion. We started with the dates wrapped in pancetta, delicious. Next was the wild arugula salad. It wasn't bad, but I was a tad underwhelmed. I was hoping there would be more farro. We then had the duck prosciutto. The prosciutto itself was great--salty and savory. It was served with a small pickled vegetable salad that was overly spicy and honestly, unnecessary. The shrimp dish was good, but the shrimp was overcooked. They weren't tender, as shrimp should be.  Now onto the highlights of the meal: pasta!! We had the tortellini and the orecchiette. The tortellini was served with Alfredo, parmesan, peas, and prosciutto and was literally to die for. It was clearly the highlight of the meal and one of the best pasta dishes I have had in quite some time. The orecchiette was served with a fennel sausage ragu and complimented and contrasted the tortellini well. Also, the pasta dishes here are quite large. I would say they are more entree sized than tapas sized. And then dessert. If you are going to get only one dessert, get the Gran Coppa Quartino. I'm assuming it's what they're known for. It's vanilla, strawberry, and chocolate gelato served in a martini glass with fresh berries and a giant biscotti. It was fantastic and the presentation was beautiful. We also ordered the zeppole. The zeppole was good, but it's a huge portion. I think it came with eight pieces.  My only complaint? They pretty much give you shot glasses for your wine. If I'm spending money on wine, it has to be able to breath!

Love this place! Tapas style so be ready to enjoy a bevy of different plates. Places like this its hard for me to share because I like to indulge, but I love the concept however. I will be back here again no doubt about that. Great service as well.

Just came into town this place was recommended to me by my cousin. He was right. The food is excellent here and the service was outstanding. They were able to get a table of five setup for us right when we walked in. The hostesses was very accommodating.

Came in on Tuesday evening was seated right away.   The place is packed and loud.  Delicious pasta but the mixed seafood dish (fruiti di mari?) is the star.  It's soooo good the calamari and octopus were really tender and fresh so is the clams and shrimp.  Soak the crispy bread in the soup and I can eat it all day! Get it you won't regret! Service was excellent as the waitress kept checking on us and asking if we need anything.  Manager alysia also dropped by at the end of the meal to say hi and introduce the $25 3 course lunch special.

This place was fantastic! Beautiful interior and great customer service. We had a meat and cheese plate and it was amazing. We let the chef choose what should be on the platter... Awesome! I also had tortellini with Prosciutto, and it was perfect! They don't serve you huge portions but what was served was perfect for me. The Italian beer was fantastic as well. Would definitely go back the next time I return to Chicago.

I enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant, and the service was prompt. There was so much on the menu, it was hard to choose! The bread was great, and they kept it coming! The caprese salad was good, but it was hard to share with 4 people, as there was not enough cheese compared to tomatoes. The tortellini with prosciutto was bland, honestly. We also had the shrimp risotto and quattro pizza, both which were good. The shining part of dinner was the dessert. We had both the donuts with honey and chocolate dipping sauce, and the lemon gelato sandwich. The lemon gelato was tart and refreshing, and the donuts were light and airy. Overall, for the price it was good, but this would not be my first choice of Italian restaurants.

Really not impressed with Quartinos. Family style restaurants are not really my thing, but I also did not enjoy the food. We ordered the Roasted Beet salad (yuck), Brussels sprouts (not noteworthy), a pasta dish that wasn't cooked enough, really dry chicken, and some other just "ehh" dishes. The sausage pizza was pretty good, though a little droopy. The one dish that I really enjoyed was the dates wrapped in pancetta, and there was also a steak or cut of meat that was pretty tasty. Overall though, I would rather go to a steak house and spend $30 on myself than eating a bunch of mediocre dishes that I split with my friends. Our reservation was also delayed about thirty minutes, and I was not impressed with the waiter. The guys who brought out the dishes were attentive and friendly, but our waiter did not provide helpful recommendations and he was rather curt.

Went back after a bizarre experience my first time and they really made up for it. Food was good and Alysia made sure we had a great meal. Will definitely bring my group back when we find ourselves in the area.
Tortellini was soooo good. I added chicken and my fiancé added meatballs. Highly recommend. Tomato soup was a little chunky for her but all in all we loved it. Great service too

Ravioli 3/5 delicious crispy bacon on top but the Ravioli itself is kind of blend  Supersamic 5/5 delicious!! Not too sour..just the way I like it Zeppole 3/5 it's the dark chocolate that does the trick...the dough was just...dough.. I would recommend to people who have never tried it but I wouldn't order it again  Waitress 5/5 very friendly and sincere and patient...wish I got her name~ Would definitely come back to try their other items on the menu
Italian tapas!? Where can I begin to even consider how friggin awesome your Margerita pizza is when shared about soon-to-be-bffs.  And wine in a carafe!? I'm in love.

Let me just start off by saying I've been here a million times. We had Lauren tonight as our waitress , and her recommendations were spot on. Not to mention she was very attentive and was very helpful in choosing food items. I always have a great meal here, but Lauren's service was above and beyond . Will be returning as always , but hope to get Lauren as a waitress again! -table 39 on Saturday 11/26 at 7pm (want to make sure I have the right Lauren :)
Every time I am in Chicago I try to make time to come here, my absolute favorite place in Chicago.

I took my girlfriend here for her birthday. I made a same day reservation,  came early for a drink at the bar,  and we were set at a perfect table toward the back of the dinning room that allowed us to talk and be comfortable. The service was fantastic, the food was amazing,  and the price was perfect.  The ambiance and decor are so fun, the facilitues are clean and stylish, and the whole experience was exactly what I hoped for.
Love the place! It's huge, very authentic. Tomato soup is a must have! Linguine with clams - delicious! Service is great!

If I could give Quartino 10 stars I would. My parents and I were in Chicago in July of this year for a Cubs game and after researching restaurants I made a reservation here. SO GLAD I DID. One of the best meals we have ever had. Started out with the Salumeria tasting which was an absolute delight. We chose roasted vegetables, cheeses, meats...the olives. Wow. They also brought out polenta sticks on the house - which was a nice surprise! My dad had pizza; mom ravioli and I had the spaghetti and added meatballs. Wine of course, was the perfect addition to the meal. Mom and Dad split dessert and I finished with a glass of Prosecco. And having to unbutton my pants. HA! Make a reservation for a culinary experience that is very similar to my Nona.
great food and amazing service. The food is reasonably priced and the portions are great . Always my go to in chicago

Quartino provided a great atmosphere and fantastic food. I imagine it is difficult to get in here during the dinner rush as we sat down at 10 PM and still required a reservation, not to mention all the tables were still very full.  The wine pricing and selection offers diners an easy avenue for trying and sharing wines to appropriately pair with the various tapas you inevitably order. As someone with italian heritage who equally loves tapas-style eating, Quartino perfectly fit the bill! The menu options are great and it truly appears you cannot go wrong with whatever you order. Personally I drooled over the osso buco and the octopus the most. The meatball sliders were delicious. The penne vodka was okay, I think the sauce was a little weak, so I would not recommend that dish specifically (however, I am pretty biased because I make a killer vodka sauce). I would DEFINITELY eat here again.

I absolutely loved this place! Went here on a Thursday night (around 8:30) with a big group of 11 people(with reservations of course) to celebrate my birthday. We loved the liters of wine and the sharing style tapas and ate so much. Our two waitresses were Megan and Tori (or Hannah?) (I called this morning to double check the names and they said Megan and Tori but our receipt said Hannah so not sure). Either way, they were so sweet, funny, and accommodating despite how wild my friends can get. They even brought me an (interesting) ice cream dessert for my birthday!! (If you're looking for a laugh and are a lil bit immature, ask for the bachelorette dessert for your friend if it's their birthday) It was one of my best birthdays ever because of quartinos. Thank you guys for a great night!

We stumbled upon this restaurant by mistake and it was a wonderful surprise! Even though they were very crowded they were able to seat us immediately. It was packed but we got a wonderful table outside. It was very romantic and reminded me of being in Italy. The food was very delicious and homemade and came quickly! We got a Neapolitan style pizza, asparagus risotto, and eggplant Parmesan. This wonderful restaurant is one of the places we are excited to come to again!
awesome
Tasty pizza and appetizers  Decent wine selection Loud atmosphere and buzzing place- a very good sign as many people come here to visit
Service was ok but the food is horrible. The quality of food was extremely disappointing. I have never had a bad meal in Chicago until Quartino. Go to Eataly instead!!

This place is best for lunch and it can get really tight and loud during dinner. The food is great and meant to share with your table. Portions are good sizes for the price, ensuring you can try a lot of different things. Great wine to pick from in all different sizes. Don't miss out on the olives!

Amazing meal and amazing service! This preggo lady is in Chicago for work and squeezed into a crowded and boisterous bar area, the service was quick and really friendly. I had an arugula and orange salad with a half order of Neapolitan meatballs, with raisins--absolutely wonderful. I took dessert back to my hotel and am super full and satisfied, italian donuts to dip in dark chocolate...just what the baby bump asked for.
Was in Chicago for a conference and a friend took me to this little gem.  The atmosphere was great and the Quattro Formaggi pizza was just like I remember the last time I was in Italy.

We had reservations, but still had about a half hour wait because our table wasn't ready yet- which can happen anywhere.  Understnandable.  It would have been more tolerable had there been somewhere to stand out of the way and wait, but tis Chicago.  The place was absolutely packed, we stood in the entry/foyer area by the hostess stand because they call your name old school style and we didn't want to miss our table.  Would have been nice to get a text when table is ready or pager system.  They had a few large groups so that probably added to the crowd or that's just how this place always is.  The hostess was gracious and made rounds to everyone waiting assuring them they weren't forgotten about which I thought was a nice touch.  She was also able to snag us a complimentary bottle of champagne for our group and an awesome mocktail for my pregnant friend. I've had long waits at other restaurants and I'm happy enough for an apology or updated ETA.   I thought this was a nice and classy touch but not going to sway me to go somewhere should the food absolutely suck or something along those lines.   They didn't have wine glasses; I hate drinking wine out of a regular glass.  I get that you're trying to be trendy, but that's wine 101 to get optimal flavor.  I did like their wine pricing- they do glasses, carafs, liters, etc.  All are proportional and you don't get a discount for larger quantity, meaning you can order multiple different wines and not be penalized that you didn't stick with the same one and order a large vat of it.  Dishes were moderately priced, some tasted better than others.  The pappardelle al sugo di manzo was a hit with the entire group.  The gnocchi was a little bland tasting, needed a stronger sauce or more seasoning or something.  The eggplant parmesan was mushy and had-dare I say it-too much cheese.
The food is good, not amazing, but this is the PERFECT place for large groups.  It's reasonably priced, well located and good service and ambiance.

The food here is so good and fresh! I came here because I saw on a website they were good for people with food allergies. This place went above and beyond to take care of me. They told me anything I wanted on the menu they could make for me free of my allergens. I was even able to get dessert, which with a dairy and egg allergy is unheard of for me. I love this place!!

I've been to Quartino twice and I like it a lot. They offer a huge menu of affordable Italian tapas- come expecting to share food and leave picky friends at home. The vibe is trendy, service is good, but it's a little loud.  Food rundown: Sopprestta and provolone cheese plate- really tasty and a good deal for the price. Served with unique garnishes. Definitely recommend picking a meat and cheese on the menu to start.  Orange and arugula salad- fruit was fresh and the salad was light, but it's probably not worth it. Save your money for more pasta.  Spaghetti pomodoro- meh. A sign of a good Italian restaurant is that the most simple dishes are incredible, and this one missed the mark.  Tortellini- really delicious. Definitely recommend sticking with their fresh pasta dishes. While it's heavy, I could have eaten a whole plate.  Profiteroles- big portion, high quality ice cream and chocolate syrup. Worth it.  Would definitely come back to Quartino again and again, but would look elsewhere if I'm in the mood for authentic, classic Italian food.

I came with my girlfriend on a Friday night and had a really great experience. We started with a small meat and cheese  plate. The soppresatta was especially delicious.  We shared the arugula salad. The orange slices and hazelnuts made for a very interesting flavor combo.  We had two pastas: the spaghetti and the tortellini. The spaghetti was just ok, pretty basic and probably not something I'd get again, but definitely not bad. The tortellini were bomb. They were served with prosciutto that melted in your mouth. The waiter was a nice dude. Restaurant was very noisy, not somewhere I'd go for a first date, but it was a fun atmosphere.

Still amazing food. We started at the bar and the bartender let me taste the wine before ordering. Our open table res was running behind .... so that was a bummer. Great service and food made up for it.... pasta, pizza, calamari.../ food coma!

This was my second trip to Quartino, and both times very happy with the food and the staff! It is a bit on the pricier side, but for groups or a celebratory dinner it's a great choice. The only bad things I found was that a) the dining room feels a little cramped and b) it gets SO loud. I don't know, maybe something about the acoustics (I've been in other crowded restaurants, don't remember the noise level ever getting quite that high) but both times we found it difficult to hold a conversation much of the evening for that reason. Ah well I still overall enjoyed visiting. I'd recommend it!

My first time with tapas. I'm so glad I came here to experience it! It's a beautiful place, the host is beyond amazing, attentive, and a great conversationalist. The food-TO DIE FOR! I haven't tasted food this good since my grandmother was alive and cooking. You HAVE to try the meatballs. They're literally the best thing I've ever eaten. So good, I ordered a second plate. Outstanding in every way possible. If I could rate higher, I would!
Standard food, but nothing spectacular. Definitely over priced and the service wasn't good enough to make up for it. We went here for a work event so maybe that's why. Would not return.

When this place first opened, almost a decade ago, the food and wine was fantastic. Admittedly, it was probably most fun for the loud scene, and the ambiance that the Gibsons Group are known to create. Here's the issue: 1. The quality has gone way down on the food, as have the portions. 2. The beverage offerings have gone down even more. They plain suck, and lack any variety that Italy has plenty to offer, at reasonable prices.  3. The hostess team is clearly lost. They can't handle the door volume. It shows, and it creates unneeded issues in the small space people wait in, at the front door.  This place feeds on the tourist crowd with the hotels that surround it. They also have a tendency to bribe concierges to send you here, so be wary of that if a concierge seems overly excited to 'get you in here'.

I came here last Thursday night for dinner.  Booked through OpenTable so it was an easy process.  I was with two other people and we split a bottle of wine, margarita pizza, gnocchi, polenta fries and some sort of seafood stew that came with bread.   Polenta fries were not my thing but they are super popular so I can't knock them too much I just didn't think they had any flavor at all.  The gnocchi was very dense and flavorless but the sauce added something to it.  The pizza and the seafood dish were awesome though- the basil on top the pizza was absolutely perfect. I think overall this is a solid River North spot and I'd definitely come back, I just probably wouldn't order some of the things I did this time, next time.

Quartino - is notorious for its distinctive Italian small-plates, awesome old school decor and a fun staff with a ton of buzz anytime, day or night. A great spot for a family dinner, date night or a fun Late night out with friends. ...and seats all through the bar, if you want to relax and enjoy a beverage before being seated. Or ask for the menu, pony up and enjoy! One of the best Bar atmospheres in Chicago. What's a good Italian Restaurant without a Salumi and Formaggi plate (Meat and Cheese)! My go to is the Prosciutto San Daniele and the Soppressata a MUST! For the Formaggi  Gorgonzola and the Parmigiano Reggiano Vacche Rosse, WOW! Super fresh and Super Good! Next we move on to the Roasted Baby Octopus...one of my favorites. I have eaten at Quartino every time I am in Chicago for YEARS and is always cooked perfectly, the spicy flavor is out of this world. I have eaten at some of the TOP seafood restaurants in the WORLD and by far this could be the best. Time for the#1 at Quartino...The OSSO BUCO! I owned an Italian Restaurant and this was my BEST dish! It takes love to make a good Osso Buco and Quartino shows it.. and MORE! If you have to only try one dish, this is it at...

Quartino is a fitting name because this is the food equivalent of listening to a child poorly play the e flat clarinet. Squeeky, grating, a bit painful at times. With so much italian food in the city I can hardly say this is worth a stop (check out Piccolo, Monte Verde, etc instead)

Quartino restaurant was recommended by one of the locals during our trip to Chicago. The ambience was of old Chicago and place was filled with customers. We tried three dishes from there menu, the House made Goats milk Ricotta  that came with bread and honey , Broetto Ai Frutti di Mare (shrimps,clams,calamarii, Octopus, & Whitefish Simmered in Aqua Pazza with San Marzano Tomatoes)on pasta, and finally a Beef Short rib in salsa verde. I have to say everything we ordered was amazing and Quartino is now one of our must stop restaurants anytime  we are visiting  Chicago. By the way let me tell you the service was also excellent they had up to three host walking the floor atttending to all the customers. One last thing, I do recommend a reservation.
The pastas are not good.  I would only entertain going back to casually meet some friends for some pre-dinner meats and cheeses.  I would not eat a meal here again.

This is an awesome find! The food was delicious the atmosphere was awesome and service was great. Amanda, our server, was friendly and helpful. What a great personality! We enjoyed our evening on the balcony with excellent food and great wine. our water was kept full, and empty dishes removed by the busser. One of the other servers actually stopped by to chat about my dessert that I had, and a manager checked on us during our meal. The restroom attendant was very friendly as well. I would definitely recommend a visit to this awesome restaurant!

Always a pleasure to be back, love their small plates ( not over priced ) especially tortellini and truffle pasta dish! Sooo good, always try something new. Was not a fan of their clams seamed a bit chewy, but their calamari wore fried to perfection. Service usually really good, unless they are busy ( witch is very understandable) Do yourself and others a favor, if it is a busy night order a bottle of wine rather mixed cocktails and few food items, instead of one dish at the time :)
Service was just okay. The food left something to be desired. Good atmosphere to bring friends to share.

Overall a good experience.  We had a reservation on a Saturday night.  It was crowded but we were seated immediately.  Food was good.  I had tortellini, my wife had osso bucco and my aunt had sausage and peppers.  All were good.  Portions are reasonable but not typical U.S. huge.  We also had dessert which was good Zeppoelle and profiteroles which were very tasty and very large and shareable.   My one negative is that the place is very loud so having a conversation is tough.

I came here a few months back with my friend for her birthday and we were pretty disappointed by the sub par food here. HOWEVER, after having been kindly reached out to by the staff and assured a wonderful experience, we decided to give Quartino another go. I left the restaurant with a full stomach and happy heart. We were sat at a table near the kitchen which was nice and roomy which I appreciated as the rest of the building was packed. The manager and wait staff were extremely attentive and friendly. They made sure our experience was great as well as the food.  We started out the meal with some bread (I still feel like the bread they give you at the table isn't that great, but the rest of the food made up for that) and some seasonal cocktails. I had a pumpkin spice mai tai and my friend got a moroccolo (or something like that!). Both were pretty boozy but delicious.  Next some appetizers were brought out for us. A toast with a DELICOUS fluffy goat cheese spread, bacon wrapped blue cheese filled dates, and a meat platter with (I believe) pickled onions of some sort. All of the appetizers were delicious, especially the meat sampler and goat cheese.  For entrees we went with fettuccini (homemade noodles, yum!) and the shrimp risotto. Both delicious. The alfredo sauce was light and not too overpowering. The risotto was heavy but nice and creamy. Portions were a bit small but that was fine because we had so much other food. For dessert, the manager sent us THREE different things to try. The warm donuts with dark chocolate and honey dipping sauces were nice and fluffy. The dark chocolate dipping sauce was incredible! The tiramisu was rich and fluffy and moist and was exactly what we were craving. Best of all was lemon cream gelato sandwiched between some sort of lemon cookie/cake on top of a lemon curd that I could eat spoonfuls of. So good! I felt like a queen and a food critic at the same time with the variety and amount of delicious food that was sent our way. The staff here was so kind and I am so glad to have given this place another chance.  Thank you Quartino for an amazing dining experience, and thank you to Alysia for having us. I realize that everyone has their off days and that my dining experience the first time didn't correctly reflect the quality of food here. I will definitely be returning here for another meal due to the quality of food and the genuine staff.

I chose this place for my birthday dinner while I was traveling for business up in Chicago. The guys on my team never let me pick and put up a big fuss when I picked a "tapas" place, thinking it was "chick food" and they wouldn't get enough. Well tough luck boys, it's MY day!  Luckily we all walked out of Quartino completely stuffed and loved every course. We started with their Salumi selection and had the waitress bring her choices of meats, cheeses, and accompaniments. I also got us some malbec to enjoy - the wine list is super cheap and approachable ($40 for 1 LITER? Yes please!), but they also have a full bar.  We then each ordered a pasta dish and a couple of other items (pizza, shrimp) to all share. It is true that the plates will come out at various times so it's best to share with everyone so no one is left out when the food comes to the table. Everything was great, but my favorite was the tortellini with prosciutto.  There was a little mishap with the shrimp order where it was delayed and then came out incorrectly. The waitress was so concerned over it when we brought it to her attention that she took it off our bill and comped all of our desserts! Speaking of dessert, I ordered the off-menu tiramisu which was the best I've ever had in my entire life. Others ordered limoncello, house-made gelato, the gelato cookie sandwiches, and cannoli.  Long story short, the guys on my team now request Quartino at least once a week. Win-win! The owner said that they were considering opening up in Frisco down here in Texas! Do it!!

Have been here twice now and really do like it. They serve everything tapas style and the waitstaff are always willing to give helpful suggestions for pairings and portion sizes. Great cheese and meat selections and the seafood dishes are worth ordering. On our last visit, we got, in addition to a selection of meats and cheeses, the 4 fromaggi pizza. It comes out piping hot: simple and delicious. The atmosphere is fun and italian with all the waitstaff wearing italian jerseys and adidas shoes. The staff are also very accommodating in terms of seating. They always give cute postcards  to you with the check that I love! Would like to come back for dessert sometime!

Best Italian food I've had since I was in Italy. What a great restaurant. If you are into a lively fast and busy atmosphere serving amazing authentic Italian food this is your dig. We ordered Polplette al sugo di pomodoro (veal meatballs in tomato sauce with basil and ricotta) Quattro Stagioni pizza and Pappardelle al sugo de manzo (Tuscan pasta ribbons with braised beef in tomato sauce) and tiramisu(not on the menu). Everything was cooked perfect and full of flavor. The manager was great and even offered us some complementary wine on the house. Love this place and will be returning soon!
A good tapas restaurant with pleasant atmosphere and drinks. Excellent service all around. I liked all the dishes that my friends ordered.

My husband and I were in Chicago visiting family for our 30th anniversary. Quartino was recommended to us by the Bellman at our hotel. We had such an amazing experience. The restaurant is definitely loud and boisterous, which can add to the fun. Because there were only two of us, the host kindly sat us at a secluded table for two. Our server was extremely knowledgable about food and wine. He recommended the Salumi and helped us pick it out. We had a yummy salad, pasta and a pork shank entree, all of which were so flavorful and perfectly cooked. In addition, I am on crutches and had to ask to find the bathroom. The manager that I asked so kindly led me to the bathroom to make sure I did not slip and then guided me back to my seat. We were thoroughly impressed by the entire experience and will definitely do it again!!

We stopped by here for a late lunch in the summer and enjoyed a quiet meal outside.  We started out with grilled seafood, which was slightly charred, but tasted good.  We then ordered a Margherita pizza and Tagliatelle alla Bolognese.  The pizza tasted fresh and perfect after a long day sight seeing.  The Tagliatelle alla Bolognese was very filling and flavorful.  Overall, enjoyed our meal.

This place was recommended to me by a local (I was traveling on business from out of state and went by myself).  A bit of a cluster to get a seat (especially by myself), but found a small high table by the bar.  I wanted Chicken Parm (my favorite).  Not on the menu, but of course they make it.  However the Tagliatelle Bolognese sounded good.  I asked my waitress which I should get.  She said to get the Chicken Parm with a half order of the Bolognese.  Both were excellent.  Somehow I had room for dessert:  Warm chocolate cake with vanilla gelato.   All excellent.  Would definitely recommend and would definitely come back.

Went here for a working lunch and managed to snag a small room for 10 people.  It was absolutely wonderful.  The food was great, the service extraordinary and the atmosphere calming.  Can't wait to go back.

Delicious Italian food! My friends and I were dining there for dinner on Saturday night and were seated in the 2nd floor room. I must say this place is very noisy! My friends who were out of town couldn't take the noise and we had to finish our dinner sooner than expected. It is a fun place for sure but I think for younger clientele. They were very busy. They have wonderful owen baked pizzas on a thin crust! Prices are reasonable.

Quartino is great for groups so I've been many times for birthdays, bachelorette parties, family dinners, etc.  They are very accommodating with large groups and provide quality service for so many people.  It's also a great place because the atmosphere can either be dressed up or dressed down, anything goes.  There are so many different options on the menu that it can be overwhelming at first glance.  Luckily the portion sizes aren't too big so you can order multiple items without having too much.  I really liked the pappardelle and ravioli.  They only downfall is that the food comes out as it is prepared so depending on what you order everyone may be eating at different times which can be awkward.  They also have gluten free options if you need that accommodation for your group. I will definitely come back with more big groups because it's classic Italian food and you can't beat the prices.

Girls from work highly recommended it but it's been 6-7 years and I'd have to assume it's under new management or has went downhill.  It was very busy and it was a cute place .. and they got us seated right away without reservation.  The service was fine and they gave free postcards which was nice touch.  But we dine out to have good food and thats where they really missed the mark.             This is were the happy ends .. the food was  across the board lack luster ... we added salt to everything which never has happened at any restaurant.  The portions and price was small which is fine .. gives you chance to order a few things and share around.  But the food was flat out bland and disappointing ..  we were in town for 9 days so plenty of opportunity to try other places. I am shocked the majority of the reviews are favorable.
I love all of the food. All of it. I love the decor and ambiance. I love Italian everything and I love this place. The risotto - yes. The burrata - yes. Everything - yes.

I am SO torn about this place- on the one hand, the food was fantastic. But on the other, the atmosphere. My god. My ears are practically still ringing from the noise caliber. I made a reservation here for dinner, and the place was packed. We had to wait a few minutes to be seated, and were walked upstairs and seated in the back room, smack between a large party of about 16 women on one side and a large party of about 10 people on the other. Our table was also shoved against a wall with a shit ton of stuff on it (plates, plate holder, etc) when the table was pretty small in size to begin with, and it was next to the kitchen so my chair was either kicked or in the way of every single person going in and out of the kitchen (due to the narrowed walking space because of the large 16 lady party).  Both parties on either side of us were SO extremely loud, to the point that they were all literally yelling to each other and shouting over each other to be heard. My husband and I were so incredibly irritated. Who yells in a restaurant? And who does it with zero respect for the other poor victims who were sat near you? There were 2 gals clearly trying to have a girls night out dinner and those poor souls were sat behind us so they had to deal with the noise too. I heard them complain to the manager, but she offered really no sympathy. The noise literally ruined what was supposed to be a nice celebratory dinner for my husband and me, and we couldn't wait to eat and get the hell out and find somewhere quieter to get dessert.  Pappardelle- delicious. It's my fave kind of noodle, and the sauce was hearty Sausage risotto- really good and creamy. Sometimes risotto can be too chewy but this was cooked to perfection Cheese tortellini- decadent alfredo sauce, great chewiness It's too bad that the noise level is so awful, this could be a great place. Perhaps some of the other seating areas are quieter, but I don't think we'll be back

Unbelievable! We've been a few time and it defiantly is a stop when we go to Chi Town a few times a year. Small portions delicious to pass around the table. There were 6 of us again and we each got a taste of each plate. I think we got at least 8 or more things on the menu in which were tasty. Meatballs, spaghetti, sausage, veal, huge meat and cheese platter, octopus, gnocchi and a few more.  The drinks were good too. Staff was pleasant and accommodating. Def a place to try.

I genuinely hate giving restaurants terrible reviews, but the food here was just awful, mediocre at best. My boyfriend and I flew in from NYC for the Chicago Marathon and were looking for some delicious pre-race pasta. Instead, we found cold, bland, and undercooked pasta served with a side of poor service.  We checked in for our reservation right on time and were told to wait for just a moment.  I noticed several tables being seated immediately upon checking in, so I asked the hostess for an update.  She simply told us that she already called us several times and that we missed our table. Given that we were standing literally in front of the check in the entire time, I don't see how this was possible. Not a big deal, but an apology instead of some made-up excuse would have been nice.  As for the food, we ordered the arugula salad (pretty good, but can't say I've ever seen anyone botch a salad), minestrone soup (bland and lukewarm), tagliatelle bolognese (cold, clumpy, cardboardy), and truffle porcini risotto (flavorful, but cold). Both pasta and risotto dishes were entirely undercooked to the point where they still tasted grainy and almost crunchy.   On the bright side, our waitress was really sweet and got us in and out of there in under 45 minutes.  Super disappointed in such a well-reviewed place, to say the least.

You can never go wrong with this place. Great for groups, takes reservations and everything on the menu is delicious. Something for everyone, and pricing is super reasonable! I love their pizzas so great, fresh out of the oven to your table. Everything comes as it is prepared.  I love the cavatellis with fresh burrata. Simply incredible. The regular meatballs with red sauce are a must along with the sausage sooo much flavor! For desserts you cannot leave without ordering the Nutella panini, mind blown, I could eat the whole order myself (and it is decent sized). Zeppolini and the profiteroles are another recommendation.  The fondue is good and I personally like dipping the other desserts in the fondue. Mmmm This is a fun casual atmosphere, kind of loud, but a good time none the less and always someplace I stop when I am in town.

This place really does live up to the hype!!! I went here recently with my parents and some relatives. I was somewhat skeptical because it looks like an old-timey Chicago joint, and I had the impression that it was good "back in the day," but maybe not so cutting edge anymore. I have to say, the food here is exquisite. They have such a great selection of classic and contemporary Italian cuisine, and it's all made with the best ingredients and to perfection. The service here is also some of the best in town. I really appreciated how attentive they were, and how upscale they keep things. A quick FYI: This place is a bit like Italian tapas, it's family style, and so can get slightly pricy. But definitely 100% worth it. (And I don't say that often).

The food was great at Quartino.  We had several small plates that we shared, including desert.  The deserts were amazing and the expresso was too.  The upstairs was decorated with some cycling memoribilia that was worth checking out if you're a cyclist.

The food is good. Others have discussed it. I really care more about atmosphere. They have a lot of seating room. But it is LOUD. SO LOUD. If you want to talk -- in this case, I was introducing my mom to some of my friends -- go somewhere else. This is for tipsy yellers only. I really can't think of a time in which I would want to have to sustain conversation at a decibel level required for even basic communication inside this establishment.

OVERRATED. Beyond disappointing. We live a couple blocks away and have passed by a lot - but never went in. Finally, we had a perfect chance and dined with four friends. We ordered about 10 dishes total, from salads (tuscan kale) to pastas (gnocchi, risotto, spaghetti, pappardelle, cavatelli) and meats (veal, chicken). None were good except the Cavatelli. All were overpriced and VERY small. It was insanely loud. I don't know why this place is popular. Our friend can't have cheese (dietary restriction) and her dish was brought out with cheese. To make matters worse, she was the last person served by a long shot and we had all finished by then. She sent her dish back for no cheese. We all wanted 30 more minutes (on a weeknight) for a no-cheese pasta dish. Also, the Porcini Mushroom & White Truffles: Glop in a bowl for $15... what? Insane.  DO NOT GO HERE.  oh, my fiancé liked the atmosphere.  This is the first bad review I've ever written.

Quartino's is a great place for a nice dinner with some broke college students .  Its easy to get to from UIC and the atmosphere is so warm and inviting.  Be warned that you cant check in for your reservation until all of your guests are present, but we got our table quickly after they showed.  The waitstaff is relaxed but attentive and they work efficiently without stressing you out.  I got the linguine with clams and it was such a blessing.  Close to 15 whole clams with extra meat in there made it so well worth the $13.50 i paid.  The pasta was perfectly al dente and the red sauce had a tang with a solid finish making the entire dish really filling.  They claim their portions are meant for sharing, but I would argue the pasta dishes are not nearly big enough to be family style, maybe just a few extra bites per person.  They were also good about honoring our request for the "special birthday surprise" (look through some of the photos, youll get it ) and the dessert was delicious! Sweet thick vanilla gelato sandwiches between huge puffy prefiteroles covered in a thick chocolate sauce.  Overall, great experience with a great value. P.S. The managers (or who im presuming) were really sweet and took the time to talk to every table of people.  Thats a very rare experience and I just wanted to give them a shout out!

We reserved a big party and I expected a table to seat about 20 people. I even spoke with the restaurant multiple times.  When more than half my party arrived on time, the table wasn't ready. On top of that, they split up our tables so that we didn't even sit together. What's the point of a reservation? The servers were nice but rushed us completely. Our waiter rushed us but the waitress was nice and pleasant. She was the only highlight. Outside of ruining my wife's birthday, the food is mediocre. There are plenty of other good choices and we only came here because this was the first place we met. But if we were picking for any other reason such as food, service, and ambiance, we would've chosen any place else. This is the last time we are going here and will be sure to tell all of our friends to avoid it. Severely overrated.
great for a group and fantastic food

Love visiting Chicago. Always stay downtown.  My wife and I stopped in for beers and a pizza. Service was outstanding. Food was delicious. Had a pizza with calamari.   It's a little loud ......but it was a Saturday night and packed.  Cool atmosphere ... I recommend dining here.  You won't be disappointed.

I came here with 3 friends during lunch and got 2 pizzas: the Margherita and the Quatro Formaggi. The pizzas were both super delicious. The crust was very thin and I thought the dough really made it.   The entire meal was very filling and 2 pizzas was definitely enough for 4 people.  The meal all together cost less than $30 and was definitely the tastiest and cheapest meal I've had in a while.
What a neat place. Food was neat, servers were neat, ambiance was pretty neat. Overall, kinda neat experience.

It really depends on what you're looking for but if you want authentic, tasty Italian tapas - this is not the place for you. It was overly crowded/ very loud and was very Americanized Italian food. Don't order the bruschetta for sure.  The servers were nice enough but this was a generic factory style restaurant that I would totally skip.

Ah freaking amazeballs. The service here is impeccable. From the hostess, to the server. (Scott) Food A#1. Vodka martini with REAL AS SH*the blue cheese....Best EVER. Can't say enough. Go here, now. Yes, it's an order. :)

Came here on a Friday night around 7:00pm and while the place was packed, we didn't have to wait for a table. It's sharing style. For two, we ordered the burrata cheese with beet salad, veal meatballs, polenta fries and cavatelli. It was a lot of food! Everything was so delicious, the service was great. Highly recommended.

WORSE ITALIAN FOOD EVER.... Margarita pizza were sweet like honey n tomato sauce tasted like vinegar on it. Cheese was none existent..,, Gnocchi was salted potato and sauce was so bad I had to send it back twice.... Chicken Parmesan was so bland that it tasted like just came from freezer to microwave to table.... Do not visit here...

I have been here a few times and have always had great food/drinks. First off, the restaurant is huge inside and is always packed! Great place to host a birthday dinner, the tapas style sharing is perfect for a large party or a small party. I honestly cannot remember what I have ordered from here because I've tried pretty much every dish, however, everything is good. The only downfall is the front desk gets overwhelmed when it's busy and they can mix up reservations, which creates longer waiting times. Other than that, this is a great place to visit if you go to the city.

My manager and coworkers flew in from out of town, and Quartino is where we had our team dinner (14 people.) Obviously we made a reservation for 5:30, which ended up being a good time before it started getting gradually louder through the night. Service was eccellente for our large group, and the food was delizioso! Other Italian restaurants typically overwhelm you with dishes that can feed a small army, but Quartino takes a different approach by creating dishes that serve 1-3 people. This way you can order multiple dishes and eat family style. Also, orders come out as they are ready from the kitchen. No waiting for everybody's orders to be complete all at once. The waiter and staff were incredibly friendly and took the time to explain the menu and answer any questions we had. A few of us got curious about the cured meats (made in house) along with the equipment near the kitchen. Our waiter invited us to the kitchen and gave us a tour. We met the executive chef and they took the time to show us how things were run even with it being busy on a Tuesday evening. We were all very pleased with the entire evening. The red sauce pastas were perfect, and weren't swimming in sauce. The pizzas (especially the margherita) were baked wonderfully. I can't wait to come back to Quartino. I wish more restaurants were this friendly and good!

I typically do not write reviews good or bad, but in this instance I wanted to give a shout out to the gentleman who was the bathroom attendant last night. I placed my sunglasses on the counter and forgot to put them back on.  About 20 minutes passed, and he found me at my table before I ever noticed.  The food was also very good along with a very personable and friendly waitress.  Kudos on having a great team and good food.
Nailed it again. Great service. Great food. Clean restaurant. My wife and I love this place. Good joint. Will be back.
This place is good for big parties.  Food is okay and wine is okay.

Great lunch special for two people! Only $25 for three generous courses. Food was really good and authentic. Great ambiance. Food took a little while, but our waitress told us everything was made to order and came out as ready. It was our anniversary, so a bit surprised they didn't acknowledge that at all. Overall great experience and I would highly recommend this place!

Let me begin my review by saying that we shared our feedback with the manager at the end of our meal, and she went above and beyond to make it right, so we left happy. But still, all 5 of us were disappointed with the meal itself (and, to a lesser extent, the atmosphere), so I'm still leaving this 2-star review to let others know of our experience.  (reviews of individual dishes are at the end)  The atmosphere - this is a casual place and quite loud (the acoustics, not loud music). If you're expecting an elegant or even classy place, this isn't it. Some of our fellow diners were wearing NFL jerseys, and I was literally hoarse at the end of the meal from having to raise my voice to talk.  And finally, it was expensive!! They took a LOT off our bill, and it was still $35 per person. That included tip (on the full bill of course) & tax, as well as 2 drinks each.  All in all, Nonnino - a couple blocks up the street - is a MUCH better choice for a great Italian dinner experience.  And now to the disappointing food. We ordered 8 or 10 dishes, and the only one of them that was universally enjoyed was the grilled octopus. Well, and also the olives! LOL The rest of what we ordered fell short:    * dates wrapped in pancetta - not good. They were small, and the pancetta used was just not the right flavor combination for a date * veal meatballs in tomato sauce - these were fine but nothing to recommend them. And we all salted them.  * polenta fries - rather flavorless. All of us reached for the salt, and half of them went back to the kitchen * gnocchi - really, really bad. The flavor was off, the texture was chewy... We sent more than half of it back to the kitchen. And there were 5 of us!  * fettuccine alfredo - thin sauce with a weird herby flavor, underdone pasta (and no, it wasn't al dente, it was UNDERDONE).  * osso bucco - this was the most flavorful dish we got, but it was a TINY portion (literally 6 bites - for $13.50!), and because the veal shank used was so thin it was overcooked and chewy The dessert course was much better - and not just because it was compliments of the manager, in consideration for our disappointing meal:  First, the limoncello. WOW, was that stuff good! Strong lemon flavor, sweet but not sickeningly so, and the manager told us it's overproof.  Since we didn't order them ourselves I'm not sure exactly what the other desserts were but every single one of them was really, really good.

This is really mediocre Italian food. Everything is so over salted. I had to send my salty arugula salad back. The octopus was almost impossible to chew. I've had it done right where the octopus is tender and tasty. This was just overcooked. The pizza was the biggest disappointment. Bland crust, meh sauce. What an under whelming experience. Anyone who gives this place more than two stars has never had really good Italian food.

Best food ever! Totally loved it! We were there on a monday around 3 for lunch, sat outside and yes it was loud but honestly, it's part of the experience. The service was great! We had the linguine with clams and the penne with vodka sauce, okay the clams were amazing that dish was light and yummy. Their vodka sauce is bar none the best ever! Really! Try it! Oh and get some calamari also! So great!!! Can't wait to go back! Try it you won't be disappointed.

The food was ok, service was great, noise level was insane!  We sat upstairs & it was so loud I couldn't hear the person sitting next to me even when they were talking loudly.  I've definitely had better Italian in the city so won't be returning here due mostly to the fact that the noise level was so uncomfortable & distracting.

This place is YUM!!!  Generic complimentary bread which I did not care for but everything else was five stars!! Here is what we ordered: Burrata beet salad - I'm a huge fan of beets. Therefore anything with beets is my JAM. The burrata was so fresh on this plate as well!  Shrimp risotto - very tasty and flavorful.  Tortellini in Alfredo with peas and prosciutto - Good amount of prosciutto to provide the right amount of saltiness for the dish. My husband was a major fan!!  A+ service.

Great food we had to go back the next to get the seafood frutti de mare (not on menu). OMG. Best dish and best frutti de mare I've ever had (obviously since I went back two nights in a row). The sauce was ridic delicious. The best and most pleasant surprise was the bill - this restaurant has the best prices! I'm already thinking I need to go back to Chicago just to come here!

Wayy overrated, not sure why there are so many positive reviews. The waiters kept mentioning how all the dishes were made to share..however if you order the pasta dishes, they're not really made to share...They also have a bathroom attendant, and dry soap (borax)...so old fashioned. Tried their sangria...which was a disappointment, they filled a cup with ice/fruits and gave you a carafe of wine for you to pour over.

A surprisingly small food bill, but we blew the budget on liquor. Our 4-top ordered the Salumera tasting which is a great item permitting you to mix and match cheeses, salumera (the meat stuff), spuntini (the veggie things) olives, etc. Almost a meal in itself for the group (well not quite), it satisfied both the meat lovers and the vegetarian-inclined at the table. To this we added the shaved salad, house-made pappardelle, polpette (veal) and roasted baby octopus. All good, well maybe the octupus was a bit tough, but worth trying. You want pizza? Go to Due's and shut up.
