OK, we were seduced by the grapefruiticello, limoncello ("We make our own limoncello") and espresso martini's and then had to order another round after tasting each other's drinks, plus a decent pour of a shiraz. So, yeah, $84 for liquor and $60 for food. But we left happy and stuffed. I was surprised. I am so completely jaded by most restaurants. And then walking into Quartino's in the heart of tourist Chicago, as a local I was not expecting much value or anything that wasn't over-salted. Service was attentive and even personable. The 1st floor room was loud (about 85dB - yes I have a sound meter app) but it registered more lively than lean-in-I-can't-hear-you.

Love the atmosphere; super fun and creative how the waiters all don Serie A jerseys. VERY reasonably priced, friendly service, and AMAZING food. Especially the pasta was delectable, 10/10 would recommend.

The best part of Quartino is definitely the pasta, which, I think is also the most important! We also enjoyed the Crisp Calamari. The portion of the calamari was very generous! The only thing we didn't like was the polenta fries, which I think may have been removed from the menu. They did not have a lot of flavor. We're looking forward to going back, hopefully with a larger group so that we can try more dishes!

This is our favorite tapas style Italian restaurant in the city. We have been here multiple times and have never been disappointed. The gluten free pasta is so good, that I had to confirm with a manager that it was actually gluten free. The vodka sauce is phenomenal. Their wine selection is also very well thought out and the servers are very knowledgeable when you ask for recommendations on both the food and drinks. We have brought friends from out of town and they also loved the food and ambience. If you are looking for authentic, delicious Italian food with a relaxed ambience and great customer service, then this is the place to be.

One of the most memorable restaurants I have been to because of phenomenal service and great food. The food itself is pretty great. Our table ordered a Tortellini dish, which was a white sauce pasta with prosciutto. The prosciutto definitely made the dish unique and much tastier. We also got a sausage pizza, which was pretty average. My favorite was the Orechiette, which is the ear shaped pasta. Halfway through, we decided to order the Fiocco di Prosciutto, which was a nice way to end our dinner. I would definitely come back for the food, as it really is phenomenal.  The service was amazing. Albeit, we did go 4-5pm, when there was less customers, but the servers were very attentive. Unfortunately, I did not get our waiter's name, but he was very nice and definitely very energetic. Definitely one of the best waiters I've experienced. The manager, Alysia, also came by and was very welcoming as well. She was very well versed in her introduction to the different types  of prosciutto, as we had trouble deciding which one to try out. As customers, we were impressed, and her dedication to her job makes the vibe for us that much better.  The restaurant itself is very large. There are many many tables on two floors, as I can imagine how busy the place would get. The ambiance is nice, with the dim lighting and homey interior. It's definitely a place to try out in your visit to Chicago or even just for a simple meal with friends and family.

Sad that I am leaving Chicago.. But just before we went to sleep, my lady and I needed to grab a bite. To our delight, a very tasty and authentic Italian tapas was in sight. Sam was informative and professional, and steered us in all the right directions. The veal meatball Napoli are must haves. Thanks for my last dining experience! I'll be back when in the area.

I was organizing a group dinner for 20 college students at Loyola, and was looking for a place where we could eat affordably and the food was good quality. Quartino was the perfect choice. Valerie the catering manager was very responsive and helped me preset a menu, even though we were just eating in the restaurant and weren't paying any extra. At the dinner, the waitstaff was very friendly and did not seem to mind having to deal with 20 outgoing students. We ordered a variety of pizzas and salads, we especially liked the funghi pizza and the kale salad. I would highly recommend using Quartino for a large dinner, they are very on the ball.

Food and staff are fantastic.  I love their bottle of wine specials they offer.  I have been here many times and EVERYTHING I have eaten has been delicious.  We went here for my cousins bachelorette party several years ago and the amount of food and wine we were provide was CRAZY.  So much food and drink we loved every minute of it.

Incredible. My favorite Italian food in the city. I love the atmosphere and it is so inexpensive! I've never had a bad meal here. I've been lucky to have Sinead as a server twice and she is incredible. So sweet and attentive and so much fun. Don't miss out on Quartino! Get the tortellini or penne ala vodka! Love you Sinead!

Came here late at night after the Drake concert and I'm so glad we did. The setting of the place was really cute. The waiters were so nice. Our table was under the AC and I was freezing and they were kind enough to move us and make us feel comfortable. We got two different pizzas and both were so good. I'm sure the other ones are just as good. The calamari was AMAZING. One of the best I've had. I also got the gnocchi. Didn't think it looked that appealing but when I tried it, I was so impressed. It was delicious.  Over all I loved it!

I really like this spot. The outdoor seating is great and the food is delicious. We ordered four plates and the bill came out to ~$60.   The free bread was phenomenal- I didn't want to keep eating it because I wanted to focus on the actual entrees, but I could not stop.  Absolutely recommend the Margherita pizza and the shell pasta with beef and vodka sauce (totally blanking on the name but it was my favorite dish.)  The risotto and gnocchi were good, but nothing special. Probably wouldn't order those two again.  Service was excellent. Will return!

This is my favorite Italian place in the city.  Great atmosphere and the food is very delicious.  Quartino's serves a variety of options; all well presented and perfectly portioned. Its nice to go to place and you are able to try a variety of food without being overwhelmed. I recommend going late at night so its not so crowded and chaotic.

We found this place on yelp with a lot of reviews. So the place is very nice outside and inside. There is an upstairs and downstairs.  The place does get busy as well but we found seating on a Tuesday night.  The waitress said the portions were huge as well, but it ended up being small and tiny that we were still hungry after the meal.  We ordered the specialites like the veal, baby shrimp and clam linguine.  They were all really good and tasty.  We ended up spending $50 dollars for the mean, but left hungry unfortunately.  The service was fast as well.

Probably one of my favorite restaurants in the city! The food is delicious EVERY SINGLE TIME. The sangria is a great deal- and does the job as well. Food is delicious and drinks are amazing- what else can you ask for? The staff is also very attentive and helpful. We weren't huge fans of a dish and they took it off our bill! Highly recommend for any occasion!

THIS PLACE WAS SO GOOD! Good prices and amazing food. So I walked all around River North looking for a good place to eat and finally stumbled upon this place on Yelp and was thoroughly pleased. I knew from the moment I walked in that the food was going to be delicious. The hostess was very nice to begin and sat us right away. The server started us with bread and olive oil/vinegar and we ordered a bottle of the house red (Rosso) which was  a good choice with our meal! The style of this restaurant is meant for sharing (family style) and I was happy they warned us in the beginning about this. We got the Margherita pizza which came with eight slices (12 inches). The pizza was super good because it had a very authentic taste and was different than any other pizza I've had.  The server was very helpful by letting us know that we could order a half pasta for half the price and it was a good amount of pasta for even one person. So we split the gnocchi as well which I thought was good but wasn't necessarily the best gnocchi I've had. Still was pretty tasty though! The way we finished off with the hot chocolate cake and ice cream which was basically just a lava cake but wow it was SO good! The perfect amount to split with another person. Overall the three dishes we got and the bottle of wine was $45 which was SUPER cheap and a perfect amount of food. This reataurant was the best I've been to in Chicago. By far.

Amazing vodka sauce! Great calamari. Those are pretty much my Italian restaurant food requirements. On point here. Def keep in mind the 'tapas' style of this Italian restaurants. Expect to pay normal portion prices for half size plates.

The number of reviews and the overall ratings were what drew us to go...  Ehhhh, we may have just ordered the wrong things. Outdoor seating area was great as well as the calamari. The pizza was ok, stay away from the shrimp risotto. No bueno. I would recommend checking other places out first. But again, we may have ordered the wrong things.

I really don't understand the Quartino hype. Every one of my friends raves about this place, and it's just been mediocre all the times I've come here. The food is okay, the service isn't anything to write home about, and the ambiance leaves me unimpressed. The last time I went, my friend and I split the Pappardelle and the Bianca pizza. Both dishes were okay, the pappardelle was a little sinewy. It took 40 minutes before we got our food, and we had multiple waiters throughout the night. I just don't understand why everyone loves this place. Would go elsewhere.

My girlfriend and I made a reservation here at 8:00 on a Friday night. We walked in at 7:45 and the check in area was crazy busy with people that have either made reservations or just walked in to get a table. They got us in right at 8:00 which was great. They sat us upstairs which just happened to be extremely loud. Our server was amazing and the food was amazing but the portion was very small. If you go, I highly recommend sitting outside, as it is much quieter. You can actually hear yourself talk out there.

Visiting from out of town and had a fantastic authentic Italian meal. Both the service and food were fantastic. We had the veal meatballs and an assortment of homemade pasta dishes. The cannoli was a treat as well. Highly recommend!

This is basically the only restaurant besides 1 other that I frequent more than 5x a week and recommend everyone to go to. Quartino is open late and the kitchen stays open till they practically shut down the bar which in Chicago is rare. The staff is also super nice however, this place is always jammed it seems so be sure to call ahead for a table. Also, keep the kids at home.

We will be back!    Great example of Chicago Italian.   Lots of yummy choices, wanted to order more but stomach was too full.   Service was friendly and prompt.   We had reservations for 7 and good thing.   The wait was two hours with crowds of people waiting to eat here.   We ate outside which I would recommend,  pretty noisy inside, but boisterous.

Wow! Busy Friday eve in Chicago and the place is hopping! The intriguing menu of Italian specialities made the evening's choices difficult; but our very knowledgable, (and efficient) waitress Sinead suggested a couple dishes. The Egplant Parm was perfect and the pasta bolognese was outstanding with shredded beef and just the right blend of spices. This was our 47th anniversary and the Tiramasu (with 2 forks) was the perfect sweet ending to a fun evening!

Spontaneously stopped for lunch and very happy with fresh ingredients and small medium plate tapa choices. We sat in glassed in sundeck which reminded us of favorite Paris bistros.  Eggplant Parmesan, lamb rigatoni very good. Portions not large so allows you to try a few things and share. Dates were good but not sure i liked the Gorgonzola filling.  Great spot overall. we were served quickly so was easy to get in and out over lunch hour mid week.
Great service and location. We got pizza, veal meatballs and eggplant parm... and it was pretty bland and underwhelming. Not quite sure why reviews are so positive

Such a great option and caters to big groups. We had a company dinner here and just ordered the entire menu and it was all very very good. For downtown and near the Mag mile, I think its an excellent option. You really do get that traditional Chicago Italian feel to it as well. Wine, food, dessert, all of it was spectacular.
fantastic!  pizza is one of the best in town [especially with arugula and shaved cheese].  ambiance is good.  and it's often crowded, so sitting outside if possible is the best option.

Hands down the best pasta I have ever eaten in my 31 years. Everything was unbelievably fresh. J and I split the sauteed Broccoli Rabe and the Cavatelli with fresh Ricotta and Gnocchi with Pesto. Both pastas were like beautiful fluffy pillows and the sauces that went along with then were perfect. Even the olive oil that is served with the fresh bread is to die for. Washed down with a half bottle of house white wine. Here is the place to go if you just want to much and linger over food, wine, and conversation. This was the perfect way to end out trip!!!

Loved the patio and the ambience upstairs, and the service was wonderful. We had drinks, the lamb sliders (priced per piece), a white pizza and spaghetti pomodoro for the table - the food was fresh, came out quickly and everyone was super satisfied with the taste and portion size. I'd recommend getting a few different types of dishes and sharing, Quartino seems to be able to do it all!

Had a great time here for a bachelorette dinner! We had a 2 hour dinner, ordering another course whenever we decided we were still hungry. Our server was fun and helped us select the best dishes for our group! She even suggested a special bachelorette dessert! Although we opted for the tiramisu, which is not on the menu but is absolutely a must! The only downside to the restaurant was that it was extremely loud; granted it was a beautiful Friday evening in the summer in Chicago.
The chicken was slightly under cook in some parts. The atmosphere is nice and the bread was good. I would try this place again.

Fun dining room. Fun restaurant. Nice place for a group of friends.  Food was outstanding and really a great value. Roast beet salad to start with and black truffle salami as well. Shared the soprano and d'anitra pizzas.  Tables consensus. Probably best pizza ever

Had a blast at this restaurant! I think i died three times, had way too much to drink before i got to there. Food; we shared three pizzas, several bottles of wine, and we all ordered an entrée and appetizer. The lamb dish that J and I had was phenomenal, pizzas were unbelievable, I do remember us having too much bread  and wine at one point.  The walk to the restroom was rough, thank you to the people that helped me on the way, i wouldn't have made it without you!

Fabulous fun place. Friendly atmosphere.  Food is always wonderful. Had the veal meatball sliders, the tagliatelle bolognese and a 1/2 order of zeppolis with dark chocolate dipping sauce for dessert along with some wine. I have to come here every time I'm in town and the food and service never disappoint. Crowded all the time and noisy but the food is worth it.

This was the 2nd time coming to this restaurant and we brought friends based off of our first experience.  This time, unfortunately the service was awful.  Our server didn't seem to know what food had come when and 40 minutes after the first entree showed up, mine (shrimp risotto)finally showed up.  By that time though, we had to leave and I had to leave hungry.  Overall, the food my wife, kids and the other family got was decent and I understand stuff coming out at different times, but it is unacceptable for a dish to come out 1 hour after ordered.  Will definitely not be coming back here or recommending to anyone else.  I just wish I could remember my servers name or I would add that too.

Had a good experience however some dishes knocked off a star.  THE GOOD - delicious bread served immediately. Soft w amazing olive oil. THE CALAMARI- is great, worth swinging by just for that. TORTELLINI - absolutely delicious. The prosciutto melts in your mouth, sauce and tortellini are sooo good. The dish works. Delicious. SHORT RIB w POTATOES - omg order this. If my Yelp reviewing can help you in anyway possible... Get the short ribs and get the potatoes. UNREAL !!!!!!!! VEAL MEATBALLS - incredible. Best meatballs I've ever had.  THE BAD - caprese salad; there was so much salt in my mozarrella it was inedible. Grossss. The other salad we had which was like radishes, beets, carrots... Soooo gross. It was so vinegary, tough, and the flavors did not work together. BOLOGNESE- this I was told to order but it was clear no one in our group really liked it. The sauce was VERY sweet and lacked any real sofrito flavor or if u like marinara bolognese it did not have that going for it either... GNOCCHI- ok the arugula pesto is really pushing it. It tastes like pure arugula which any of my salad eating friends out there knows tastes like DIRT plain. They should know a normal pesto w basil, garlic, and pine nuts would much better serve their hand rolled gnocchis. And when I say "THE BAD" I mean I pushed it away with my fork and did not eat it.  I think with this place u need to be selective. The marinara is great (meatballs) same w the cream sauce. Wine is inexpensive if you get house wine and the service is good.

Great outdoor seating watching the parade of "bachelorette" parties passing by.   If I had a $1 for every girl with a super  short skit and 5" heals walk in, I'd have a $1,000 tonight As far as the food, try the Salumeria Tasting.  For $25, worth every penny for this experience.

I came here for a business dinner so the food was buffet style for everyone. The shrimp cocktail that they served was delicious along with their meatballs and shells & sauce. The waiters were attentive and informative with the food. The other items that I had like the salmon and chicken was mediocre--nothing special. The pizza is OK compared to the pizza that I have had in New York and Connecticut.
Came here for my boyfriends birthday, I don't remember what we got but the food was good. The tables are too close together for my taste and the place is very loud.

LOUD! Oh my gosh, we went there for a group dinner and I couldn't even hear the guy next to me. Dirty plates and glasses and waiters were eager to clear plates as you were still eating off of them. Food was mediocre, definitely had better Italian elsewhere.
fun, busy place, pretty loud. good food and drinks. fun with a big group. I didn't get to sit outside but that looks it looks nice if you manage to get a table.

I came to Quartino for a friends birthday dinner last week. The food was absolutely incredible, but I also wanted to rave about our server! Hannah was so sweet and welcoming. She was patient with our indecisiveness, answered our questions well, supported us scooping extra chocolate with our fingers, and was all around an awesome part of the evening. Hannah, I told you I was going to leave a "lit Yelp review," and I follow through!

Celebrated a bachelorette party here last weekend. Food is good and reasonably priced. The small plates are fun and allow you to try a variety of things. The meatballs are delicious! This is a great place for large groups, but it is quite loud so you really can only talk to the person next to you or across from you if you raise your voice. Service was great as well.

Standard Italian fare. We came in on a Saturday night and it was hoppin' and deafeningly loud, but I'm used to that. We got a pizza to share and each ordered a pasta dish. Our hours-long drinking fest needed carbs. The pizza was the best thing we got - it was the quattro stagioni pizza with artichokes, zucchini, mushrooms, and roasted peppers. Excellent, with a nicely-flavoured crust and good quality/balance of toppings. I would have liked it a little more well-done but that's my only quibble. My lady-date got the cavatelli, which I found to be a bit tough and the sauce was a bit sweet and one-note for my taste. I had the pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo, which was a braised beef tomato sauce. It was similarly sweet and needed some fresh herbs or something to brighten it up, but it was OK and the pasta was well-cooked. The best things about this place: 1/2 liters of wine, and grana padano in a crank-bottle on your table. I got the Sangiovese and it paired well with the meal.

This restaurant was a surprise. I went last week to meet some friends after work and the wine was really good. I also ordered an authentic Neapolitan Pizza which was delicious. The staff was incredible and the ambiance better than I expected

Came here last night with my good friend. Being from out of town, I'm always looking for good places to try, especially Italian food which is my favorite.  We ordered the arugula salad with hazel nuts, orange slices, and their own goat cheese. It was fantastic. For the entre, we ordered linguini and shrimp. It was the best I've had. For dessert we had the flambé banana with ice cream....can you say insanely good? We had s couple of wine pairing that went great with the food.  Our server was very polite and attentive. Adam the Manager was nice chat with us.  Excellent experience overall. I will definitely come back.

Attended a group event (about 30 people) here. I can't say enough about the excellent service. We never waited even 30 seconds for someone to help us - and that's saying a lot since it was a really busy night. They even went out of their way to make sure our attendee with dietary restrictions received exactly what she needed. Food was delicious but we ordered way too much of it (family style) and were ready to quick before the entrees even arrived so beware! Excellent experience.

Very kind servers. None of the food came out at the same time, if my dinner mate didn't get a salad we wouldn't have been able to eat at same time. If the weather is nice sit outside, it is lovely. The bread tonight was kind of hard, but pretty good. I had gnocchi and it was veryyyyy firm, but I liked it. The clams were amazing. I do not recommend the shaved salad!!!!!!!!!! Other than that good food and good price.

My wife and I went here after a few recommendations.  We had the waiter recommend a few small plates. The eggplant spread but the two cheeses we had, along with the salamis were good, but not world beating. We had the tortellini with prosciutto and peas as our main dish, along with the wild arugula salad. They were both great.  We left satisfied, and also thinking it was very reasonable for a downtown Chicago restaurant b One additional point. We ate outside, and the outside chair my wife sat in was filthy. We didn't find this out until we went into Nordstrom afterwards. I called the manager from the store, and he was very apologetic. I gave him the table number, and he was going to hopefully prevent another pants disaster after ours. He said to come on by with the dry cleaning bill, or if the pants didn't come clean, he would take care of it. I didn't have to do either, because we washed them back at the condo, and they came clean. So, if the manager happens to read this- no harm no foul- but I appreciate the gesture.

Great food, great service. Reviews speak for themselves. We came on a Sunday, no wait. Server was very polite and made some great recs. Mrs ordered: linguine w/ clams in white sauce-very good  I ordered veal steak: amazing !!!  Only thing to note is that portions are small so may want to order appetizers.  Will be coming here again !!!

I really used to love this place when I first moved to Chicago 8 years ago.  I would always bring friends and family here.  I just feel the quality of the food has gone down my last few visits.  We had the shrimp risotto and it was undercooked and the shrimp was definitely frozen.  We had the gnocchi which is my wife's fav but that was really tough.  I think they have become more concerned with speed of service than quality.  It wouldn't hurt them to revamp some of the menu also...seems exactly the same since my first visit.

My first 5 months of the year were spent primarily in Chi Town. Quartino's was a place i was so happy that my crew had found. There are many choices in the city. Quarto's is a fantastic mix of Chicago's long time consistent restaurants with Excellent freshly prepared products from top to bottom. Service is top notch and consistent. So let me just say this,, in the many times ( I clearly did not use my Yelp check in every time) I'd been there between January and June 2016, Ive not identified anything I do not like or really do not love.. With that, some of the can't miss items, are Calamari, Big, crunchy, tender, and full of flavor, any of the house vegetables, Brocolli Rabe, Spinach,  Eggplant, all winners..The Burrata is a MUST! Veal Meatball sliders! Incredible.  Any of the housemate pizza's are a winner, The Pizze Quattro Formaggi,, DAMN!!! Unfortunately I cannot comment on the desserts because we've always been happily full. That's my mistake. However I have to believe it's all worthwhile. Priced reasonable acrsso the board, always a busy hopping place ( a great sign of a good place in a restaurant deluged town)  and one that I'll never forget with my opening crew of 2016. The dining room harkens back to the 50's and 60's with the mini tiles and ceiling artwork of another era. It's pretty unchanged, and hopefully it never does. The servers are moving there. And the management is on the floor. The food speaks for its;f, but the service ties it up nicely in a neat unforgettable bow.

I throughly enjoyed my experience at this restaurant. I ordered the linguine and clams. I must say the meal was superb. Lastly, my date and I experience absolutely amazing customer service. I cannot wait to dine at this establishment again.

Love this place! It's always my go to Italian spot when I'm craving pizza and pasta in the area. Great for groups or a date. Their tortellini pasta with cream sauce, peas and prosciutto is the best! Your crave it for days! Every pizza I've tried is great! I only took one star away because the bathroom lady is pointless. Go early and on a weekday and you will beat the crowds!
Awesome Italian styled tapas bar. Wonderful Eggplant Parmigiana, Roasted Baby Octopus, and Neapolitan Pizze.

Good Italian food at good prices. Tapas style so you are encouraged to share which is fun and a good way to try many dishes. 4 of us ate there last night w/ a bill of $155 before tip, including wine. Just knocked a star off because of the noise. The restaurant is LOUD. I think the loudest dining experience I've ever had. Why is it the "thing" to have zero sound absorption in restaurants these days?

Two Chicago trips of less than 2 weeks total, eaten here 5 times already. It's a must try Italian hot spot in downtown. Honestly I don't think it gets any better... The food, the service, the ambience is nothing less than exciting and perfect. A little side note which is pretty cool is that all the waiters wear Italian football jerseys, so If you're a football fan it gets even more exciting. Other than that they're very helpful, so if you can't decide from the awesome menu don't hesitate to ask. I absolutely love this place and can not get enough of it! Go try it today

Love this place. Great food and great wine selection. The pizza is awesome. I am never disappointed here. However, they are almost always packed. Like to the point that you cannot get up to go to the restroom without climbing over other people. I don't know why they sit everyone so tight, but I suppose it's because of the demand.  Make a reservation. Try lots of wine. They generally do small plates and then you split things. Almost everything is delicious, and the chicken I had there once was some of the best I have ever had. Good for all types of eaters - there is something for everyone.
The food is just o.k. Pizza is fine and the sea food is o.k. as well. I wouldn't recommend this place.

I've never had an issue getting a last minute table here (much appreciated when hosting out of town visitors that enjoy sightseeing without any sort of schedule). The food is meant to be ordered and shared family style, typically 1-2 items per person. The variety is good (pizzas, pastas, salads, etc.). I highly recommend the cheese fondue - it always ends up being everyone's favorite dish. Quartino can get a bit loud, especially in the downstairs dining room, but the convenience and solid food more than make up for that.

I wanted to like it, and I remember liking parts of it, but once I got the bill I realized it didn't like it that much. A loud and crowded place - not a in bad way - its happening! The dishes were to good to very good. Nothing quite got into the great territory. Waiter started out very strong and then kinda slipped towards the end of the meal. Wish I had went to Purple Pig... would have received better food, better service, and a better value.

Great customer service. It started raining and we where sitting outside. The servers were so nice to let us stay if we wanted to under the umbrellas and kept check on us. After a few minutes it' stopped raining and they made sure our drinks and food were still being served.

Amazing food and better service. Had the braised short rib pizza. Amazing!!!!!! Also got an eggplant Parmesan that was cooked better than any I've ever had. Despite walking in at 1:56 (kitchen closes at 2 a.m.), they happily still cooked our food. Thank you so much!!
Found this on Yelp after a work event and LOVED IT! The pork shank and beet salad were to die for. Cute restaurant with a wonderful selection!!
Lots of food ordered.  Can't remember all the food - just remember everything is not perfect. Pizza is good not great.  Other tapas were solid to include the short ribs.

Quartino is a tapas style place w an Italian flair. Food is good and the price was reasonable. We shared the orchietta pasta, a pizza, and salad along w a very nice bottle of red wine from montepuciano Italy that was so reasonable (15.00) And delicious! There are many items to choose from on the menu, so I think you can please the most discriminate of palates here! The atmosphere is very chic and fun - however tables are close and it's hard to carry on any serious type conversation, so I would not suggest this for a business meeting venue. I had been here multiple times but my daughters who live in Chicago had not. They left saying they would def be back and I am hoping it is with me!

Excellent food. The place was abuzz in great energy. All staff were attentive & helpful, especially Nico, our server. Salmon was great. As was sun dried tomato basil soup. Generous bread while waiting, w delicious olive oil. I'm a non drinker and it was refreshing not to be harrassed by staff to order alcohol. Wonderful food and experience. We'll be back when next in Chicago!

Prosciutto/Parmesan pizza: pretty good. Duck prosciutto/arugula pizza: greasy and altogether unbecoming, which is unfortunate. Duck prosciutto can be really good. Pastas and salumi: generally pretty good. Service: fine Atmosphere/decor: quite nice, actually! All-in-all, this is a decent place to eat at. Long hours are a convenience, and Quartino's does offer great value for money.

We always love finding new places in Chicago and this one was amazing. The food was delicious...try the clams and linguini! And prices were incredibly reasonable. This place does get crazy busy so get here early! I can't recommend this one enough

Sharing is caring, guys--especially when it comes to food. Come to Quartino for shared plate-style Italian! It's a giant restaurant with great finishes and details in every corner. They offer all authentic Italian beverages, which is a lot of fun--Benedetto sparkling water, Peroni, Aperol, etc.  The menu features tons of charcuterie cured in house, and plenty of cheese to go with them. The goat's milk ricotta is really tasty. I love the  burrata with beets two ways (paper thin raw and roasted cubed) with arugula and celery leaves.  Don't forget the pizza...I'd suggest the margherita, which has beautiful big basil leaves--one for each piece--no skimping. Great for a crowd, since there's so much space, but it's so noisy it's hard to carry on a conversation with the person next to you, much less across a table.

Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place til now. Whenever someone suggests Quartino or is having a get together here, count me in. The pizza is wonderful and they have a wide range of menu items. It's got some of the most attentive waitstaff, but it's still relaxed and not stuffy.

Great spot to host a private party.  Service and bartenders were very attentive.  Food was delicious and plentiful.  Between the calamari, paata and dessert i was stuffed.  Only negative was the AC went out in our area.  But management was very apologetic and went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable.  Will be back!

Our go-to shared plates restaurant when friends come to visit us!  Great vegetarian and gluten-free options and a wide selection of thin crust pizzas and pastas!  Favorite dishes that we order almost every time we go: tortellini with peas and thinly sliced prosciutto, veal polpette with fresh ricotta cheese, and the manzo pizza (with braised beef short rib, fennel, and creamy gorgonzola fonduta).  For vegetarians, try the quattro stagioni pizza!  It's topped with artichokes, roasted peppers, grilled zucchini, and portobello mushrooms-- all fresh and generously piled on the pizza. For dessert, definitely get the zeppole! Their sugary goodness with chocolate and caramel sauce will have you wolfing down every last bite! One note about the atmosphere-- it does get pretty loud and the tables are close together so it's not the restaurant to go to for a romantic intimate dinner.

We had a rehearsal dinner for about 65 people on a Saturday night and the staff and glorious food made it an outstanding success. Planning was a breeze with Julia and Roberto and staff took care of my guests every needs. The food was spectacular, especially the cavatelli and shrimp risotto. Our family could not have asked for anything more.  Thank you so much Quartino for your thoughtful attention to detail.

It was too loud to have a conversation with my wife for what are supposed to be a couple of the only peaceful hours we get together a week. I mean like nightclub loud. Everyone there -- even the bus staff -- is screaming like it's the apocalypse or something. We should have just turned around after walking in the door, but we didn't have time to figure something else out. On top of that the food was mostly meh (eggplant parmigiana was good, everything else... not so much). And the server was nice but... disappeared when we needed him. In short, my wife is now mad at me, so thanks Quartino: now I'm in the ef'ing dog house.

This is one of my favorite places.  Every time we visit Chicago we always eat here.  The red sangria is amazing.  We ordered the Romaine Hearts Salad, Meatballs, Tortellini, and then Tiramisu.  The entire meal was delish!  Can't wait til next years trip!!

Without a doubt the best restaurant I've experienced in Chicago.  Very authentic decor and food.  The fresh ricotta was to die for, and the seafood pasta was among the best I've had.  So glad I found this place!

Quartino was a nice local choice in the Near North River neighborhood near our hotel. The atmosphere and ambience deserves a 4.5-5, as it looks and feels like old world Italy. The service was also good, and at 1:30 on a Sunday in mid-July, there was no wait to sit inside. The bathrooms were clean and bright, and the noise level was very conducive to conversation. The pizza was very good, with a great crust and good favors. The penne was well done, but the ravioli was somewhat lacking in flavor and not done consistently...it seems they overlooked that part of the  order, then prepared it quickly to get it to the table. Decent variety of wines and bottled beer, with 7-8 on tap. Overall, an above-average to good experience, with the ravioli snafu being the only blemish. I would recommend Quartino if you're in the neighborhood or nearby area.
Never come to Chicago without eating here. They have an eggplant pizza that isn't on the menu but they will make if you ask for it. It's incredible.

I had a fantastic experience here. I came with a big party of girls and we were seated right away on a Friday night with our reservation. The place was packed (which obviously means it's good). They immediately served us bread with olive oil and vinegar and kept the supply coming.  We got liters of the house red and white wines to share for only $20 each! What a steal for Chicago. We also ordered a bunch of pizzas and pastas for the table and everything was delicious. It seems like no matter what you order here, you can't go wrong. The best part of all was that it was surprisingly extremely affordable. I would definitely come back again and recommend it if you're craving a fun Italian spot.

Nice little place to grab some shared plates and have a glass of wine or four. :). I work in the industry so this is a frequent late night hangout.  The staff is great, the prices are very reasonable for the neighborhood and the food is wonderful.  They are smaller shared plates so be prepared to order several items and share with your party.  They have plenty of space and I've never waited for a table.  One of my fave spots In the River North area.  Also, it's worth noting that they have many Vegan/Vegetarian options.  Oh....the wine is CHEAP and GOOD!

Food - OK, tasty  Service - Friendly, but a little slow Ambiance - Horrible  Noise level - Horrible -so loud you have to shout Since we have never been able to book a reservation on a Friday night we decided to just walk in and were actually seated immediately and escorted upstairs.  We were  initially going to be seated in a large room but there were so many large parties in it we couldn't hear anything.  We then were seated in a small room and noticed a huge table set for about 20 people directly next to us and asked to be moved downstairs but the host said the party would not arrive for 30 minutes yet and there were no other tables available.  We went ahead and ordered an appetizer pizza and it was lukewarm.  A hostess stopped by a little later on and asked how everything was and she was appalled when we told her that the food was lukewarm and quickly whisked the partially eaten pizza  away even though we told her to just leave it.  We thought she might return with another one but not the case.  We placed our entree order only to be inundated by a very large and LOUD party celebrating a birthday.   There was no room for my seat as the large party was getting seated and I had to move right right against my husband.  It was still so noisy we literally could not even converse.  We finally flagged a manager who was very apologetic and found us a table downstairs where we could finish our meal.  We noticed that other diners in the room did not care for the noise either but it was super noisy everywhere upstairs.  The ambiance was horrible especially for smaller groups.  The location downstairs was packed with large tables too but at least one party was leaving so it helped cut down on the noise.  We noticed another small party being seated and their space was so tight we knew what they were in for.   The service was courteous and the manager really wanted to smooth things over.  The remaining entrees were actually very tasty but the whole incident upstairs really ruined our evening.   Quartino's is obviously a very popular place but it seems more interested in packing people in like sardines vs creating a nice dining atmosphere where you don't have to shout to be heard.  We were told that they serve 700 people a day so it gives you an idea of the insanity.  Dinner time is definitely not the time to go if you want to enjoy a normal meal where you can converse.

Love this place! I've been 3 times in the past week's visit to Chicago and would love to take it home with me! Came here once last year at the end of vacation and couldn't wait to come again this year. Try the M-F lunch for 2 special at $25 - you will not be disappointed, as you get to choose your own 3 dishes from the full menu, just get here before  3pm for this awesome deal. Any other time the prices, service, and quality are unmatched. This is a great place to order plates to share, along with a great wine and beer selection, in a friendly atmosphere. Menu til 1 am and flatbread pizzas til 2 am :)

After 4th of July fireworks we came in here for a late night bite. This place is a tapas place. But they do Italian style tapas. I've never been to an Italian tapas place, but I was excited. We got the following: Olives  Prosciutto plate Veal meatballs  Bruschetta  Cavatelli Pasta dish. Sangria. The bruschetta had three different types. 1 mushroom. 1 juicy tomatoes. And one eggplant. All three were great, but the mushroom one was my favorite. Overall the meatballs might have been my fav dish. The ricotta in the meatballs and cavatelli was amazing. The sangria was eh.. and I didn't really like the Cavatelli. The ambiance in the restaurant is great. They have the bar side and the dining room side. We opted for the dining room, which was empty when we arrived, but packed by the time we left. It's dimly lit, and has a nice romantic feel. The service was good - our server had a lot of energy, even on a late holiday night. She was great. The gentleman that brought over our plates was a little rude. I didn't recognize the pasta when he brought it and I asked him what that was? He was obviously bothered. Eh. Overall it was a good experience.

We were a very large group so I think some of my impressions lie in the servers inability to manage 14 separate orders.  Food was served randomly, entrees before salads  - missing orders.  I ordered a caprese  salad, never showed up.  The sausage pizza was fine, thin crust with a traditional Italian sauce.  Wine was served in shot glasses (okay that was different) but service added to an overall disappointing experience.

What they're good at: cocktails; tagliatelle; table bread.  What they're not good at: attention to detail. Even with a reservation expect to wait for a table during the weekend. Luckily they have excellent cocktails (red sangria or limoncello martini) to tide you over.  The kitchen could stand to pay closer attention to detail, however. One of our pancetta-wrapped dates had no date or Gorgonzola in it; the baby octopus could have stood a bit longer in the pressure cooker (some tentacles tough, others just right); the risotto was undercooked and crunchy; the chair I was sitting at must have had some marshmallow on it from a previous party because when I got up the back of my pants were sticky.  Just a few seconds to wipe down seats, cook food a bit longer, and taste and inspect the food before going out could go a long way at this place.

4 star because their pepperoni and specially their duck prosciutto blew me away. Ordered their charcuterie sample and the whole thing blew me away. It was big enough for 2 that we shared a lunch item because I was already full. Their egg plant cheese and tomato sauce dish was absolute. Wish they had this in Cali.

Great spot terrific aeevice - sat outside. You can order had salads which are very big portions. Chicken soup a bit salty - burrata excellent, kale excellent. Caveat - I wanted to wrap leftovers and plate was taken, but server stopped at another table to chat awhile with my food in her hand. I asked someone else to please wrap it. I won't give it a 3, but service and hygiene is everything.

Disclaimer: I don't know shit about Italian cuisine. But we had an awesome experience here. VEGANS: There are lots of things you can get here. Our very helpful server (wearing a Juventus jersey) sat down and went over the whole menu with us, annotating every thing we could get as-is or with substitutions. We got the white bean spread, escarole, pasta with broccoli rabe, and olives, and this was the perfect amount of food for two people. Our favorite was the escarole. Oh, and plenty of wine. It was a lot of fun in a nice atmosphere and we would totally come again.

Came back here a 'lil over 5 years later and had the sausage pizza w/a friend while sitting outside -- they do have a nice patio area. The service here is really great, but I still stand with my earlier review that the food is pretty good, but not necessarily great.

Quartino has become our favorite for upscale, though relatively informal, Italian on the Near North Side.  This trip, we tried their lunch special--a great deal, at $25 for two people; offered weekdays until 3 PM.  This consists of three courses:  one selection from among their soups, salads, wine bar plates (think tapas), or fondute; one from the pasta or risotto items; and one from the specialty, seafood, or vegetarian items.  We chose: -Bruschette:  three pieces with three different toppings:  portobello, tomatoes, and Sicilian eggplant. -Linguini with clams in a Pinot Grigio sauce.  Four clams in the shell plus lots of chunks of clam flesh; slices of red pepper and garlic.  An excellent rendition of a classic. -Veal skirt steak.  Four tender veal slices, arugula(?), and tomatoes in a balsamic sauce.  Very tasty, though I must say that in a blind tasting I'd probably have taken it for beef rather than veal.

Ate here on our July 4th week trip.  Didn't try the pizza but they had a wonderful tapas menu and really reasonable wine prices.  The atmosphere was good and so was the service!  Loved the duck prosciutto  and the ravioli the most.  But all the dishes we sampled were yummy!

I have spent most of my life in Chicago, and this was perhaps the worst dinner I can remember.  Cheap, tasteless rice pasta and linguini,  with overcooked, tasteless vegetables, a salad with no discernable dressing, and a waitress who obviously couldnt care less since the place was very crowded.   It seemed like an eternity before we could get our check and leave -  What a waste of $100, and  WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT.

Had Quartino's for the second time last night and was very impressed. Its menu is built for small plate sharing and the appetizer offering shows it. Their house-made meats and cheeses are great. Highly recommend their spicy salami and goat's milk ricotta. Service was excellent and I'd recommend sitting in the main dining room vs. the bar if you don't mind the wait. Healthy portions, good flavor, cheap prices. Good for big groups with a louder setting. Just a solid Italian option where you can't go wrong with much on the menu.

This place is a factory moving people in and out and serving industrial quality food. It is also unbearably loud. Everything we had was completely forgettable: a bland spinach salad, a cardboard pizza, a boring sausage pasta, generic meatballs, and last - and least - a "gelato" that tasted like it came right from a Breyer's package, very gummy and unlike any "gelato" I have ever tasted. This place is trying to be upscale with an attendant in the restroom. (???!!) Skip it!

Great service and the food was pretty good. We got the tasting platter and the eggplant, Gorgonzola, provolone, the truffle salami were all very good. The margarita pizza was ok but would go for something different next time.

Went here with a group of 8 for my birthday dinner and it couldn't have been any better! First- the tapas style worked out so well because we all got to try different items on the menu. The portion size was great because it really allowed us to explore the menu. Second- We had a great waiter who was very attentive. He helped us choose our dishes and wine and even brought me a fun cake for my birthday. Very personable experience and we were always tended to. Third- the food was absolutely amazing for the price. Everything was delicious but my favorite dish was the campania pizza but the veal meatballs and cavatelli were really great too. Don't forget to get the zeppoles fore dessert! I recommend this restaurant for large groups and families.

Heard good things from girlfriend/friends but had to try for myself. Snuck in a last second rezy on a Friday night. Good thing we did because the place was slammed. I'm not sure how the staff was able to keep up with the amount of action inside but everything seemed to be moving smoothly. Snacked on some garlic shrimp, meatballs, and a cheap bottle of wine to start. All fantastic. Later munched on the Soprano pizza. Halfway ordered it because of Tony. RIP. Oh! Only negative was the noise. Could barely hear myself think with the European family of 20 behind us. Regardless, we'll definitely be back.

I've eaten at Quartinos at least five times in the past two years. It's a fun, casual, and lively atmosphere, good for bringing large groups or out of town visitors, very reasonably priced for the location, and you never have to wait very long (make reservations on OpenTable for weekend evenings). The service is always friendly and efficient- your food is served as it is ready (so stagger your order unless you want all the dishes to come out at once).  Our favorite pizza is the Campania; salads are the wild arugula and baby spinach; the calamari is fresh & huge!

This is probably my favorite Italian food in the city. I love that tapas style and the food is always brought out fresh from the kitchen. Their menu has so many delicious items, you can get something new every time. Their outdoor seating is lovely and the service is quick and very reasonable.
The food was very bland so I was going to give it 3 stars, but then they told me there were no free refills on Arnold Palmers so they lost another star.

Everyone -- even the kids-- loved the flavored! Sampling plate was great and the sauces were fab.   I don't recommend the truffle risotto as there are better options elsewhere.   Stick with the pasta items.

I stopped by here for lunch with a friend on a nice day and was seated outside. You will be served with complimentary bread which actually tastes pretty good with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. We settled for the $25 lunch special which essentially allowed us to choose three different dishes from the main sections of the menu. Our choices ended up being the beet salad, linguine with clams, and the calamari. I am a fan of beets and the salad did not disappoint. The salad contained beets and burratta cheese. It seemed as if there were two different kinds of beets in the salad. One came in the cubed form and was juicy and flavorful while the other came in a sliced form and tasted more like sliced carrots. I definitely enjoyed eating the cubed beets more since the sliced beets were pretty flavorless and dry. The burratta was extremely creamy and burst when I cut it with a fork. Although the flavoring of the cheese itself was a bit watered down, it complemented the strong flavor of the cubed beets well. The linguine with clams dish was actually smaller than I was expecting. There was the option of a red or white sauce with this dish and we opted for the white. The sauce was a wine sauce so it was not creamy. For pasta, I thought the linguine dish was actually pretty light. After I finished eating, I did not feel weighed down. The clams were pretty tiny and there weren't that many unfortunately. Ordering the calamari was a mistake. I need to remember that eating fried foods in large quantities is neither enjoyable nor desirable. The portion size for this order was pretty big and we were unable to finish the dish completely. In addition, the calamari was a bit soggy which made it even more difficult to consume. This was definitely one of the weaker dishes we had ordered. On top of the lunch special, my friend and I mistakenly ordered the Gran Coppa Quartino dessert. The description of the dessert may seem tempting, but let me warn you that it is actually just a very mediocre, overpriced dessert in disguise. The gelato tasted extremely artificial and the screaming shade of pink of the strawberry gelato did not help one bit. If you are looking for a reasonably priced meal for lunch, stopping by Quartino and getting the $25 lunch special is actually not a bad deal. I certainly regret ordering the dessert which cost an additional $8. Skip on the dessert here and you'll walk away with a decent lunch experience without having your wallet drained.
Excellent late night eating placed. Amazing homemade pasta. Very friendly wait staff. Nice people watching from the patio. We will be back.

Service and food was great. Then before I left I went to the bathroom, seen an employee use the restroom fix his hair then walk out... Missing something?  Yup, didn't wash his hands. I walk out and tell my wife who responds that's the kid who brought out your meal!  It was!!! Horrible ending to a great meal. Young kid with highlights on top incase you want to remind him of the LAW!  Please ensure everyone attends classes if they are handling food.  I would like to thank the management for their professionalism in handling this review.  Although I will admit this was the one time I've had a negative experience here there were a handful of other visits that were all great.  I felt the need to update this review because I will not let this one time deter me from visiting one of my "go to" restaurants.

Service was ok when I went in but that could be because the place was packed. Their food is on point! Paperdelle is out of this world. Haven't had paperdelle like quartino's anywhere else. I would say it's pretty casual dining.

Came here with my sister around 9 pm and we were immediately seated at a nice table outside.  My sister informed me that it's a small plates type of place, so we settled on 3 dishes: the spinach salad, shrimp, and the Margherita pizza.  We were going to order the Bianca pizza, but our waitress advised us against it saying that it "isn't really pizza" due to its lack of cheese and tomato sauce. I appreciated her honesty.  The spinach salad came first and it was disappointing. It was overdressed, which caused the spinach to lose its crunch. The flavored were nice together, though. I only wish it hadn't been so drenched in dressing.  The meal redeemed itself with the shrimp and pizza, which both had really fresh flavors. I wish the shrimp had been spicy, but I fixed that by adding red pepper flakes. All in all, a good meal for not a bad price. I'd come back!
I have been living in Italy 2 years and I think that there are better places to eat real Italian food. Nice location.

TLDR: good for kids, good food, good service, BUT food slow to come out and value depends on the dish Big perk - stroller check. Just like baggage. Exchange stroller for ticket upon entrance and pick up stroller when done.  Big perk - went here with the lady and child on the 4th of July around 7pm and was able to get seated (inside not outside( immediately  After we ordered we hadn't heard anything about food or our wine for about 15-20 min. The manager came out and apologized for the delay, as they didn't have what I had ordered and offered me three different samples.  The food took a while to come out but was well worth the wait. The pizza comes out faster than the pasta.  The food was excellent. However, be careful what plates you order. A plate of tortellini is much more filling than a plate of pappardelle.  Typically the wait would turn me off but the atmosphere was great and management was on top of acknowledging any delays which is enough for me. We're all human and get behind sometimes.

The Service here is the Best and wonderful people. Collection of Wine is also nice. But the food they have is soo bad. I tried Basil Pesto Pasta which tastes like uncooked and Raw basil mixed with Pasta. If you want to try Better Italian Pasta go to Vapiano which is a Mile away or try Eataly which is closeby. I tried a Pizza which is Soggy when made fresh. I hated myself to order a Pizza after eating is from here. Chicago is known for Pizza where they made their horrible mistake.

LOVE this place!! My husband and I sat outside and enjoyed the olives plate and calamari. We had a cheese selection and two dinners salads. The food was perfect and the outdoor atmosphere paired well with to our Chicago weekend.

Hands down the best restaurant in Chicago!  The menu is described to be "tapas" but the portions sizes were definitely not small.  We ordered the Quattro Formaggi pizza, fried calamari, and tortellini.  The calamari was perfectly cooked- it was very soft and juicy on the inside and had a great crispy coating. The pizza was perfectly cooked- had a great crust and the cheese was ooey gooey perfection! The tortellini was on a bed of thinly sliced prosciutto that just melted in my mouth! The house-made pasta itself had a great bite and the cream sauce was perfectly seasoned.  Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. Definitely enjoy the nice outdoor seating if the weather permits!

My most recent experience at Quartino certainly felt update-worthy.  I've been back several times since my initial visit, and I have been quite pleased each time.  Tonight, however, I was especially impressed.  Several of the employees went out of their way to accommodate my last-minute reservation and then to help me construct the perfect "soft foods" meal following a tooth extraction.  The Potato Puree and Cavatelli were ideal for my healing mouth, and our waitress even brought me some gelato!  The manager kindly stopped by to check in on my party as well.  I will certainly be back again soon and continue to highly recommend this place!

The 3-stars are for the service.  I have been to two larger parties on the second floor at Quartino's and both times the staff has been rude.  The first was a family member's engagement party and the bartender kept complaining that he couldn't keep up with our groups consumption.  He said, "This is a restaurant, not a bar." And closed the bar.  The second time was a work networking event and a similar situation occurred.

Tigah is very sad that her first review is not a good one.  We ordered the wild arugula salad, tagliatelle bolognese, the beef filets and shrimp.  The salad had all the components to be fresh and light for the start of a summer meal - arugula, orange slices and hazelnuts. Unfortunately, the salad was drowning in salad dressing so that you could barely taste any of the other ingredients. We needed the orange to almost combat the overpowering  dressing. It also would have been nice if they had de-pitted the orange slices. There were a lot of orange seeds that made them hard to pick out when mixed among the small grain rice and hazelnuts and made for an unpleasant bite of bitterness. The tagliatelle again would have been good if they had cooked the pasta properly because the bolognese sauce was nice. There were lumps of noodles that didn't separate during the cooking process. Tigah hates clumpy pasta! The beef filets were ordered medium which means pink in center but came out well-done. The shrimp did not taste fresh and were overdone giving them an unpleasant rubbery texture.  Overall, it felt like a meal that had all the components to be good but was prepared by an amateur - Overdressed salad, clumpy noodles and overcooked proteins. Tigah gives it a paws down.  Sorry!
The food was alright but not anything special. I went with a coworker while at a conference and when asked to spilt the bill it was a whole ordeal. Was not impressed!
Awesome food. Great place to take a bunch of people and try out different menu items. Highly recommend

I LOVE this place. I used to come here all the time in college and recently went back for a reunion and everything was just as wonderful as I remembered. It is a lovely spot for any meal, any occasion. I have tried most of the options on the menu and there has not been one thing I was dissatisfied with. Fantastic pizzas, wonderful perfectly portioned pastas, and the shrimp is a must-try.

I met two of my friends here for dinner, and since it was a Sunday, I made reservations to be on the safe side. We had initially planned on being seated outdoors (and people watching!) but the weather was too warm and sticky for that. The hosts (there appeared to be 3!) were all smiles and seated us quickly to a window facing table for a happy compromise. The place was packed and got noisier with laughter and banter as the evening progressed.  The ambience is all mood lighting and on the fancier side, so we were happy that we'd all dressed up. Side note: the tables are close enough that the group next to us tapped me on my shoulder twice to ask me what we had ordered because it looked SO good. Speaking of the food, it was one those meals that I'll reminisce about for a long time! We split a bottle of prosecco, and ordered one entree each, skipping the appetizers in favor of dessert (which is my favorite thing to have when I'm out dining). The menu had plenty of non-meat entrées, which pleased my vegetarian friend. We asked the server for suggestions and she made up in friendliness what she seemed to lack in knowledge of the menu. We got the potato gnocchi, which came with one of the most delicious pesto sauces I've had in a while; the linguine with clams in a marinara sauce that was seasoned and spiced perfectly, and the eggplant parmesan, which was my least favorite dish, but which my dining companions seemed to enjoy a lot. The portions are decent sized, and unless you have a really large appetite, stick to sharing dishes like we did. Also, all our dishes came out at different times, which was kind of awkward. Then came dessert, and we agonized over the ridiculously tantalizing menu until we decided on the profiteroles and the Nutella panino. The sugar sprinkled Nutella panino was a great Nutella toast, but too simple and easy replicable to be on that menu. The profiteroles were the MVP, and honestly, we ate them up so fast that I didn't even have time to note the ingredients. I'll definitely upgrade this review, because I want to sample more of their stellar offerings. I'll just be prepared to talk really loud to be heard!

My favorite restaurant in Chicago. It gets crowded during dinner on the weekends but the service is still good. I love the atmosphere in this restaurant. And I absolutely love the food! Definitely a must try in Chicago!

We used open table to make a reservation after a local friend told us how great this place was. We weren't disappointed! The portions were perfect, the food was smack the table good, and our waitress even had an Italian accent. We loved the European eat and enjoy your meal pace of the meal. It was so nice to not be rushed and allowed to enjoy the smells, taste, and textures. We both ordered desert and we both loved them!
Great place for small plates of Italian dishes to share. Great service even though they were packed on a Monday night. Get the octopus. It was very tasty.
Love this place! Such good Italian food at an affordable price. Great for dinners with friends.

Everything is shared plates. Plates are a bit small for price, but since you can order a bunch of things to share, you will definitely get your fix. We got the tray of salumis, olives, cheese with the apricot spread. Most of the things were great (pizza), but some items were alright like the pasta we had gotten. Overall, the food was good, but the service was alright. The waiter hadn't come by nearly enough, but it was also a busy night so we gave him a break.

Very disappointed in this restaurant. I chose it because friends had recommended it. Although the bread was fresh and the roasted beets salad were delicious, my main course was bland and tasteless. I had the orecchiette with ragu sauce and sausage. What can I say? I've had better by purchasing bottled red sauce from a grocery store. My friend ordered linguini in clam sauce. Her noodles were so over cooked they looked like you could break them in half. While the restaurant is inviting, the staff was attentive, and the location convenient, the food and the reason we went there (to eat) didn't meet the most minimum of expectations.

Great food and very accommodating to our party! The place was packed from the get go, so you know they're doing something right. I planned ahead for my sister's bachelorette party and was able to get a set menu down with a customized title for the menu. Food was brought out in a timely manner, and the wait staff was able to time it right for guests that were arriving to the party late. The Veal Steak is a must and the Tiramisu was a crowd favorite for our party.

This was my second visit in a few weeks.  I read reviews that indicated the service was not up to par but I found the opposite to be true.  It was a busy, Friday evening and the staff was very attentive, including the management.  It seemed like every server was capable of taking more orders or getting us anything we needed.  We were lucky enough to snag an outside seat at 5 pm.  I tried to move the reservation back a bit but they were firm in that they were booked for the next four hours.  I appreciated that and felt it was a sign of respect for all the diners and that they could maintain some control.  The atmosphere is fun, loud and festive.  The sizes of the "shared" plates was more than adequate for our table of 5 to try everything.  We ordered two pizzas, and a couple of salads, as well as the pancetta dates, shrimp risotto, and fondue and a couple of desserts.  Excellent.  The only caution is that since we were sitting outside, they could not light the candle to keep the fondue warm so it got cold quite quickly.   The people watching was excellent.  I was amazed and slightly amused to watch parties of 5 or more approach the hostess and request a table and be indignant and rude when told there would be a wait.  People.....its Friday evening in Chicago.  this is not downtown Iowa.  For one group in particular, they had a child with them on a scooter and she kept riding it from the sidewalk into the restaurant.  Those poor waiters trying to maneuver around her as well as other patrons entering and exiting the restaurant.  When a table became available, they pouted because they could not get a prime outside table.  Jeesh.   Now you know where some of the bad reviews come from....unrealistic expectations.  I loved everything about this restaurant.  Just know that it is busy, crowded and loud so if you want a quiet conversation,  pick another restaurant.  If you are in a party, let if flow mood, this is the place to be!

We met our good friend here to enjoy a nice dinner and drinks.  The restaurant was cramped and noisy, but the ambiance was enjoyable otherwise.  We sat at the bar while we waited for our friend and had a few drinks.  The bar waitress was great. The menu was diverse, offering many different things at affordable prices.  It's a tapas type restaurant, which I really liked because at most Italian places after you eat the bread, an appetizer, and the salad, you finally get a huge plate full of pasta or meat, or both.  The meals were delicious, as was the beer selection. I dinged it a star because our meals all came out different times, with the last one coming over 5 minutes after the others.  Other than that, great place and we will definitely be back.

Disappointed. Read so many good reviews and saw great pictures. took there my wife a kids and we tried 5 different dishes. The only half decent was my kids fettuccini Alfredo. Risotto fungui seems to be made out of an uncle bens pre made package, gnocchi was hard and tasteless, pizza was average. Also the dishes came 5 min a part, and obviously my starving kid was the last one to show up. In a city of so many great restaurants, I give the Quartino a "C-"
It's basically Italian tapas. We had some Grana Padano, asparagus risotto, Steamed clams, and polenta fries.  All were tasty, and we were too full for dessert.

I dig this place a lot, especially the wine. It's like tapa style, but with Italian dishes. The eggplant is fire, so definitely get that. I have had the majority of this menu, and I have never been disappointed with any of the items. Mix it up....get drunk....just make sure you have some good company with you.

I have to blame the waiter on this visit. Im not sure if he was new or just didn't understand how the theme works. He wanted us to place our entire order when we sat down. We told him we wanted to first enjoy our appetizer and then we would decide. When we finally place a variety of dishes became back and asked us if we would be interested in coffee and deserts. We all looked at him like he was from another planet. We then told him we had not even received our dinner. He looked like he saw a deer in the headlights. Last time for us.

I have heard wonderful things about this restaurant but was recently dissappointed in the service itself. We dined no a Friday night and were seated on the patio. After about 20 minutes a server showed up and took our drink orders. Another 20 minutes went buy and another server brought us some bread but the drinks had yet to show up. I eventually commented and asked about the status of our drinks and 15 minutes later another server showed up with 2 of the 3 drinks we ordered. Our meal went on like this with continuous changes in servers and it even took 30 minutes to get the check let alone another 25 minutes to get my credit card back. For such a nice establishment the server confusion was very disappointing.  We tried the Caprese salad which was fantastic and absolutely fresh and I highly recommend it. We also the meatballs which I had to remind the server twice to receive and were fairly small and somewhat chewy. (I'm guessing they forgot about it and reheated them or something). As for the pasta we ordered the Cavatelli we asked for it to be spicy. The pasta itself was great and the sauce definitely tasted homemade however there was no spice and 15 minutes later some crushed red pepper was brought to the table.  Overall I was really looking forward to eating on the patio here and I do think they have a solid drink menu and great beer selection. I wish our experience was different as the food was on point but the service was unacceptable. Considering we had guests in town and chose to take them here was a bit of a mistake. Hopefully it is not always like this. Enjoy!

?Atmosphere is better than food. Meat ball sliders consisted of one mediocre ball. The side was fine. We ordered food and after the appetizer it took forever. The bread at table was a small roll sliced. I don't know how the food is for sharing. I ordered the eggplant parmesan and there were two and a half tiny slices covered in cheese and tinned sauce. My dining companions food took forever. Bland not expensive would upset any person from Italy served this.Such diminutive portions will leave you disappointed and hungry.

Things started well. Had a reservation even though we wanted outside, which they don't take reservations for.  However, when we arrived we were able to get a table outside on the upstairs balcony. The table for 2 is small and hard to put plates on.   We ordered a salad, pasta dishes and veal skirt steak.  First 2 came out right away, veal was a wait. Food was all good.  Had trouble with the waiter refilling drinks. But overall th I ngs were going well.  Then we ordered a dish of sorbet for desert. You would think that would come out pretty quick.... well that took 30 min.  No attention from the waiter again.  Guess you have to be drinking alcohol to get attention.
Great ambience and amazing service by the staff. The food tastes average for the price you pay.

Absolutely delicious food. Perfect sized portions, larger than I expected since I wasn't very hungry and i was so full when done. Had the veal meatball slider which was great, a wild arugula salad and eggplant parm, both really very good.  Highly recommend this restaurant, excellent variety of dishes on the menu, most smaller size plates so you can have a few. Only disappointment was no pizza tonight as the pizza oven was not working. Excellent service too!

This place is amazing. We had a homemade pasta dish that tasted like some Italian grandmother's recipe. The place seats 600 people and the staff seemed to be able to zip in and around. We were able to sit outside, which is much more quiet than indoors.  Save room for dessert,  such you can order half of and try me than one.  The profitroles and tirimasu were delicious.

Quartino is the perfect place to go for a nice but lowkey meal. The prices are completely reasonable, the waiters are friendly and the food is good! One of my favorite things about this place is that you can get half orders of the bigger dishes and if you're unsure about ordering something some waiters will even let you sample! Their pizzas are great and the calamari is delicious.

Oh man, I love this place.  I usually don't enjoy staying in River North to eat... very touristy and over-hyped, typically.  But this place is a gem.  The food is excellent -- I've eaten here twice with small groups.  The servers suggest excellent wine pairings with particular cheeses, etc.  The bacon-wrapped dates are to die for.  Very reasonably priced.  I also just love the crowded/cramped ambience, I have to say... It's charming.  What's more -- my mom is gluten free and they have a specific menu for gluten-free diners (and it has a lot!), which was really helpful.

We dined here during a recent visit to Chicago. I had the Tuscan sausage risotto, and my wife had the organic veal skirt steak. The portions were big enough where we could share, which is encouraged. We had an olive appetizer and of course Italian bread. We both agree the food is amazing. They have a large variety of wines to choose from and a full bar. They take reservations even for parties of 2. Our waiter Sam was amazing, attentive and took great care of us. We'll most definitely return on our next visit.

I've been going here for the past 10 years, even before I lived in Chicago whenever we would visit we would always make a stop to Quartino! The food is to die for and they even make special meals just for you not listed on the menu if you ask. The tables are kind of crammed in there but you won't even notice because you'll be in Italian food heaven.

This place is too cute! Sit outside to get a nice view of people watching and soak up the amazing weather Chicago has to offer in the Spring/Summer time. Or get inside and get social but the bar, table tops, or even dining area. This restaurant scene is active and lively, so you're bound to have a great experience regardless if you come alone or with a group.  The menu consists of a broad range of items. You want something carb heavy, go for a pasta dish! You want some simple snacks you say, well how about a classic charcuterie! How about something simple, refreshing, and just decadent enough without the typical Italian fare guilt.. definitely opt in for the ricotta! All the items on the menu are priced amazing fare, if not a bargain for the quality and flavors of the dishes! You really can't go wrong coming here and trying this place out! Dishes I tried: -Ricotta: To be honest, I've never been a fan of these cheese. But this is the one place that has changed my mind.. get it. done deal! - Veal meatballs (traditional style): Tender, juicy, and just the right about of sauce without masking the natural flavors of the meat itself. Get it. -Baby Spinach salad: lackluster and the table did not finish it. Pass on it.. -Penne alla vodka: I love a good vodka sauce and this was a perfect touch to getting a few bites of a heavy pasta without feeling weighed down. Creamy and silky with bold but simplistic flavors.. get it! -Broccoli rabe- it's is rabe and not traditional broccoli florets, it tastes similar to a sauteed spinach with more texture. Pleasantly surprised with the bold garlic notes and a pinch of spice. Get it! -Octopus: If it haven't said it enough in my reviews, Chicago is my all time favorite city to get octopus plates, and Quartino did not disappoint! Charred perfectly with bites of smokey flavor. Must get! -Porcini & truffle risotto- Creamy, heavy and lacked the truffle notes. Also was a bit undercooked. Pass on this one!

We came here for din din after we missed our flight in Chicago.  It was all quite tragic and travel in general stresses me out. So this place with promise of comfort food and free flowing wine was the perfect place to come to.  The place is quite casual and cute but everyone was dressed up. We ordered half a bottle of Malbec to drown our sorrows in to start. Following that we jumped onto to entrees - my boyfriend ordered the San Daniele pizza (prosciutto arugula) while I ordered the gluten free pasta in the stracci di grano arso (broccoli rabe/tomatoes/ onion/ garlic and works). The food was good and I would rate it a 8/10. Also, my boyfriend wanted the octopus but they had ran out unfortunately. Our Malbec was delicious and go check out the bathroom they are quaint and they use borax instead of soap.

After reading other reviews about this place thought why not... I so loved the food here that I wanted more the next day. Being my first tapas experience I couldn't have picked a better place. Tried the spinach salad, cavatelli, salmon,artichokes campo basso, Taleggio and of course dessert of zeppoles with dark chocolate. If your looking for a quiet place don't eat here the atmosphere is loud. It may remind some of family dinners. The only down side to the experience was the server. Pretty personal and helpful in the beginning but then he did a disappearing act. So I guess "thank you"to the rest of the staff who picked up his slack. Next visit to Chicago this will be on my list of places to eat

I liked the risotto I got- very delicious. Pasta was not so good, as they did not really use a white sauce that I requested. The pasta looked like it was simply boiled pasta, which I did not expect to see in a restaurant.  You can make that kind of pasta yourself. Next, the chocolate cake, was great! But the waiter really should have not put clean spoons on our dirty table.

My favorite Italian place downtown. It's boisterous, great for large groups. You can try multiple dishes. If there are enough people, the salumeria tasting platter is very good value for the money, and awesome to have while waiting for other dishes. Some of my other favorite go-tos are: - polenta fries - calamari  - bruschetta tasting - any of the pizzas  - pappardelle - roast chicken  Make a reservation on busy nights, but otherwise it's great for walk in.  Dessert:  - tiramisu  - zeppole It also has wine by the glass or liter- sangria is good too! There's also a large selection of cocktails, depending what you're in the mood for.

What a great spot in the heart of river north to bring a group for some authentic Italian tapas! Such reasonable prices also, and not to mention great wines.
