Service is impeccable, and makes you definitely want to come back. Here were our picks at this lovely restaurant: The Orvieto was a lovely sweet white wine that everyone at the table enjoyed. The Toscana was an excellent red for those who enjoy red with their meats. Arugula salad: light and refreshing start to the meal! A recommend for the salad Brussel sprouts: I always enjoy Brussel sprouts, but the others in my party thought there was nothing great about this dish Calamari: a crowd favorite and quartino does it best!! Gnocchi: excellent pesto sauce, great pasta texture Linguine with clams: the favorite of the pastas  Penne a la vodka: nothing special, a little too al dente Organic veal skirt steak: a superb meat dish here, excellently marinated Braised pork shank: soft and tender, delicious Brodetto: kind of like a seafood stew, nothing too special Overall, quartino will not fail you if you're looking for an Italian crowd pleaser! Enjoyed my experience thoroughly!

Great Italian food. It will fill you up. The only negative is the bathroom tip guy! Why ? Why ? Why ? No one liked this except the bathroom tip guy ! Give him another gig in besides this! He is a great guy but it is time to retire this trend.

Good food! Service excellant. Great bread. Keep in mind the portions are small (small plates) so get a few things you like. Place is very loud but you can still converse. The noise does go along with the ambiance of the place so it's not a nuissance.

I finally made it to Chicago and have wanted to try some good Italian food, so I stopped by Quartino. Food: I ordered the Spaghetti Pomodoro and Eggplant Parmigiana.  Both were amazing! They give you a lot of food and I devoured all of it. Sides Notes Ambiance: This place was packed on a Tuesday night. Service: Bartender was super friendly and offered me water while I waited. Overall: If you're looking for good Italian food, stop on by!

Had a great dinner here last night!  Place was packed but the restaurant wasn't overly noisy.  Had the cheese fondue for an appetizer with the additional accompaniments and it was delicious!  Both dinners were fabulous - linguini with clams and Italian risotto.  Service was great as well.  We will definitely come back!

Just 2 words: LOVE IT! The dessert is the best and have always had amazing food no matter what time I went and how busy they were. One thing though it can get a  little tight as the tables are spaced really close to each other

We made reservations for dinner here on the final night of our stay in Chicago.  We arrived on time and only had to wait 5 minutes for a table.  The place was crowded, and the layout of tables approaches being cramped, but they leave just enough room for everything to function pretty well.  It was fairly loud inside, from just the level on conversation and the acoustics. The decor is dark wood and lots of Italian posters (bike racing, pasta, etc.).  It has an interesting old-style (perhaps faux) Italian vibe.  It was interesting. The pasta choices seemed more authentic than some suburban strip-mall Italian eatery.  I don't recall what our party of 3 got, but all were pasta variants and all were good.  The wine selection was also good. If I were in the area again, I would definitely consider a return visit.

Great service. We ate outside on a beautiful day for lunch and you have to just like that in Chicago when you can dine al fresco! Portions seemed a little meager but then again it was lunch and I didn't mind eating lighter than I might normally. Great waiter who kept coming back to refill our drinks because we just hung out talking too much.
Very poorly managed. The front desk couldn't even take names to get people seated, and my desert took over half an hour. These guys on resting o. The fact they're a tourist trap.

Eh... it was okay. We came as a large group... the server(s) seemed unhappy to do their jobs. They always seemed to be upset when we tried to order something. I understand how it is annoying that we don't all order drinks at one time and want to continuously order drinks throughout the night. Please don't get huffy with me. I didn't hear you ask if anyone wanted drinks previously. If I knew I was going to get so much attitude, I would have just remain dehydrated so you don't have to do your job. The food was OK. My side of the table got the margarita and pepperoni pizzas, polenta fries, shrimp, and bolognese. The only thing good was the bolognese. That was actually really good... probably one of the better ones I've ever had. Everything else was meh. I don't know if I would go back because of the service and food. Really disappointed...

I was in the city for my birthday, our taxi driver recommended this place...poor choice.  My server was ok...and I felt rushed to order. I was disappointed in the fact that they "ran out of shrimp," on a Saturday night. The calamari was good but a little salty for my liking.  I ordered the beef filet medium and it arrived well done...  The veal osso buco was good but the price was a little high for the portion.  Yes, it's a tapas restaurant but you will have to order two of everything to serve four people....unless you want pizza.  The place was really loud and we weren't allowed to sit outside b/c of the city ordnance, which closes the outside patio at 12:00am...

Went here for lunch today, a nice environment, especially if you have the opportunity to sit outside on a nice day. Had the salmon and sautéed spinach, wife had the oven pizza. The portions are extremely small, which they did warn us about, but in my opinion too overpriced for what you get. The salmon was too fishy and didn't have enough flavor. Overall, a nice place to go on a date if you're in the city and feel like Italian. The service was good
Great food, atmosphere, and price. Recommend the porcini risotto. Food is not quite 5star in comparison to few other places, but price is more than fair :)

Now I feel like I am on vacation. Sitting outside and eating small plates and sipping wine. Unbelievably delicious. Service is over the top. I highly recommend the caprese salad, the truffle salami and fontina small dishes. They actually are not small at all. Fun place to share plates and enjoy beautiful Chicago. Ended with a wonderful lemon dessert and housemade limoncello. Could not have been better.

Great food and atmosphere, reminded me of Bar la Grassa at home (Minneapolis, MN). The hostess' were a bit frazzled with the crowd, but tried their best. The wine carafes/litres were amazing deals and the food was on-point. Get the Stefano pizza but ask them to add sauce, much better that way in my opinion. The duck prosciutto pizza was also a winner. All-in-all, our table of 7 ordered about 10-12 different things and I was impressed by all of it, with the exception of the gnocchi (great price at $11, but I've had better for similar pricing or less). Again, get the wine by the litre, you won't regret it!

Visiting Chicago from Boston, and this as close as you can get to a North End restaurant. Atmosphere and service both great, food was very good, best limoncello martini I ever had, and the kids loved the bread & oil served before your meal. We went 2 nights a in a row!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would.. My husband and I were in town for the Chicago Half Marathon and chose this restaurant for my pre-race carb loading session.. What an AMAZING choice.. Food was beyond fantastic, very authentic atmosphere and service was impeccable even despite the place being SUPER crowded on a Saturday evening.. I would suggest making reservations. All of our food came piping hot and was so fresh and delicious.. I would HIGHLY recommend!

Always love eating here! One of my favorite spots and I had the privilege of meeting Alysia Prosser this evening. I mentioned to her I moved into a new apartment and she sent over a drink. So thoughtful and takes such great care of her customers.

The service, atmosphere, and hours at Quartino are excellent, and they dish up some pretty solid pizza and pasta as well.  Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere? Historic and lively at more or less all hours of the day, the service and atmosphere at Quartino are arguably the biggest assets. The bartenders are fantastic, and balance classy and casual depending on who they're serving (an understated asset). Even with a diverse menu you should expect to have your food no more than ten minutes or so after ordering. Star Granted.  Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost? My Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo (recommended to me by the bartender) came in at $12.50, which was exceptional value given the generous portion, and the entire menu was priced accordingly. Good stuff. Star Granted.  Stars 3 and 4: How was the food? My dish was a tale of two components. The house made pasta was excellent, with thick pappardelle noodles cooked to perfection in a way that absorbed the sauce and beef around it.  That sauce and beef; however, was a bit weak. That tomato sauce was, for lack of a better word, plain, and the accompanied beef didn't really add all that much to the equation. This wasn't a bad dish, but it didn't blow me away. Single Star Granted.  Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could? Quartino has a great atmosphere, great service, and a great menu. It's worth a visit, but I can't say it's the best italian in town. No Star Granted.

I returned to Quartino and this time around was very satisfied. First off, the service was amazing. From the manager to our waiter, everyone was attentive, helpful and really took care of us. We got a sampling of different dishes and everything was delicious. From the house made goat cheese and veal meatballs with fresh house made ricotta, to pappardelle pasta, our appetizers did not disappoint. Organic veal skirt steak was great as well. A big plus is that that you can order half portions and try different dishes. For dessert, profiteroles with delicious creamy ice cream is amazing! Overall, we were very satisfied with our dinner and I'm happy we came back!

Quartino was an excellent choice for our large group to grab dinner. We started off with some wine and ended up trying a huge variety of their plates. The cheese fondue, calamari and burrata salad were definitely some of our favorites. For dessert the chocolate cake was warm and decadent and the sorbet was very refreshing. Overall, we had a lovely dinner here and would recommend stopping by!

Great food and good choices for someone with food allergies. It's loud--important to know if you're with a group--can't hear the people across your table speaking. Service was great. My only gripe was with the reservations process and the stern talking to I got about being sure to let them know *before* we arrived if our number changed. I did call when our number changed and felt scolded. Once we were there it was fine (and we were down another two people which didn't seem to be an issue for anyone.)

Great, inexpensive Italian joint right in the heart of downtown Chicago! Place was booming, yet got a table without a wait. Staff was on the ball, quick and efficient on a busy Friday night. Ordered a 1/2 liter of wine for $10, and shared two plates: the Manzo pizza, with braised short rib, gorgonzola, roasted fennel, and walnut pesto; and the rigatoni with lamb. Both were solid and a nice foray into the untraditional Italian foods. The tiramisu dessert was HUGE and amazing, but a little heavy on the cocoa powder. Kinda caked your mouth at first with each bite. But still great!

Went for a wine tasting.  Parking is a bit hard to find and  street parking can be a bit tricky.   This place is a great tapas bar and I enjoyed the various cheese and salami's.    I will be going back to try more things.
Awesome restaurant. Perfect service and healthy food. Nice outside seating with a lively view.

Excellent homemade pastas and terrific pasta. The tapas-sized plates are perfect to share and the sangria was great. For a Wednesday, this place was absolutely packed, glad we had a reservation. Would definitely recommend this restaurant

We came to Quartino for a work dinner. It's pretty loud and crowded which can make for a fun atmosphere but not the best for a quiet dinner. The servers and wait staff were constantly making sure that we had everything we needed which was very nice. The food was surprisingly great for the cost of Italian food - especially compared to other options in the neighborhood. Will definitely return!

If you have visitors coming to Chicago - this is a must.  Great food and wine selection -- something for even the pickiest of eaters.  The price is right and the staff know how to accommodate large groups.   It can get a little loud, but it's all part of the atmosphere.
This place is legit.  I had the pizza, it was awesome.  Great wine and good help.  I ate solo at the bar.
Quartino was a perfect place to eat near our hotel on a cold rainy night . I love the italian tapas style menu and the price was reasonable. It's enough  for 2 people to share.

Great experience in this restaurant with 4 kids in tow - the youngest being 5 months. The service was super speedy and they checked in the stroller at the first floor so you don't have to drag it to the 2nd floor. We had the calamari, octopus appetizers. Both were excellent. We had the clams pasta and fettuccini Alfredo and margarita pizza. I liked the pizza the most. The clams pasta needed a bit of spice and seasoning while Alfredo was nothing special. The pizza crust was thin and crunchy. We will definitely be back when we're in Chicago.

What an awesome restaurant. The most European food and vibe I've had since I have been in the US while still staying true to what they are. Don't order a large dish or anything like that,  just order a bunch of small dishes and share. I'd advise to do so I  rounds of two because they are heavy.   I've noticed that the tiramisu is not on the menu but please order that because it is divine, seriously.  One remark,  if you are already very full you might consider sharing because it's a big piece,  like really big.
A family favorite. Great food, excellent service, reasonable prices. Why anyone goes to Chili's across the street baffles me.
Great food with so many options!! We had a large group so we had a chance to try a ton of different dishes and desserts. Definitely get the house made Lemoncello. You won't regret it!!

Great food. They have an pizza, casual dining room and an inner room for serious dinners. They just make good italian food that's all there is to say.  Very full meal with a drop of booze for two would be a 100 dollar evening.
Absolutely love this place! The food is fantastic and the wine specials they run every month are great. Their gluten-free pasta is wonderful, too!
delicious food, good service, unlimited bread. a bit pricey but Quartino serves quality italian food. we got the shrimp which was delicious, penne a la vodka, and fried calamari. no complaints!

Awesome atmosphere in the bar, server was lovely, had the romaine salad which had a very interesting dressing, honey and lemon that was totally different that your run of the mill over dressed Caesar salad. Also had the tortellini with prosciutto which was lovely. I'm just bummed I wasn't hungry enough for dessert, I'm sure it would be fantastic here!

This place is an interesting mix of delicious food and a little hectic ambiance. It's loud and busy at all times, but this is exactly because people are enjoying great food in great company. Coming back never disappoints!

I attended an event here on a Wednesday evening, and I was totally in awe of how smoothly everything went.  Planned for about 100, over 150 attended, but all went without a hitch.  Food, service, and ambiance were all superb.  Even though our event - and the resto - was jammed, service was spot - on, staff were on top of their game.  The food was perfect, and Chef John Coletta came out to take a bow and receive a hearty round of applause. The victuals are very reasonably -priced, the thin crust pizzas being especially tantalizingly tasty.  This is a popular place - and deservedly so!  My highest possible rating...

Service: I absolutely loved the service here, so friendly and always checking in to see if you need anything. Plates were cleared almost immediately after finishing with them. Drinks were received almost moments after being ordered. Atmosphere: Weird little layout, we sat in the front porch area which is what we wanted (love people watching). Clean and very homey.  Food: Fantastic, my boyfriend and I split a lunch special which is a 3 course meal-all the things you love for $25-how can you say no? We split the Gorgonzola dolce to start, which comes with an apricot puree and a delicious raisin nut bread (don't quote me on the raisin portion). The cheese was served at room temperature and was divine-Gorgonzola's (or almost any cheese) is so much better at this temperature, can really appreciate the complexity and flavor profile of the cheese. We then split the burrata salad that comes with roasted beets and arugula-so refreshing and a great textural contrast. Finishing course was the house made tortellini with peas and prosciutto-the pasta was so tender and the snap of the peas really brightened the heaviness of the dish. The next time we are in Madison, we will make a point of stopping again. Our tummies were full to the brim and the bill was less that $35. What a steal.
Perfect pasta, pizza, salads, service. Great for families. We'll be back the next time we are in town, for sure!

The food at Quartinos was pretty fab! A group of 5 girls shared the calamari, the bruschetta, and a pepperoni pizza. We could have and wanted to  order plenty more because everything on the menu sounded so delish but we were just stopping for a smaller lunch.  The calamari was so wonderful. Perfectly tender and crispy on the outside. I wasn't crazy about the marinara sauce on the side but the calamari was definitely one of the best I've ever had.  I would have skipped the bruschetta if I could do it over again. It was three pieces of a toasted bread and each one had different ingredients. Wasn't really what I was expecting. It was kind of bland and weird. Skip.  The pizza was so fresh and gooey and hot, literally right out of the oven to our table. I just had a small piece but the pizza was devoured super quickly by our table. Service was so weird!!! Our server came by only twice and he wasn't very friendly. Like at all. Borderline rude. But the atmosphere was very cozy and I would love to return for a full meal someday.

We visited with a large group and had a great experience.  On the plus side, they are clearly experienced dealing with large groups.  On the negative, this is probably because it is always PACKED - and they definitely jam the tables (and the guests) in the restaurant.  I also noticed an interesting mix of families with rowdy children (that's us!), and young, single people, looking annoyed about all of the families and rowdy children. Otherwise, it is a "small plates" concept.  We ordered a lot of everything, so I had a chance to taste a lot.  We had several of the pizzas and those were great.  I was mostly impressed by how different each of them tasted (they don't just interchange toppings - each pizza has its own flavor).  The crusts are uneven and toasty - perfectly homemade!  I really enjoyed them all.  We also had a tortellini that was amazing - a perfect butter cream sauce that was not overdone.  Additionally, we had parpadalle that came with some kind of ragu.  Personally, I wasn't the biggest fan of the sauce (thought it lacked flavor) - but our table ordered a couple after tasting one - so I must have been outnumbered on that.  We did taste some calamari at the beginning, and that was really excellent. I thought this restaurant was pretty solid - but nothing that knocked my socks off.  This is a good place for groups and for casual outings.  I would not suggest this for a date, unless you're afraid you won't have much to talk about :)

I had dinner with a group of ten friends in the wine room and it was wonderful. We selected a four course dinner with the wine package and were so happy with the quality of the food and wine and the service.

service is awful, asked for the menu to a guy that just ignored me, then 2 sec later a waitress brought it. bread was from the day before, olives and olive oil are cheap and pizza is weird... really did not understand why 4 stars

I frequent Quartinos very regularly at least once a week and they never cease to amaze me. Never had a dish I didn't absolutely love. I'm Italian so I like to believe that I have a good taste for Italian food, and Quartinos never disappoints. Aside from the food, service is always superb. I generally sit in the bar area where all the servers are incredibly pleasant and Will the bartender is also very welcoming, speedy, and knowledgable. I love this place, as long as the doors are open I'll continue to come here.

I love this place.  Reservations are nice but not absolutely necessary. Overall I find that everything is well priced. The sangrias are amazing.  The flatbread pizza can be shared with two people if you order another side dish or appetizer.  We got the polenta fries which were amazing.  They tasted like slices of breaded polenta which were dipped in an amazing sauce.  The margarita and vegetarian pizza can easily be shared with two people.  I would definitely come back for apps and drinks again. If noise or close proximity both you, this might not be the right place. It's very loud and lively. Fine with me and my friends, but not the best when I brought my mom. I'm a sucker for desserts and would definitely recommend the doughnuts and chocolate sauce. Yum!!

Its always busy and crowded but that's because they consistently deliver good quality food and wine at a reasonable price. My favorite dish is the homemade cavatelli with ricotta and basil. Simple but delicious!

Although I have only been to Quartinos twice, the restaurant has placed itself in my mind as a go-to dinner spot when I am downtown Chicago. First of all, the location is great! It's a couple of blocks from popular tourist attractions like the John Hancock Lounge, Mag Mile etc which makes it a very accessible and easy to find place.  The food is also really good. Their menu includes delicious shareable pizzas to all sorts of pasta dishes. My favorite so far is linguine with clams.. which is saying a lot as I am normally NOT a fan of seafood.  Finally the price point of the menu and the fun, happening, lively atmosphere really makes Quartino a place you want to come back to!

The service was really slow here. The gluten-free pasta was actually surprisingly good - I tried it in the alla vodka sauce. The place still remains an okay neighborhood place because of its convenient location but not where I go when craving amazing Italian food.

Quartino is my favorite place for a girls dinner. They have great wine and the calamari is better than I've had anywhere else. Best thing about this place is the prices are reasonable and you can share everything. I just wish I still lived closer.

We have been here several times. Sat at the bar, inside & outside. Each time we are "meh". It's too loud and the service is hit or miss. We aren't too crazy about the wine selection which is just a personal preference but they don't have a solid sauvignon blanc or pinot. We also don't care for the saltiness of every dish. Again this is just personal preference. It is a great location and has great people watching on the patio.

Italian + Tapas = Amazing. I wish I could eat at Quartino every day. Plenty of vegetarian options, and every single thing is delicious. This is one of our go-to places for celebrations. However, it is very noisy and often crowded. The tables are quite close together. Not super great for kids (it's a relaxed, long meal type of experience), but we brought Little Miss Trouble without much problem. There's pizza, after all.

My husband and I are traveling to Italy this year. To plan and prepare, we have been visiting different Italian spots around the city. After going to Quartino, I don't really want to try anywhere else! I just want to keep coming back. I wish I could remember the name of our server, because he was a strong representative for the restaurant. An excellent guide through our meal, SO helpful with wine choices, very kind, always nearby when we had a question. The portions were perfect--a great way to try a lot of their dishes without being overwhelmed. We enjoyed all our food and wine. I especially recommend the bacon dates. The ambiance was lively and fun, even on a crowded evening. Yes!
A bit touristy, but the food makes it all worth it. Charcuterie and pasta are my go tos

I've been here a couple of times now and both were on reservations. Like other reviewer, I highly recommend them because I've seen them quote an hour to hour and a half on most friday nights.  Out of the items I have tried, I have enjoyed the beet and burrata salad, polenta fries, and artisan blend fondue the best. I love anything with burrata and their salad is no exception. The polenta fries are great and i love the red pepper salsa that they serve it with (I also love dipping them in the fondue). The fondue is delicious and for two people, it's plenty - I may get two orders if you have four or more though! I found the gnocchi and eggplant parmesan to be somewhat tasteless. The gnocchi at least had the pesto which added flavor, but I really did not enjoy the eggplant parmesan. The eggplant was thoroughly cooked through, which I like, but the sauce was lacking salt and flavor, which caused the entire dish to do the same. I've been meaning to try the pizzas, but haven't gotten around to it. For dessert, I've had the hot chocolate cake with italian gelato and the italian donuts. I expected a few donuts and you get a huge basket full which is awesome because who doesn't love extra donuts! The hot chocolate cake is so rich and decadent - absolutely delicious, and pairs well with the cold and creamy gelato.  The service has been fine  each time I've been there. However, I agree with the reviews on just how LOUD the place is. It's not loud like you would expect at a packed restaurant - it's literally piercing. And, to even talk to a person you're sitting next to, you have to yell, causing you to contribute to that noise. I'll have to try the suggestion of sitting on the patio next time instead.

Everything I had was great! Real Authentic fresh Italian food!! I especially enjoyed an anti-pasto platter which contained so many great nibbles! I also really enjoyed their pizza, which was very authentic to say the least! I also met Chef John who was very personable and nice, service was excellent! 100%!

This was one of the best bar table meals we have had. Just a few apps and a bottle of wine (weekly special $30)  Definitely recommend sitting in the bar if you have a show to catch. Carpaccio was great, almost ordered a second round. Meatballs didn't knock me off my seat but quite good. Meat selection was good ask your server for their favorite. We had an after dinner cocktail and it was 3 times bigger than expected. Over food and drinks great. Service lacked but we did sit in the bar. We will go back

First time I was here, it was a beautiful day and my friend and I were drawn in by the fabulous outdoor seating. Shared a pizza and the donuts for dessert and both were super delicious.  Went back again because I knew I had to try the pasta! Tortellini was sooo good and the caramelized gelato with biscotti was to die for.  Absolute perfect lunch spot - will definitely come again! Tips: -Pasta comes in half portions! (Super affordable and the perfect size with an appetizer and/or dessert)
One of my favorite places for pizza. The restaurant has also a very cozy feeling. I never feel rushed there regardless of how busy they are.

Looking for a nice Italian restaurant near our hotel and found this place. WAIT: No wait, we made reservations about a month in advance and got seated right away. ATMOSPHERE: It's a fun restaurant, dimly lit but lively I could see it being a good place for a birthday dinner or date.  It has TVs and lots of stuff on the walls. FOOD: Their prices are fairly reasonable and the portion sizes decent.   CAVATELLI - they say it's house made pasta, which I was excited about but it wasn't as good as some other restaurants I've had.  It definitely tasted fresh and fairly chewy but nothing to rave on and on about.  The dish itself had tomato sauce and ricotta cheese on top.  The sauce was a little on the bland side. VEAL - several of the people in our group ordered this and it looked pretty decent.  They give you a good amount of meat and arugula salad.  It did look a little overcooked though. Overall, probably a decent place to come for pizza or pasta.

I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to Italian food, in all fairness it's because I was turned onto one of the best Italian restaurants when I was young (Osteria's In Palo Alto). Because of this it's very hard for me to find a great Italian restaurant, there's nothing i hate more than a so called "Italian" restaurant not knowing how to cook pasta. Pasta is supposed to be al dente, it's not supposed to be super soft but have some firmness, it's supposed to have a texture to it. Okay rant over onto the review: Went here 3 times when I was in Chicago for training and I loved each experiences! so much that anytime my wife asked me where we should go for dinner I would say "Quartino". Loved the bread that they serve right away, just a little bit of parmesan and olive oil and your good to go. Cheese plates where nice, didn't love every cheese but it was great to try like 3 for around $14. The pizza! man the pizza was amazing! My wife said it was the best in Chicago. Such great crust, highly recommend the margarita. The veal meatball sliders are another great treat and only a few buck. Now onto the most important thing their pasta, yum it was on point! I only ordered their home-made pastas and they where excellent. Desserts where amazing. The only thing I didn't really like was their meat dishes, the chicken was super dry, don't recommend it, the steak was okay.  I also brought my 4 year old and my 2 month old and the staff was super nice, even though my kid can be challenging. Overall 3 amazing meals that I'll always be remembering when I think of Chicago.

I ate here for appetizers and it was a Meh experience at best.  We sat in the bar and an obnoxious crowd of college basketball fans ruined the night. I don't know if it was the team or the kids, but once they left I wanted to clap!  The food was okay, not great.  So many other options in Chicago-won't be back.

The food was about four and a half star but the employees working there were nothing but amazing and helpful that's why they get 5 stars the shrimp appetizer as well as the duck prosciutto was simply just amazing and very tasty got to give it up to Chicago Italian restaurants. This is 3rd restaurant  in just weeks time that have been nothing but impressive.

Had a lovely lunch at Quartino yesterday. My waiter Lenny was very attentions and pleasant recommending drinks and suggesting to order half portions of the 2 pastas I wanted to try, which I did. The food was delicious and my app Polanta fries was very crunchy and yummii. For dessert a had their house made Tiramissu super creamy and very generous portion to share.
What is there not to love about this restaurant? The atmosphere is great. Their food is delicious and their wine which is a reasonable price is also very good.

We never hated a meal here. Although it caters to ther purist crowd we've always felt like we belong. If you want to meet friends for drinks head to the bar. More intimate, head upstairs. It's quiet. Food is great, and I recommend ordering wine of the month!  Meatballs and Brussels sprouts are a plus. Pizza is what we stick with and have not been bummed yet.

Our group of ten, came in for lunch.  We had awesome service, Scott was awesome, he explained the menu and the restaurant's serving style.  The salads were great, we would up doubling our orders they were so good.  The veal meatballs melted in our mouths.  The house wines both white and red were very good.  We finished our afternoon with an assortment of desserts.  They were the perfect end to our meal.  Loved it.  We'll be back!!!

Had a great meal here!  First off, valet parking on the ONTARIO side of the street. Took me a couple of times around the block, but the boys in the green jackets and I eventually met up.  Excellent menu - Authentic Italian, some of the top in the city. Skeptical? All the waiters wear Italian soccer jerseys. If this doesn't silence your criticism, you may as well jump ship and work for Trip Advisor.  For as good as the meal was, the service was better. We ordered a few appetizers to get started, with some GREAT WINE. the 2013 Banfi Col di Sasso - smooth initial taste with a vibrant, sweet finish. Anyway, our server forgot to tell the kitchen to make our pizza. He felt awful, and immediately apologized. Furthermore, he brought us free lemon jello shots. They were so good - had I not drove, I would've gotten a few more. He also told us to give his name when we come next, and that he'd get us right in. Talk about customer Service.  Ultimately - one of my new favorite spots in the city. It can get a bit noisy - but, it's Italian!

One of the best meals I've had in a long time! Went here for a bachelorette party which was great because they allow reservations for large parties. It's a tapas restaurant so be prepared to order many small plates. I ordered the baby octopus and the Brussel sprouts and then samples some of the other ladies dishes. We were not disappointed and everyone loved their dish.  Also, order the dates; you will not be disappointed. Overall a great meal and the atmosphere was fun and welcoming.  Def coming back next time I'm in Chicago.

The best meal we had in Chicago and we ate everywhere. We highly recommend the burrata and beets, grilled octopus (delish), rigatoni with lamb sugo, osso buco, and we ended with torta al cioccolato (wow). At the end Patrick the general manager comes by to make sure everything was good. If you come here ask for Nick, he will take care of you. We trusted him from the wine recommendation through dessert. He was awesome!!  Our favorite restaurant you won't regret it!

Last night we had a party for 75 people.  The food was excellent and plentiful.  The staff was very attentive.  All of the guests, which is unusual when you have so many people, said it was one of the best meals they had.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  Ellen G.  Plainview, NY
Went there with my girlfriend and sister and her husband. We all loved our food and the drinks were great. :) I had the tortellini alfredo and died from the deliciousness. Highly recommend!!

Went here for dinner with a friend on a Sunday and it was disappointing.  I love Italian food and could live on risotto.  I actually gained 12 pounds travelling through Rome and Florence (thank God for stretch pants!). Soooo, I was excited to eat here given the mostly positive reviews.  Maybe they had an off-night but I was disappointed overall.  They were packed and - our fault for not having reservations - we opted for the bar rather than waiting 30-40 minutes for a table.  Pros: There's a good selection on the menu, there's outdoor seating, the waitress was friendly and informative, and they have one of  those old-style bathrooms with the attendant. Cons: Part of my dinner order came out a good 15 minutes before the other part and before any of my friend's food, so of course it was cold.  We ordered the sausage risotto which had zero flavor and the gnocchi which was meh We had to ask 3 times for Parmesan cheese (different people because we could not find our waitress) While the waitress was friendly, after we placed our order we did not see her again until we were 30 minutes into our meal The portion sizes are small for the price point There are so many great Italian places in the city, I doubt I would go back here.

Came here with some buddies after a recommendation from a friend. Pizza was great, I had the "Manzo" and it was delicious. Also tried sautéed calamari but it was cut in bigger than average chunks which I didn't like but the taste was there. Tortellini was great with a generous amount of prosciutto

Came here for dinner as it was right next to our hotel. The atmosphere is loud and family friendly. The cheese plate was really good as well as the pizza! Service was good and the the hot chocolate molten cake was amazing! A manager came over and checked on us while we were eating and gave us his card. Pleasant experience and my husband LOVED the food. We will most likely be back before the end of our trip!

we came here on a rainy Friday night and was so glad that they still had seats for two we ordered a tasting salami platter, highly recommend it as you can try a bit of everything. we really liked the cheese and the salami, especially the truffle salami, it is very rich in the truffle taste. the olives are awesome too! we also ordered the gelato in a cocktail glass, loved the chocolate flavor one!

I went to a bachlorette party here and enjoyed it so much that I had my 28th birthday dinner here with a large group of friends!  This place is great for large groups! I think total I had about 18 people and they were great about reservations and service.  We tried a bunch of small plates that were passed around.  My personal favorite was the Porcini & Truffle Risotto  The risotto was a pile of creamy goodness!  Other table favorites were the Penne alla Vodka, Tortellini with alfredo sauce, and the Eggplant Parmigiana.

Absolutely great food, unpretentious and affordable, but still great atmosphere and a classy place for a nice meal, take your time and enjoy sharing small plates of excellent food and wine. Their pizzas are stupendous and their gnocchi is fabulous!

We were in town for a couple days and didn't really know where to eat. I randomly chose Quartino. Are we glad we did!  We made an early reservation for 5:30 so the restaurant was still a bit quiet The waiter was very attentive. When we asked for some help, he readily gave us some tips on what to order.  We ordered pizza for our son and then some dishes for my husband and me.  Yummy!  I took off one star because the pacing of the dishes was a bit off.  By the time we finished our meal an hour or so later, the place was packed.  I'm glad we dined early. The three of us totally enjoyed our dinner here and if ever we are back in Chicago, we will definitely re-visit this place.

The very best thing at QUARTINO IS The Manager ALICIA--HANDS DOWN!!!! I was with delightful d (so read her review) Food was just okay for me!!! We had shrimp, salmon, pasta in vodka sauce n a pizza --none of our dishes had meat due to us observing Lent.   So now that Lent is over I will go again!!!!  Hoping to try a few different dishes with meat and hoping to love the food on my 2nd visit.  The restaurant is very kid friendly
Great place, the best host i have come across. They were almost closed and done taking the last order. We walked in really hungry, and they made a recommendation. The food was just the cherry on top

Came here with a group of 6 friends on Saturday. Made a reservation for noon and it was relatively empty when we arrived; it gradually filled up as we were there. The service was great and the interior gave off a very homely feel. We ordered a salumi platter to share which was ok; nothing special. For our entrees, I ordered a soprano pizza as did two of my other friends. Another ordered the brussel sprouts salad and the rest ordered pasta. The food was decent but same as the platter; it was nothing special. I think I went in expecting too much and was disappointed. Probably won't make another visit considering all the other options in the city.

Excellent atmosphere! Brought my significant other to Quartino for his birthday and I got a nice mix of fancy + affordable. Bottles of wine are not pricey at all, cheapest one is $15. $15 for a fancy-ish restaurant? Not bad at all. Their food was good but exactly what you would expect from an Italian Restaurant.
This place is great for a large group, as they can accommodate big parties pretty easily.  The food is fine and it is relatively inexpensive, however it is nothing I am rushing back to eat again.

Love this place, we go every time we are in Chicago. Great options at reasonable prices for Chicago. Waiters are always friendly and knowledgeable. We had the Salumeria Tasting for $25, had lots of yummy plates - I would highly recommend this option for starters. The pizza was great and the zeppoles for dessert are yummy. Wine is a good price too!

Great place! Very affordable and quality without being pretentious. As authentic as it can be.  The pizza is Neapolitan style which is my favorite pizza. The wine selection is inexpensive ( of course, you could also " Barolized" yourself and spend all you want, but I suggest to explore the garage options. Pasta were all al dente and smaller portions so you can order a few. Service was very fast, but professional. I'll be back when in the area.

So I would really only give three stars here for food but the other two are added for amazing service. I came here with my brother and mom for a lunch and was really excited because I been wanting to stop in here for years and it never happened. Decided to give it a try and I was highly disappointed in the food. Nothing was bad just nothing amazed me had a pizza, penne alla vodka, salmon and shrimp. When the wait or asked me how things were I said okay, he questioned that and I told him why. He apologized and I said no problem. Soon after this wonderful woman Alicia a manager came by to talk to our table. She was so professional and highly upset we were not satisfied and insisted on making us another meal. We were full so we settled on free Limon cello (amazing) and doughnuts (delish). She told me that she definitely wanted us to come back in so she can make us some complimentary items and show us how the food really is amazing. She gave us her card and I thanked her. Truly didn't expect that but it shows you that this restaurant cares about their customers. Before Alicia I probably wouldn't have returned but I will now because of her stellar customer service. I will return soon. Thank you Alicia.

I am really really sad.  My experience last night was most definitely a 3.  I have never had a bad experience, until last night.  90% of the food was bland, what the heck?! So we ordered wine, i was pleased with both reds.  So that was good. We start with  a meat/cheese/veggie tray, we had salami, proscuitto, cheeses and olives.  It was a tasty start, along with the white bean spread.  Then we ordered gnocchi...it was extremely bland.  Then the risotto with asparagus arrived, also very bland.  Next were the polenta fries, they tasted like nothing.  I was going crazy with the salt, and so was everyone else at my table.  The brussels sprouts we ordered were just fine.  Then we ordered the octopus, which was more flavorful, so that helped.  Finally, we ordered the cavatelli, which has always been a favorite, and finally we had a tasty item that was cooked perfectly with a really nice sauce.  At least we ended on a high note.   I was really surprised because I have never had a blah experience there before.  I will go back because this was my first just ok experience, and I'll assume it was just a bad night.

I came here for dinner. Very busy and loud atmosphere. The space around the seating/tables seemed kind of tight to walk around. There were many times where the servers kept bumping into chairs. House bread was pretty basic, just plain french bread, nothing special. I got the penne alla vodka- delicious and cooked to al dente! My friend got the rigatoni (great sauce) and my boyfriend got the gnocchi (could have more flavor, just tasted salty). The dishes are meant to be shared so the portion is small if you get the plate for yourself. We could've gotten 5 plates for a more fulfilling dinner, but each plate is around 10 bucks.

I've been here a handful of times with groups of anywhere from 2 to 8! It's great for all sizes. The food is tapas style italian and everything is pretty delicious. Great for vegetarians as well! Especially the penne vodka and the pizzas! Also, do not leave without trying the Torta al Cioccolato (molten lava cake). SO GOOD!
Busy place with servers that are always on a rush. Very friendly hostess and manager good of on the medium side but the atmosphere is nice. Give it a try when you are in downtown Chicago.

This place is great.  We were visiting Chicago with our kids and stayed right across the street.  We made reservations through open table and even though the place was packed they took us to our table right away.  This is "tapas style" Italian, which means some of the portions are smaller.  The appetizers were normal portions however (we had the goat cheese, which was massive, and calamari).  Both appetizers were great.  The kids got pizza and the wife and I split some penne alla vodka and some steak.  Everything tasted fantastic and the service was spot on!  Definitely going back the next time we are in Chicago!

We went on Monday night for birthday  in this fabulous place. It was actually crowd, but they found for us table for 6 people.   The interior of Quartino was transfer us to Italy. All waitresses were in Italian soccer teams t-shirts. First what we try in this place was bread, so soft, fresh and taste good. Then we ordered couple plates. I ordered pasta with clams ( never try better pasta before), my friends ordered pork steak, which was for 2 people, but meat was so juicy and cooked perfect. Some of them ordered octopus, also was great.  And in the end of the night we ordered ice cream and fondue, it was probably the best part of the night.  Quartino was the  best place that I visited for the year.  Actually they also have huge glasses of wine.

I'm kind of stumped in regards to the rave reviews for Quartino. Everyone carries on and on about it and Yelpers seem to love it just as much. First of all, it's good, I will be likely be back. It's just not spectacular. For the positives, the ambiance is nice - cozy and ktichsy with a busy vibe, just like it is in Italy. The slight aromas of Italian fare from the tables close together are a mingling of fresh garlic and spices. it's a welcome sight to see bread, and actually good Italian bread, olive oil and Parmesan to be part of the experience and not part of the bill. Service was very good and although the restaurant was packed on Sunday night, we were allowed to stay and linger in the bar (with full service), for at least 3 hours. The Malbec was of a good quality. The wild Arugula salad was fresh and filling. It was the eggplant Parmesan that was just okay at best. Lots of tomato sauce, a big basil leaf, a bit of mozzarella cheese and a few pieces of eggplant. While we were warned that the plate was hot, mine was cold, like refrigerator cold, which was so very odd. I didn't want to complain, so I just ate a portion of it until it seemed ridiculous to eat that dish cold. All in all, Quartino is a fine establishment for drinks & apps, or a simple Italian meal, it's just not great.

Great, great service. This is not an Olive Garden clone sort of place. Had the salumeria sampler, it was easily more than two people could eat. We complimented the bartender on their house-cured meats (try the duck prosciutto, you won't be sorry) and mentioned I had read a book on curing salami but hadn't worked up the nerve to try it yet. Next thing we know a manager turns up and gives us a tour of the meat-curing operation. First class service, the staff couldn't be nicer, and the food is incredible. Don't miss this place.

This place looks like it's alive during the entire time it's open. The place has a very European feel to it. The food I had was delicious and not too small or too big of a portion. I had the linguine with clams and a espresso martini. The martini was a wonderful twist, it tasted very much like a Starbucks drink mixed with some light liquor. The linguine was delicious as well, they gave the option of white or red sauce ( I love that option). The linguine was meant to be eaten at more of a table rather than the bar area but nonetheless it was still really enjoyable. I would love to come back to try the other options they offer. The only downside was the service. It looked like at the time there was only one person servicing the bar area and that poor girl was everywhere- so it took a while for us to order anything.

This is a cute little place that my friend and I came across while walking through the city so we stopped for a pre-dinner snack. We sat in the bar area and had wine, salami and cheese. The truffle salami was amazing! The wine list was great and they serve the wine in little glasses which was kind of a throw back to old Italy. The waitstaff was very helpful and friendly and the ambiance was wonderful- kind of dimly lit which I liked. I can't speak for the food but the place really filled up while we were there so it must be good! I would definitely recommend Quartino!

I came here with some friends while in town on business. The food was delicious! Everything can be ordered either full or half portion.  I ordered the half Wild Arugula salad, which came with a generous portion (enough to share as a starter for 2-3), and the Orecchiete pasta, which was delicious. The plates are designed to be able to share with friends, or can also be ordered as individual portions. My friends and I also got a liter of their red sangria -- an absolute must! Prices were very reasonable. We'd definitely come again next time we're in town!
I really like Quartino's because it's appropriate for dinner with children. There aren't many restaurants in River North that seem family friendly. Plus, you can always count on the food to be great!

Yesssss Quartino. Even though it's so close to Mag Mile, it's truly an Italian gem. Been here quite a few times and consistently loved the experience. Favorite dishes: - Quattro Staggioni Pizza (omg could eat this whole thing) - House Made Goat's Milk Ricotta (comes with fresh toasted bread, sooo good) - Penne all Vodka - Prosciutto wrapped Dates - Wild Arugula Salad  The wine is really well priced, as is the food. And the food is truly DELICIOUS. You can't go wrong. Quartino is an amazing place to bring a group of friends/family as the small plates are great for sharing and you can really try a ton of the menu. It gets quite loud in here as the restaurant is massive, so that can be a little annoying. Otherwise, the food comes out fast and fresh and the service is great.

Legitimately the worst service I have ever had in my life. If you can't accommodate large groups, just say so. Sat in the restaurant for 1.5 hours for my food and 2.5 hours before I received my check. Absolutely ridiculous. Hope they had fun catching my clams out of the river since that's how long it took for them to be on my plate.

I can't figure out why this restaurant is so highly rated. We had reservations for 3 for 7pm on a Sunday. First we ordered the fried calamari and the tasting special they have which is just cut meats, olives, veg and cheeses. And also some wine.  This took a good 45 minute to an hour to get out and we were not pleased. When we realized how long this took we decided to order the penne in vodka sauce and linguine with clams when the starters came out, which did not have such a long wait time.  The food overall was basic at best. The calamari was tender however the breading kept falling off and we had to be scraping it off the plate to get some crunch. The tasting spread was good. The penne vodka did not live up to standards I'm used to. The linguine with clams was decent. If you want an intimate setting, this is not for you as the restaurant is very large, crowded, bright and very noisy. Will not be going back.

Nice little affordable, tapas style menu! The gnocchi and pizzas are a personal favorite. There is a nice outdoor patio and a private party area in the upstairs section that is great for events. One downside is that the inside part of the restaurant is very loud because of the tin ceiling they have.

So far so good. Food was the best at the best quality. The waiters where nice and prices where right on target. If you're looking for some decent Italian food downtown please come to Quartino if you are on a budget.

The pizza here absolutely blows me away! The crust is soft, but I love the flavor and texture. Quartino claims that it is a Neapolitan Pizza, but whatever it is, I like it better than what is served at Spacca Napoli.  I highly recommend getting a balsamic drizzle on top of any pizza. It's not too tart or tangy and it compliments the pizza nicely. An amazing charcuterie, cheese, olive, and Spuntini (these are miniature gourmet salads) selection is featured. If you are not a fan of pizza, you have several other fabulous options to choose from. This establishment also offers an excellent selection of wines by the glass. The servers are knowledgeable regarding the wines and happy to make a good recommendation. As other people have stated the $25 lunch option is a good deal and offers you a nice selection.

My go to place when visiting Chicago. Great food and service at good prices. Their wine list is amazing. Try the Lazio. The cheese fondue, zeppoles and Nutella panini are my favorites. Their pastas taste amazing. All in all, can't wait to visit again.

"I just want to live here and eat nothing but cheese and pizza." -actual quote from the night.  We were a little daunted by the menu, but our waitress was fantastic and made us feel less-dumb.  Our dinner included: The assortment of olives: the only thing we didn't care for.  Taleggio that comes with a raisin bread and grape salad: all amazing! Probably my favorite part of the meal was this board.  Fettuccini Alfredo: creamy and delicious! Gnocchi: an amazing dish, the potatoes and green beans were an unexpected, but fantastic addition to the pesto.  And free bread? This place is a winner (we could tell by the atmosphere just walking in that it was going to be good!) I'll be back for sure. I want more cheese! I'd love to try the pizza and the house-cured salami!

I think I'd probably hate the Mediterranean, because I hated this food, and it felt Mediterranean.  Lots of weird olives.  The waitstaff was fantastic though.  You can blame me. I'll stay away from places like this in the future.
I'm not sure what all the fuss is about.  The food was average.  Via De Stato across the street does a much better job with the same concept.

We we're excited to try this place after all the great reviews, but for us it didn't live up to the hype. Service was pleasant and accommodating, but busy, and not always available. Food was mediocre and bland at best. I don't think we came on an off night because the place was packed, maybe it just wasn't for us.  The escarole and beans were a bright spot, the roasted peppers the lowest point. The romain hearts with extra virgin olive oil, honey, and lemon were a disappointment. It's great that they have gluten free pasta but it was bland, mushy, and overcooked. Overall a disappointing meal in a city w great food.

This place is amazing! Food is out of this world. We had about 9 pasta plates to share and each one was better than the next. We even got fondue to start which was literally like dipping pasta sauce. The drinks were also amazing. I highly recommend the 75 and the sangria. Only down side is that they try to cram way too many tables into the restaurant. You are literally sitting on top of the table next to you, and the waitstaff is clearly overworked. Our waitress was very nice, but I had to remind her multiple times to get me a drink and she could barely hear me when I asked.

With the number of reviews already existing for this restaurant, I'm sure mine will get lost. However, I love traveling to cities and finding my local Yelpers' reviews of destination restaurants, so hopefully if I've got some Louisville folks in Chicago, my review will motivate them to stop in to Quartino! During a work trip to the Windy City, I wanted a place close to my hotel for dinner that wasn't outrageous. Quartino's menu fit the bill.  I arrived around 6pm and was seated immediately in a cozy little corner at a table for two. A server brought a glass bottle of tap water in addition to a plate of bread. Very quickly I was able to give my order and surprisingly fast, my food arrived. I had the Pappardelle al Sugo di Manzo (pasta with braised beef) and it definitely hit the spot.  What I really loved was that the idea at Quartino is to share plates, and so since I was on my own, the portion was a little smaller than most restaurants, so I didn't feel stuffed by the end of the meal. My server mentioned that there were options with the menu as well...if you want half portions, double, etc. I was fine with the portion that was served. However, I took advantage of the half portion for dessert when I ordered the nutella panini and capped it off with a decaf coffee. Perfect end to a pleasant meal. The ambiance, price, and service all really add up to make this a five-star establishment in my book!

Friendly service, nice bar area and good food. Late night spot for those looking to eat something the kitchen can put together fast. Came in around midnight after drinking earlier with a few friends at another bar.  The ambiance is perfect embodiment for a downtown chicago drinking well with a simple yet delicious italian menu. It is dark inside, but it adds to the charm of this gem.  Prices are definitely on par if not a bargain for a downtown bar thats open late. I ordered the Quattro Stagioni and my friend ordered something from the antipasta menu.  My reason for the ONE missing star and most would have given more than one ... my pizza was unevenly cooked ... not to mention BURNED on a couple of slices..... thats a no-no.  I definitely will try you out again and give you an updated review next time i am in town.

Quartino is always a great choice for delicious food in an upscale environment that won't break the budget. I was disappointed once with the meatballs (cold in the middle), but otherwise I've always been pleased. All of the risottos are delicious; the beef tagliatelle is amazing; the pizzas are all solid; the salads are all quite good. There's a reason I keep coming back!

A good standby. Love the bar staff. Great pours, good, unique wine selection. Very reasonable for the food quality, lots of Italian/mediterranean small bites, sides. Great salads (salumi salad is awesome, a meal on its own, great value). Lively atmosphere, good vibe. All of these qualities and the fact Quartino is not a chain keep me coming back.

Very good Italian food!!! Beef Carpaccio was amazing!!!!  The Lunch Special($25) is very good deal! You can choose few items. Beef Carpaccio: Amazing! Must try! Pizza: has a lot of flavor but I don't like the texture. I prefer to Eataly pizza. Truffle Risotto: Very good!! It has so much flavor!!  Pork: It's ok. Banana Dessert: Very good! I like the gelato.

Quartino's small dishes make it a perfect date location or place to meet with friends. Order several of the dishes so you can sample a little bit of everything (think tapas, but Italian food!). Our favorites were the calamari, the margherita pizza, and the tagliatelle bolognese. They also have lots of creative sangrias, both white and red, in various sizes. A little trivia for Bachelor tv show fans: Chris Soules and Whitney came here on her hometown date in Chicago! :)

This place is SO GOOD! The food is delicious and the waiters are friendly and really know their stuff. It is a little loud so it might not be a good place for a date but rather a night out with friends. I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken and it was one of the best I've ever had. I also tried my friend's Tortellini as well as the Risotto and it was also great. We got a bottle of wine from Napa which was also enjoyable. It does get busy so try to call ahead, or visit one of the bars nearby and they'll text you when your table is ready, but trust me, it's worth the wait! The desserts looked delicious but I was too full to try.

My husband and I just hosted our Wedding Rehearsal Dinner here on 2/19/16. From the get-go, Julie in planning and events was fantastic to work with. She was super responsive to emails. For a friday night rehearsal dinner in Chicago,IL Quartino we knew we would be spending a lot, but some places in River North charge just stupid amount of money and Quartino was the best deal we found from a price standpoint AND to the amount of food/drink you can get for your money. It was a no brainer to pick Quartino.  As the planning process went on, we were able to set up our own complimentary tasting for our event. My fiance and I went to the tasting and the waiter we worked with was amazing. Him and the manager worked with us to finalize a menu we felt satisfied with for our rehearsal dinner.  The day of our event we showed up and were greeted by one of the head waiters Roberto and the manager Alysia. THEY WERE AMAZING!!!! Roberto was so unbelievably nice (so was the rest of the wait-staff and Alysia was as sweet and as helpful as can be. We had 40 guests, we had our own private room upstairs, We went with the 5 course family style meal option, basic beer and wine package and the final bill ended up being a little short of our $3000 food and beverage room minimum. Alysia and Roberto recommended a variety of wines to take home and they were so great about that too.  Whenever I have a bigger event or party to plan or if you are looking for a restaurant to host an event..... PLEASE USE QUARTINO!!!!! It was the best night ever. SO SO SO happy :)

Sharing is caring here at Quartino's. Bring more friends, try more dishes.  The paper thin verticals slices of zucchini pizza is marvelous, cured duck prosciutto and white bean spread are my favorites. You almost can't go wrong.  Service is fast-paced, but you get a real tour of what the restaurant specialties are.  Attended a fun bachelorette dinner here in a special dinning area.  We like to order take away sometimes to avoid the weekend mobs.

One of my favorite places in town. Veal meatballs and bacon wrapped dates are exceptional. They're always packed, I suggest making reservations in advance to avoid a wait.  One of the few places in town I've seen Lambrusco on the wine menu- completes the meal. Service is always pleasant but the place is huge and quite busy so sometimes you do need to wait a little.

This place is old school I have been coming here for a while. The food is great, great for bigger parties (which I have attended), and decent prices for the great service. I will continue to go there.
We love the salumeria tasting. It's fun to try a lot of things. The service is incredible! And they have gluten-free options, including gf crackers to go with the tasting.

My husband and I decided to check out Quartino for the first time last night.  We chose it for 3 reasons...1. Our friend was in for work from out of town and staying in the area 2.  My husband and I were seeing a show at Broadway playhouse at water tower which is also in the area 3.  It had some great reviews on Yelp! We got the mixed olives, burrata and beet salad, margarita pizza, rigatoni in vodka sauce and the shrimp. Everything was very delicious...amazing vodka sauce!   My husband and I got the Sangiovese for our wine which was a great price and smooth.  Speaking of price, the 3 of us got out of there for $100...before tip...to me that is unheard of in Chicago to have full belts plus 2 beers and a liter of wine!  Definitely worth it! We can't wait to go back and explore the menu more (especially because our friend we were dining with is pescatarian so we didn't order any of the amazing meat dishes)...  I guess that would be the forth reason I chose the restaurant! ;-)
great energy and fun atmosphere ... real value for downtown.

Authentic Italian restaurant, right off the boat! Family oriented, don't be shy to bring a group. They will accommodate you! Quick friendly service. Kids loved the pizza and the atmosphere. We enjoyed a tapas dish, $10 red chianti carafe was plenty of wine for one, two could share. Skip Uno's pizza(down the road and a good place of course)-but give this place a try instead! You will be happy you did!

This place is soooo much fun. It's always busy and crowded, it's loud (but in a good way). Not the little romantic or neighborhood Italian dinner spot - Michael Corleone would not have been comfortable here - too many people.  The food is great, service impeccable, and the selection will knock your socks off. Be ready to share, the plates are on the table for. A reason - if you don't share; well you may not like this place (chances are you're going to be eating alone anyway if you're not a good sharer).  Be ready to have a good time. See my rock reviews and subscribe @  m.youtube.com/watch?v=L4…

Aaaaaaaaaaaaammmmmmmaaaaaaazzzzzziiiiiiiiiinnnnnnn­nnggggggggg! Date night with my husband.  Great atmosphere,  loved the vibe. A great place to go if you want to enjoy a great evening with good company.  I recommend the pizza, of course staff suggested it for me, but it was very helpful. I like that he was knowledgeable and informative, very polite. I will be back, the pizza was something different but definitely something to try.  I heard the pasta was amazing as well, I will have to  try it next time I go. And I do plan on going back soon.
Just go... It's a slice of classic Italian/Sicilian specialties... Everything from the wine to the house made apperativo... It's like being back in Italy! And the value is amazing!
Awesome italian food.  Menu items are set to share.  Great to go with a group of people.  The place is always crowded, but in a good way.

When I arrived there with a party of six, I was embarrassed to realize that I accidentally made reservations for the wrong night. The front house manager didn't hesitate to reassure me that they'd work us in. They sat us within 10 minutes and we had a wonderful time. They really saved my ass!

Food was excellent! More than the pizza any of the pasta dishes you can't go wrong. Definitely that home made taste. The only complain that I would have is that for a table of two the table is small so why not clear out our plates? We running out of room, I almost had to put our watter bottle on the floor.

This place is amazing!!!!  Food, wine, atmosphere, and the service was all great.  Our server Paul was very friendly and really took our dining experience to the next level! He even offered to mail the free postcard that they provide out for us! Absolutely wonderful! I suggest getting a bottle of the house wine...it's cheaper than the water ;)

We were in Chicago for a long weekend and decided on Quartino for our last dinner there.  The service and the food were impeccable.  Our server and the manager were friendly and well educated on the menu.  If you're in Chicago and want great food and good service at a reasonable price stop in!

We have been coming here for YEARS! Chef John Coletta is a constantly learning and hard working chef that puts all the others to shame. If you have the honor of dining here, more than likely he will come say hello or simply how things are going. When you're here he treats you like a friend even with how INSANELY busy they are, he will always take the time to say hi. If you've been here you know how outstanding the food is. If you haven't hurry up and come in! Sooooo yummy!! Customers for life.

Loooooooooooooooooove this place. My wife and I have been having a huge pre-Christmas feast here with friends for years. The dishes are so delicious and so shareable that it's become a beloved tradition. Will be for a long time to come.

I see so many good reviews to this place that I had to go. Don't get me wrong, the food is great and the servers are too. This is definitely a nice place to go while downtown. Would I recommend it? Yes Is it the best Italian place I've been? No

Quartino's is the BEST spot for a girls dinner. Let me explain: - Get a few thin crust pizzas (all around $15) - Get a few carafes of wine (the $10 ones) And for the very low cost of about $30, you have a ton of food and drink per person. The carafes are about 3 glasses of wine. Get one for yourself. Don't worry about the judgement - it's fleeting.

I love Quartino!  There are SO many good dishes and it's fun to try different things that my friends/fam order.  I always seem to get the cheese fondue, the gnocchi, and the short ribs.  Yum!  I've been here countless times and never had bad service and never a bad meal.  Oh and the Limoncello is delicious!

This restaurant had a great, lively ambiance.  There were lots of food options.  I went with my teenage daughter who is a vegetarian and we found plenty of choices.  The portions were large so we shared a couple of dishes.  We enjoyed the shrimp risotto.

I traveled all the way from Texas to have my Birthday dinner here and I my experience has made me a patron for life. Reasonably priced, great  My friends and I had reservations at 5PM and were promptly seated. They wanted to seat us near the kitchen but being from out of town I wanted something closer to the bar. We got a three top in the middle of the bar and I was happy. Shinead* assisted us throughout our dinner and was an attentive to our needs, thank you!!. This was my second visit to this restaurant on the recommendation of a co-worker during a training visit to Indiana. I am so glad I chose this restaurant, THERE TORTELINNI IS WORTH THE MILES TRAVELED!!!!! It is simply amazing, in its simplicity and presentation. I enjoyed a glass of Rose and I was a Happy Birthday Girl. Also the Ravioli and Brussels Sprouts were very tasty.  Great for sharing plates and they do half portions!!!  Towards the end of our experience a few patrons had come in for their meal but were very obnoxiously loud. After 5 minutes of them trying to arrange the bar tables themselves and failing, I finally had to ask them to stop yelling in my ear. Shinead noticed the frustration that was now present on all the faces of my friends and I, and apologized. What happened next made me a customer of Quartino for life... We had already paid the tab and she asked us to wait because she wanted to bring the manager around. He approached us and asked how our dinner was and made a point to apologize on behalf of Quartino that other guests had disrupted our dinner.  When he found out we were visiting from Texas, he was shocked and asked if he could give me a gift of Champagne. I have worked in hospitality for 10+ years and you only have experiences like this a few times in life, but I guarantee you I will talk about this for the rest of my life. Thank you Shinead and Peter for your dedication to service and commitment to the experiences your guest have at Quartino.  I will definitely be back.

2nd visit : 1st review. Quartino is a reasonably priced, great dining and service experience.  Food is served a la tapas style, meaning the plates are shareable. This makes it a really fun experience if you are dining with a group because you get to try lots of different flavors. In my two visits, neither I nor my dining companions found fault with any dish and in fact, loved it all. Definitely try the pizza, pastas and salads. All are flavorful, seasonal and fresh. Service is top notch and friendly. You will leave with a smile.

This is a great spot in river north for food and drinks with friends. It has great food, great service, and a fun atmosphere. It is very loud so maybe not the best for an intimate occasion. This is definitely a go-to restaurant downtown!
Great place for Italian small plates. Great pizzas, excellent veal meatballs and tasty sangria.  Friendly staff and a nice atmosphere.

I love Quartino. As an Italian woman with extremely high standards for Italian Cuisine, that is saying a lot. I was on the fence about coming here the first time because Italian food is not typically served as tapas, but that is in fact what makes this place so great. The first time I was here, my date and I ordered a bunch of different items ranging from pastas, meatballs, cheese plates, and a version of fruitte de marre. Delicious! My date and I were back this weekend for our anniversary and utilized the restaurant week menu, which was a special with one appetizer plate, one pasta plate, and one seafood/meat/vegetarian plate PLUS dessert! At $33/person, this is a great promotion as most of the plates range from $8-$15. The promotion is going on until February 4, so if you're thinking about trying this place but don't want to break the bank, I highly recommend doing so!

I have to say Quartino is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in town! They made great Italian tapas!  We arrived a bit late of our 6pm reservation tonight, and seated immediately . Our waiter was friendly, got us water and menus right away.  Here's what we had tonight:   -Veal meatballs Napoli. Very juicy, the raisins added a slightly-sweet flavor.  -Linguine with clams. Fresh clams in the shell cooked perfectly together with the pastas.   -Braised pork shank. Always the superstar! It was so tender and delicious, the meat just fell off the bones.   -Gran Coppa Quartino. Three flavors of gelato(vanilla, strawberry & chocolate) in a big cup with fresh strawberries and whipped cream on top.     The blood orange soda tasted good, while the watermelon soda might be a little bit too sweet for me.  We've been here several times and every time we left with a good experience. So certainly we will be back again!

Reasonably priced with great service. It's great as a lunch spot, a date spot and a group dinner setting. I recommend eating family style here, the plates are large and are designed to share. I've never been disappointed by the quality here and I always send people here for great, fresh Italian downtown.

Their food is good and price is good, too.  I like that we can order bunch of dishes and get to have fun sharing them. Only small complaint I make is that this place is the loudest restaurant ever. But, I and my family love to go this place whenever we have chance.  You can eat their awsome pizza at home if you don't mind picking them up from there.
Amazing, authentic old world feel. Family style tapas, carafes of wine...like eating in Grandma's kitchen.
absolutely love the food, the ambiance is challenging as it is so loud!

oh quartino, how I love thee. flew in at around 5pm from the west coast and this was our first meal of the day. so basically we were hangry AF and wanted something that could accommodate our appetite as well as provide comfort to our bodies as we [unsuccessfully] acclimated to the Chicago winter.  Italian food is my favorite-- we got a half fennel sausage, half campania (fonduta, ricotta, basil, cherry tomatoes) thin neopolitan pizza. the very competent and friendly server informed us that the pizza and serving sizes are small bites style made for sharing. something was amiss because everything was larger than what tapas are in Cali!! we were amazed. the pizza was like a medium sized one. wonderful crust and flavors. extremely superb campania. flavorful sausage, though if I had a do over I'd probably just get a full campania.  the absolute winner for me were the veal meatballs, tender and light but with a sweet golden raisin figgy sauce that was neither thick nor syrupy; just coated perfectly and truly mimicked the meatballs I had in Naples. again, tapas style meant 8 meatballs. crazy when in Cali we usually get 3-4.  also got the calamari which was friggin huge and delicious. I wish they were breaded less like kfc (overly spiced) and included more tentacles. the dipping sauce made of fresh tomatoes was outstanding though.  wine by the carafe measurements. excellent wine list. didn't see Barolo but I may have been too hungry to even focus.  definitely recommended.
You can't go wrong here. If you don't mind a little noisy environment, you'll love the food, extensive wine list, and service which has been consistent the 8years I've been a customer.
Everything was so good! After studying abroad in Rome this was an authentic place to go. Will definitely be coming a lot when I move to chicago!

On my last night in Chicago, I had an insatiable craving for spaghetti late on a Sunday evening. A friend suggested Quartino despite her fiance's reluctance to try such a touristy spot, but mannn, are we glad we went. This was technically Dinner #2, but really, who's counting? The spaghetti was so simple but SO amazing. The pizza had a nice consistency and good flavor. The grilled octopus was a delight. The gnocchi was a little too salty but the pesto kept us going back for more. The shrimp risotto was delicious as well. Every dish we shared was wonderful. I will definitely try to stop by the next time I visit!
We just had the best time. Medium sized dishes meant that we ordered a bunch and shared them. Spectacular! Highly recommended.

One of my favorite meals while in Chicago! My friends and I sort of stumbled upon this restaurant and we were lucky enough to grab seats in the bar area. I love places that are sharing friendly and this restaurant is definitely that.  Red Sangria (4/5) - delicious and slightly sweet with bite size chunks of fruit   Neapolitan Pizza (5/5) - I forgot which types we ordered, but we were able to get half and half two different types Polpette al sugo di Pomodoro (6/5) - veal meatballs that are an absolute must get Polenta Fries (4/5) - crispy and held together well when bitten into  Minestrone Soup (3/5) - average Gnocchi (3/5) - passable  Tortellini (4/5) - prosciutto added great flavor  Shrimp Risotto (5/5) - shrimp cooked perfectly and all the flavors were delicious together It's been awhile since I ate here, but my memory of the food here was great.

Very well done but standard Italian dishes. Extensive menu and I liked that both the Campania pizza and housemade burrata weren't overly salty or too heavy... Although it did make the burrata seem more like a fresh mozzarella than a burrata. Pizza was thin crust but with a very chewy light pizza crust. Duck prosciutto served with pickled cucumbers also yummy with just a perfect amount of fat... Definitely order the warm prosciutto wrapped dates as well, which was our favorite. I also liked the self serve fresh Parmesan graters and the balsamic vinegar was nice and fruity. Our server Jeffrey was also lovely and funny and apparently on weekdays lunch 2 can dine for $25. Can certainly understand why this place is a classic!

6 GOOD AND 6 BAD  GOOD  1) Good for big crowds  2) lots of different alcohol  3) large selection of food  4) Attentive Staff  5) Inexpensive  6) Good location  Bad  1) Parking is expensive  2) Very Loud could hardly hear  3) To crowded  4) They said the food came out as it was ready but there was no rhyme or reaosn e.g. appetizer 1 salad 1 meal 1 meal 2 appetizer 1  meal 2 salad 2  5) The food was only okay not enough punch or real cheese for pasta garnish  6) Too cold inside
