very crowded but great pizza and Italian food. My favorite was the duck pizza. Prices are reasonable and they had great service. I highly recommend this place for couples or groups of people. Great atmosphere and good for parties as well.

i've been to quartino a dozen times, and even hosted my wedding rehearsal dinner here.  the private party staff was fantastic, and my rehearsal dinner was perfect.  the food was served family style, and we had our own bartender in the private room for drinks.  the food is typically small plates to share, and i've yet to have a dish here that i didn't enjoy.  the staff is always exceptional as well.

Went here for a date after an exhausting night of ice skating. The locale was very welcoming and the ambience was perfect for a date. We ordered the bacon covered dates, fondue, sausage risotto, polenta fries, and calamari. We also had two types of wine--the malbec and a Garnacha. The food was all decent except the fondue. It wasn't spectacular. The bread for the fondue was dry and the fondue itself fell flat of what I expected. My favorite for the night would have to be the bacon wrapped dates or the polenta fries. The others were mediocre. I would probably come back for the ambience and to try the pizzas in hopes of it being better. However, if I have other options I'd prob choose it over Quartino.
It's ok. I wanted to like it more!! the location is great with a nice outdoor patio. ambiance is pretty amazing-very lively. Great for big parties too! the food though, it's just ooookkkkk.
Great every time! Large group or party of two, Quartino never disappoints. Outstanding menu of amazing small plates perfect for sharing. The house red wine is super cheap and delicious!

Solid go-to spot, especially for guests coming to town not looking to spend and arm and a leg - it's very affordable. Awesome outside seating in the summer. Can get a bit loud as most Italian cafes tend to.

I don't know why I haven't reviewed this before since I've been frequenting this place for the last 3 years! A solid staple in my book!!! Atmosphere: I wouldn't come here if I were claustrophobic. Definitely a lot of tables squeezed together. Also, it's quite loud at its busiest. Price: Fairly reasonable for the location and food. Pizzas are $10-16 which is enough to feed 2. Tapas style plates range from a $5-20. Food: I've had probably 1/3-1/2 of their menu options and for the most part, I've enjoyed all of the courses. The pizza is NOT deep dish and comes with many different options. You can do half and half on the pizzas too!!! Pastas and other dishes are also yummy. Tiramisu is a secret dessert item on their menu. Their lemon ice cream sandwich type dessert is also yummy!

For the amount of TVs in this place you would think they could put the game on. We had our own section where nobody could see our TV, even if they wanted to, and they still wouldn't put the game on. I spent the entire dinner at the bar away from my group. It's playoff football. Are you serious? Didn't eat though, but everyone said the food was good

AMAZING homemade fettucine alfredo! We went back again and again for it. Such a delicious dish. The experience can vary depending on the waiter - once, we had an awesome young woman as our waitress, and it made the whole experience.

This place is excellent. It gets a bit loud and busy during the night compared to lunch but the service and quality stays the same. Dining in for a lunch was very quiet, the vege pizza is fresh and delicious, not too heavy, but big portion. Quick tip though, eat it while it's hot. When the pizza gets cold it has a different taste. The pepperoni pizza is excellent as well, what else is there to say? The sauce, cheese, and pepperoni is proportionate to the crispy and golden browned crust. Highly recommended, coming from a New Yorker.

Great place for sharing!!!! My friends and I went here for a late night dinner. I do really appreciate that they open so late. We were greeted by very friendly hostess who seated us right away.. Sweet! We were immediately introduced to our server, who had a good knowledge of everything on the menu. The menu is a bit daunting to look at first but he was able to walk us through the menu with ease.  Quartino specializes in Italian food and all of their plates are meant to be shared. For our appetizer, we got a sampler which came with two types of cheese, two types of meats, and topping such as jams, a beet salad and pickled vegetables. We were unsure on which cheeses and meats to get, so we asked for the chef to surprise us! The platter that came out was HUGE! Certainly enough for our group of 6. Everything on the sampler was delicious! For our entrees, we order mushroom risotto, gnocchi, fettuccini with clams, tortellini, Brussels sprouts and braised short ribs. Out of all the dishes, the mushroom risotto, Brussels sprouts and the short rib were the best!!  Make sure to get dessert! The Italian donuts with honey and dark chocolate is TO DIE FOR! I wish there was a Quartino in my neighborhood
Awesome service and food... Even in the bathroom the music is good, everyone is very nice and helpful...  I strongly recommend this place... Best of all the price...Enough said.

Great Italian Restaurant in Chicago. This place was packed the day we were there. They did great with their service and food. Everything tasted like it was cooked to order with fresh ingredients. If we return to Chicago, we will be hitting them up again.

I'm not sure I really get down with the waiters in Italian soccer jerseys, but the staff was friendly and competent, they were able to fit us in without a reservation, and the food was hearty, delicious, and reasonably priced. Also: the atmosphere is lively and charming and there are tons of wine options. What else do you need?

Not impressed. Polenta fries=tasteless. Calamari=mediocre. How can you screw up fried food?? We planned to stay for dinner, but left after the unimpressive appetizers (that we did not finish) and walked around the corner to La Madia for dinner. Server was friendly and attentive.
The best wine bar in the city! I have been going here for years and have loved every experience.  The food is fantastic and the wine menu extensive.

Really nice cozy place, with friendly staff. My husband had the Roasted Baby Octopus and not only was it delicious but it was beautiful as well. I had the Braised Short Ribs and they melted in my mouth. For an appetizer we had the Dates Wrapped in Pancetta and they were nice and warm, crisp on the outside and gooey on the inside. The prices were a little high, and the wine portions a little small, but otherwise it was great food and a nice visit.

I had been wanting to come here for months, and on the first impression, I was kicking myself for not visiting it sooner!  Quartino looks every bit like restaurants in Italy, from the decor to the menu to the people working there. The main difference: the tapas style ordering. Honestly, I was confused by other reviewers on how to go about ordering, and looking around at other tables wasn't much help either! We ended up ordering two pasta dishes to share and then, still hungry, we ordered a third. But plus one dessert at the end, it ended up being too much for two people!  The good: I LOVE that this place is so gluten free friendly. Not only did they have gluten free pasta that could be used in any pasta dish, but a designated gluten free menu had more choices than I'd seen at possibly any Italian restaurant EVER. If pasta isn't your thing, there was a long list of gluten free meat dishes along with at least ten appetizers and five soup or salad options. Also, my boyfriend agreed with other claims that the tiramisu here is really darn good (although, confusingly, it's not on the menu!).  The bad: the service and quality on my one visit here was a little spotty. Our half-full water jug was taken away before we were finished eating, our silverware was cleared while we were waiting on another dish, and our waiter never followed up on more wine after we'd decided to do 1/4 liter "to start." Our first two pasta dishes were sloppily plated, with one vastly different in size than the other. The Alfredo one was yucky. Then, we waited for a solid 25 minutes for our third pasta dish, and our waiter was even confused as to why it hadn't yet arrived at our table. Also, the wine, while cheap, wasn't served with wine glasses which was just kind of weird.  Overall, I'd love to give Quartino another shot, but at $75 for two people, I think I'll have to save up a bit before I do. The quality of the experience just wasn't there for the price, so I'd be hesitant! However, it seems like it has great potential to be a date night spot or a fun spot for a group get-together.

Great food, best calamari I've ever had! Also loved the fondue. Our waiter, Scott, was so friendly and when we were full he canceled an order we had made for us. He was very helpful even though the place was packed and I'm sure he was busy. The only thing that was a disappointing was he noise level, it was very loud in the restaurant. Overall fun night! I recommend Scott as a waiter.

I've been here a handful of times, and I must say Quartino is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I love the Italian tapas style menu, where you can taste a bunch of small dishes and are not stuck with a huge entree.  Most recently, I took my mom here for a date night before we saw the Nutcracker. She loved it as well! We had a reservation for 5pm, but arrived 30 minutes early. We were seated right away, which was great for a Saturday night (the wait tends to get really long without a reservation). Our waitress was attentive and helpful. We started off with the quattro formaggi pizze, then ordered the tortellini (one of my favorites), potato puree (excellent), and the porcini & truffle risotto - which was too much food for us, but it did not stop us from eating 90% of it.  Overall, a great place for lunch or dinner! If you're going on the weekend, make sure you make a reservation to avoid the wait.

We came here on New Year's Eve. I had read all the raving reviews but decided I don't agree. The food was mediocre and the presentation was sub par. Service was ok. Waiters dressed in soccer uniforms. They could have dressed up for NYE. We had Calamari: eh Caprese Salad: good Bacon wrapped dates: terrible. Bacon tasted like plastic. Frutti Di Mare: ok Veal meatballs: good. best item Flatbread (Margherita): good

We decided to give this place a try because my cousin's friends "raved" about it. Upon entering the restaurant, we noticed the restaurant had a very nice vibe to it, however, I did not like that the tables were very small (we had a table that "fit" 4 people). It was extremely snug, I had to make sure I wouldn't knock the water jug off the table several times. Also, if I were to lean back in my chair, I would be (literally) touching backs with the lady in the table immediately behind us. I'm also fairly certain if I reached only my arm back, I would be able to grab food off the table of the party behind us...to close for comfort in my opinion. We ordered the ravioli, some type of fries, and a clam pasta. They recommend we eat 'family style' because the food is served immediately after it is made. The ravioli and clam pasta are extremely small portions, keep that in mind before ordering. We ordered the fries because of what we read on Yelp, however, no one in our party enjoyed it enough to rave about it. The service was definitely not up to par. We were served bread upon giving our order to the waitress. When our food came out (which took a while, but that was not an issue for us) the waitress did not clear the plates from the bread. We had an extremely crowded table with dirty dishes everywhere. It was not an enjoyable experience for us. Overall, I would say the food was okay, however, I would not dine here again.

Prices were fare, but not cheap. Our waitress was very friendly, fast and when she was nowhere to be found her manager came by and helped promptly. The food and desserts were very tasty and homemade (at least the sausage was) and my LaRossa beer was also very good.  There isn't a lot of room but there's enough and we were seated as soon as we walked in. We really enjoyed our visit and would visit again.

I came here with a group of 7 on New Year's Eve to celebrate before 2016. The restaurant was bustling with lots of parties. It's always a great sign if its crowded on a holiday, but worrisome about actually getting food quickly. Luckily we had no issues with getting our table and food quickly.  We had reservations and ended up getting there early. We were able to snag a seat at the bar. I ordered a 1/4 L of their Bellini, which was delicious! What makes Quartino different than other Italian restaurants that I've been to is that the dishes are tapas style. While I'm used to larger Italian size portions, I found that Quartino's portions were just right for one person (if you don't share of course!). I ordered the Linguine with clams in white sauce and it was the perfect blend of clams and pasta. Going with a big group always has its benefits, it gives you the chance to try more. I had several bites of the Tuscan Sausage Risotto and Cavatelli. The risotto was good, but the Cavatelli was amazing! The fresh ricotta with the tomato and basil sauce was fantastic.  Overall our group of 7 ordered 10-12 tapas, a bottle of wine, a cocktail, and a pitcher of Sangria and it came out to roughly $240 including tip which is super reasonable. I would definitely recommend Quartino as a great place to grab dinner with a group of friends!

This is an authentic family style Italian restaurant. The dining is family style. So if you don't mind sharing, come here! Friendly staff. Tables are a bit small, doesn't help when you are suppose to be sharing. Not ideal for younger children.

Ate here with our 3 kids (14,11,6) last week for lunch. The food was excellent..we had the pizza, calamari, risotto...and buttered noodles for my picky eater. Great atmosphere - staff was helpful and attentive. The ice cream and gelato were huge hits.

My girlfriend and I dined here on a very quite and cold post Christmas afternoon. The atmosphere is extremely cozy, despite the restaurant being very big (there is both an upstairs and downstairs). The service is absolutely top notch. My gf and I were talking and catching up so we didn't even look at the menu for the first 3-4 times our waiter came over but she was more than happy to wait for us. You get warm bread upon sitting....it was delicious. We gobbled it right up with oil, balsamic, and the parm cheese that was on the table. The menu is large for small plated Italian. Soups, salads, pizza, pastas, antipasto...you name it, they got it! We decided on the caprese salad and a spicy sausage flatbread pizza. Both were delicious and just enough for lunch. We didn't drink, nor order desserts but those of those menus were substantial as well. Quartino is a great, cozy little spot in the heart of River North. A better bang for your buck too if shopping around Michigan Ave....as opposed to eating on the Mag Mile:)

Before i start, it was the best restaurant in chicago among other places weve went to on this trip! We ordered chicken soup, linguine with clams, and stefano/campania pizza! We actually yelped deep pizza and ended up here which they only had regular pizza. I personally hate salty dishes but these dishes we ordered had the only nessary amount of saltiness! I will fsho recommend this place!! Along with all the dishes we had

Been here more times than I can count and am always pleased. The food is really great, and while the place can get really noisy and loud, it's still a wonderful place for groups. My all-time favorite item is the polenta fries, but you can't go wrong with any of the pastas, veggies, meat dishes or desserts,

Delicious in every way. Everything we ordered was executed well, and the atmosphere and bartender were delightful elements that added to the overall experience. Husband came here a few months back when he was in town for business, and he along with 2 other colleagues came and enjoyed a slew of small plates. He enjoyed it so much that he wanted me to experience it as well on our recent trip to Chicago. Boy was he ever so right! We ended up ordering calamari, soprano pizza, pappardelle in a braised beef tomato sauce, shrimp with garlic, red chilis, olive oil, and white wine. Each were well-made and had fantastic proportions for the price, but the stars out of the bunch were the calamari and soprano pizza. The calamari had a light coating and it was crispy and yummylicious. The meat itself was tender and seasoned nicely. I only spotted 2 tentacles, but the other pieces were so well done that it didn't matter. The soprano pizza was divine, and the crust made it. Sure the veal meatballs brought the base flavor profile, but the crust had just the right amount of chew and crispy texture. We had to be so careful not to devour the whole thing in one sitting, otherwise, we would have not been able to eat the rest of the food! We ended the night with a delicious dessert of zeppoles. They are fried doughnuts, but so airy and fluffy. To accompany each bite are dark chocolate and honey. The combination of the two sauces together is like experiencing nirvana. Absolutely loved every bite, and for $6.25, it was plenty for the two of us. Each dish that we had ranged in prices from $10-$15, and there was plenty of food to take home. We ordered 4 savory dishes and 1 dessert, and we could have easily just gone with 2 dishes and the dessert. However, the leftovers reheat wonderfully. With a convenient and central location to Magnificent Mile and River North neighborhood, Quartino is easy to find, and will leave you and your family members happy. For bigger parties, make reservations online or via phone. They have an upstairs area that offers a great view of the city if you're looking for that. I'll definitely be back next time I'm visiting!

Came in for a birthday party.  The restaurant did they best they could to accommodate a party of 18.  we were able to get 2 tables next to each other to seat 9.  The atmosphere in here is really charming and cozy.  Definitely very inviting and a great date spot.   We started off with a number of appetizers.  The meatballs were pretty good. we got them with raisins which made them a little to sweet for my taste.  I would just get them the regular way from now on.  The fried calamari was good and kind of the same as you would get at most restaurants.  The Burrata was ok, nothing special and I have had way better... The polenta fries were also OK but again I have had better..  I would not get either again.   The margherita pizza was pretty tasty.. I really liked the Tagliatelle alla Bolognese it was rich and tasty! I also tried the cavatelli and that was pretty decent as well.  The portion sizes are medium.. not really enough to share but great for the price points!  The service is also very friendly and professional.  I like the theme of all the waiters wearing soccer jerseys.  There is also valet parking..  Overall this is a solid spot thats very cool and I look forward to trying more of their menu items.  Definitely worth a visit.

Top Highlights/Lowlights 1) gluten free pasta available 2) loud/energetic atmosphere  3) great service We visited Quartino on a Sunday night right after the holidays. We made a reservation about three days in advance and man am I glad we did! Both floors of the two story restaurant were packed. The closeness and loud atmosphere is what we look for when we go out to eat (fun atmosphere!), but if you prefer a quieter dining environment this may not be the place for you. Our server seated us right when we got there and promptly got us menus and water. The theme of Quartino is essentially Italian tapas.  Our server got me a gluten free menu right away and the g free menu was quite impressive (especially for an Italian restaurant!). The g free menu had the "normal" gluten free things like cheese, salami, antipasti but also a gluten free fusilli (pasta) that could be prepared the same was as their normal pastas. COOL. We tried several of the tapas; the stuffed dates (AMAZING), asparagus risotto, caprese salad, gluten free fusilli with the sausage marinara, and broccoli rabe (spicy A F). The food was awesome and we loved that like a traditional tapas restaurant they brought the food out when it was ready so you can kind of graze the whole night.  Wine is purchased by the carafe. We did the half carafe and that was plenty for us!  I am definitely a person who loves to try new restaurants and rarely visits a place twice but I will definitely be making a second trip here.

I was slightly disappointed in this place. I mean the food was good but I thought the service was just not very good. Like we had a waiter but we didn't see him most of the meal. Like the kitchen people brought out the food and served it, so trying to order more drinks or more food was difficult.  We were seated about 30 min after our reservation to a table for 4, when we had 5 people. We had to ask for a chair for the 5th person as the host didn't even notice we had 5 people...they brought the chair never brought silverware or anything.  We were able to wait at the bar before we were seated which was very crowded. They have some small tables that have a waitress and you can order the full menu I believe.  Anyways the food was good. Besides the chicken, that was a little dry.   We also ordered the Bruschette, Dates wrapped in Pancetta, (which were never brought to us and we had to ask some random waiter, as ours was MIA most of the meal), Carpaccio, Brussle Sprout Salad, Penne Alla Vodka, the Chicken and the Salmon. It was shareable plates but things like the Salad, Bruschetta, and pasta were a little hard to share, so I would order 2 if you have more than 4 people, and are not ordering as much as we did.  We also got the hot chocolate cake for the birthday girl which was actually amazing.  There was a ton of larger groups here, so they are good at accommodating that. I also was told they deliver so that's good. I would go back eventually, just service last night was not that great, (I will give the benefit of the doubt, it being the 26th, maybe they were under staffed). There are just so many other Italian restaurants on my list to try, I am not jumping to get back here.
Great with a group! Order shared plates with your group. The pizza is wonderful. A great atmosphere and a beautiful set-up. It's authentic and delicious! The pasta is wonderful as well.

Very delayed review: It was 4:30 on the last day of Restaurant Week, so the roommate and I decided to make a trip downtown to get anything we could. I heard good things about Quartino from others, and luckily, they had a table for 5:30 open. Granted, it was a Thursday night, but there weren't too many people in this very rustic, authentic-looking "Italian tapas" restaurant. I loved the salumeria and bread displays around the restaurant, and the fact that the waiters and waitresses all wore Italian soccer jerseys was a very nice touch. Might not actually be authentic, but the experience definitely felt like it could be. Strange as it may sound, I recommend a trip to the bathroom (second floor, to the right of the bar) just for the borax soap! Very unique. Probably one of the best Restaurant Week deals around, there was a lot of variety for four courses at $33/2 people. The waitress mentioned that all plates were meant for sharing, which is rather typical of Italian restaurants. We proceeded to order the Fonduta, the Porcini & Truffle Risotto, Beef Filets, and for dessert, the Coppa al Banana.  The Fonduta was a nice, hearty bite for an appetizer. Subtle in taste but rich in texture, we quickly sopped it up. It came out very quickly as well, and as two hungry college guys, we finished it right away. Luckily, the risotto came out soon after. The porcini was definitely strong and the risotto was cooked pretty well, so no complaints there. We definitely wanted more of it, however, as was a running theme throughout our meal; although it was a dinner for two, the portions are rather small if you're feeling voracious, so either pregame your meal or plan on getting an extra app or two.  The beef filets were very nicely cooked, a nice char adding a requisite amount of crunch while the meat itself was a solid medium-rare. The accompanying sauce was a bit too salty for my taste, but it really wasn't too bad. The medallions were again, somewhat small for two people to share, but we were both pleased by what we had. We ended our meal with a nice Coppa al Banana, which really hit the spot. Thx to Patrick and co.

My favorite weekly date night spot.  We always make reservations--and usually don't end up using them. This place is awesome, so it's no surprise its always jam packed. Sometimes the restaurant section gets super loud, especially on the weekends. We usually get a bottle of wine in the bar area, and try and get a bar top table to eat at. Surprisingly, it's a little quieter than the restaurant section. Servers always have great recommendations for new bottles of wine when we get sick of the usuals. We always order the maragatia pizza, it's soOoo good. They also have an awesome outdoor section when it's nice out. Love this place.

Right off the bat, ambience is AWESOME! Very relaxing vibes, with somewhat of a higher-class feel to the restaurant itself. Dishes range from about 8-12 dollars on average, but I'd say an average person would want about a dish and a half for themselves (ie. 3 dishes between 2 people). As with an authentic Italian restaurant, dishes are meant to be shared and passed so don't be afraid to order a few dishes, and pick something risky cause there is always a back up. We ordered the fondue with apples, and it was fantastic! The apples are soaked in wine, and you can even taste white wine in the cheese. Then we ordered multiple dishes including the asparagus rice (pictured) and that was delicious! This is the second time I have visited Quartino's, and will not be the last!

Great place every time. This past weekend we had a very large party of 14 and the staff was great, the food was very good and the ambiance was perfect for the holidays. Make reservations as I heard the host tell people that the wait was more than 2 hours.
I love this place, it's one of my Italian restaurants in the city. Cavatelli and Polpette Al Sugo Di Pomodoro are a must try! Also, get dessert!

I made dinner reservations at Quartino for my birthday(weeks in advance) after finding it listed as a highly rated restaurant on Yelp and walking past the restaurant several times since moving to Chicago. My reservations were for 8:00pm but when we arrived, we were told our table wouldn't be ready for 15 minutes... they didn't end up sitting us until 8:20/8:25ish which I find pretty ridiculous after making reservations WEEKS in advance. I got the steak filet which wasn't very seasoned or tasty - our waiter was nice but the guy who ran our food out slammed the first meal down harshly after we weren't sure who had ordered it (didn't look like what we thought it would), pretty awkward. It was also pretty crowded inside. Overall, cool vibes and decorations but not worth how we were treated. We won't be visiting again.

Sad to report I can only say that the bread is good. Last day of a birthday weekend trip...reservations at 9:30pm. Arrived, hostess was pleasant as could be, then seated. Our waiter explained how the menu works and was never to be seen again. Correction...he walked past our table three times to go watch sports on the TV in the bar and to take silverware from one part of the restaurant to another, but refused to make eye contact.  We had picked our appetizers and wine and we're ready to order. Knowing the window of places open later on a Sunday evening was closing we decided to walk out after 15 minutes of being ignored. I hate leaving bad reviews, and I'm never the person to walk out, but this was beyond ridiculous. Now we are at RPM, who even without a reservation welcomed us and are being attentive and courteous. Thank you, RPM!! UPDATE - I received a phone call from a very concerned member of management today with apologies and offers of "make it up to you" drinks/food.  Keeping in mind that is all they can do at this point, let's also keep in mind that most establishments would not take the time to email, let alone make a personal phone call, an apology.  A big thank you for the professional response to my review.  For that alone, I will issue another star. It's nice to know that this was taken seriously, was a fluke only, and that I will definitely be giving Quartino another try......

Holy cow! It was fabulous. We ordered a minestrone soup, eggplant parmigiana, and half-n-half of the two vegetarian pizzas. It was all out of this world. The pizzas, the tapas were all stupendous. We were a party of three wishing we had bigger stomachs and could sample more of the tapas.  I can't speak for the meat options (though everything, from the crowd here, to the smells, to the buzz and atmosphere screams yummmm) but as a vegetarian I couldn't be more satisfied!

Not a fan. The food was ok but not for the price. Been to other family style restaurants that are much better. Setting is too loud and crowded. Desserts were very good though. Hate when wine is served in water glasses. Olive oil on table but no parm. Bread is fresh but not all that great. Are at grand lux night before bill was the same amount and was much more delicious.
Food is alright, not the best quality. Extremely small portions and the waitress was unprofessional.

Everything seems super fresh. The margherita pizza is good - a little cheesier than most. The  Beef carpacchio was fresh and terrific.  The panera wrapped dates were a little too sweet...soaked in honey. But the chocolate torte and ice cream was amazing...almost like a warm brownie with creamy vanilla ice cream.  The atmosphere was very lively and pretty loud. Fairly casual so kids would be fine here. Wait staff was attentive but not overly so. Very good experience!

This place is really, really good.  Probably not as good as its reputation, but it's really good.  The wait-staff makes it educational and enjoyable if you want that type of interaction.  The mixed olive appetizer surprised everyone on how great it was. For a tapas place, it isn't as relaxed an atmosphere as I believe most people expect.  It feels more like a higher end Italian restaurant, but that isn't what's served.  If you're looking for a merger of the two, I don't know that it can be done any better.

Quartino's is a go to for many occasions. I have been here for celebrations to casual dinners/ This restaurant appeals to both locals and tourists so make reservations to be safe, even with reservations you may have to wait a couple of minutes.  Every time I have gone here I have had great service and food. The food is reasonably priced and there is something for everyone. This place gets packed and they manage large parties to small tables with efficiency and precision.  I tried their pizza with the meatball and giardiniera this last time and it was tasty. I had never had the urge to try their pizza before but this changed my mind.  It can get a bit noisy, but in my opinion it only adds to the ambiance!
This is very close to my apartment and I can't believe it took me until now to try it. The food is fantastic and the service is excellent. I will definitely be going back.
Great restaurant . Lively crowd with traditional Italian options . We love the pizza as it is thin and very tasty. Nice friendly service in a great part of town. We go often and love the restaurant .

Amazing food, reasonably priced, perfect portions, and great service. I've eaten here several times during an extended stay in the area and enjoyed it every time.  They offer half orders of nearly everything, even dessert, and have a solid wine selection.  I recommend the sausage pizza, half wild arugula salad, and tiramisu!

We wanted to find a restaurant that had a good ambiance and delicious food. We definitely found the right place. We ordered a variety of plates just to try the menu and everything they ate was delicious! We enjoyed good food and good drinks. The ambiance was great.

My friend was really adamant about coming here, so we came here for dinner today. I was extremely underwhelmed. The tables were too close together and there was too many people packed into one place. There wasn't any room for people to walk around. However, I was pleasantly surprised by how we didn't have to wait for our tables. I didn't, however, like how out of all the open tables in the middle of the room, the hostess decided to place us right next to the kitchen. Literally next to the kitchen. Someone in our group was continuously bumped into by the staff. He was pouring water into a cup when someone bumped into him, making him spill.  The food was also just okay. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't good. It's not worth the money or the hype. The pizza was too burnt on one side. The caprese salad came with 2 lumps of mozzarella cheese and 6 slices of tomatoes with some basil on top. The pasta we ordered was very...meh. The waitress specifically told us that the food was meant to be eaten family style... So we only ordered 3 dishes for 4 people. Those portion sizes were so small. She really shouldn't have told us it's meant to be shared. I probably will never come back. Ever.

Perfect spot for a group dinner. I have been here 8-10 times.  Most spots of the restaurant are rather energetic/loud, so may not be an ideal spot if you're looking for an intimate atmosphere.  Sound travels rather well even to the upstairs area that appears more intimate. The food and wine are great.  I have yet to meet a dish I did not enjoy.

My toddler daughter has severe allergies to egg and peanut, so knowing the ingredients in food and avoiding cross contamination is now my #1 priority in dining. Quartino, by far, has been our best restaurant dining experience since her food allergy diagnoses. I called the day before to talk to someone about her allergies and the menu. He, as well as our two waiters, were highly knowledgeable about potential allergens in the food. The waiters even made sure I knew what tree nuts were in dishes. The bread they served was safe but they made a point to tell me that earlier in the day, raisin walnut bread was cut on the same machine as the bread we were eating. (Mind you she is only allergic to peanuts, not walnuts but they were extra careful to point everything out). There are NO peanuts in the restaurant. As of today, the only dishes with egg are the homemade pastas and polenta fries. My daughter had the bread, orichette, the farmhouse chicken and the Nutella panini. I've never seen her eat so much outside of our house. She is usually very cautious when trying new foods. The manager came to our table twice. First to tell us that the table side Parmesan had egg in it. And again at the end of the meal to ask us about our dining experience. He said they take food allergies very seriously and their service was stellar. We will absolutely return. We have always loved Quartino's but especially now. Thank you for the best FA experience in our lives thus far!!

This place was blowing up my Yelp from 6 blocks away as the place to go and it did not disappoint. They have great, fresh pasta and fun sauces that if you don't like them, they will fix them. With every plate being normal human size, its fun to get a bunch of things and swap them around with a large group and the waitstaff will happily engage you in picking some selections. Make sure you get the tortellini with prosciutto because it is just THAT good. Cauliflower is also a winner and while I wasn't a fan of the shank, everyone else was which makes me a mutant.  This is a great place for a group, the staff is tremendous and price point is perfect. Just try to avoid sitting next to the bread slicer cuz that buddy is LOUD.

Went there yesterday had such a great time and will definitely coming back for more. The calamari and the brussel sprouts were my favorite. I was also surprise to find out that this place is part of the Gibson's restaurant. No wonder the food were delicious! Highly recommend this place!

We found our new favorite Italian restaurant in downtown. Their food excuisite, and came out super fast considering we went there during a busy Saturday afternoon. The server was excellent and served us genuinely. And their price is pretty great, too! Love this place!

I been here a lot of times with my family and friends and everyone who I brings loves it here.  The price and quality is awesome and the customer service is good too.  The waiter/waitress are amazing they do a great job in my orders and quickly as possible to get food to the table.

Great tapas place. Was packed on a Saturday night. Sat outside upstairs and even though there is a "tent," still was chilly so tough to fully enjoy the meal. However, wine, pasta, brussel srpouts, spinach were GREAT, but I just got too full on the bread. I always seem to do that, silly me. But loved it here. Something about this place / italian food that is so relaxing, makes you want to enjoy the moment, sip on wine, take a few bites, and hang out for a few hours. :)

Just everything about Quartino is amazing. Their tapas are so easy to share and they aren't that small like some other tapas places in Chicago. The service is unparalleled and I left an extremely happy customer.

We were looking for deep dish... and this place wasn't it  On the upside, they still had really good pizza! We ordered 1 pizza to share between the three of us since it was 4pm in the afternoon and we weren't that hungry. We got the Stafano which didn't have any sauce, but had rosemary, mozerella, parmigiana, basil and spicy sausage. The pizza was really good. I love sauceless pizzas. The sausage was amazing! I think it was house made or something, but instead of little crumbles, they had thick slices of sausage. That was definitely my favorite part! Overall, this is a bit of a nicer place. I'm pretty sure they expected us to order more, but it was a good heavy snack while we were here.
Awesome place! Foods like in Italy! Coffee is taste like real coffee! So totally recommend this place for enjoying great food with wine)

Absolutely Amazing! My friend highly recommended it, we had it our first night in Chicago and nothing beat it the entire trip. I wanted to eat there every meal. We're vegetarian and they had tons of options. Even our server was super cool and awesome. I recommend ordering one thing at a time (they bring everything out as it's ready) and SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT! 100% will not disappoint for authentic amazing Italian food.

LOVE Quartino.  Their small plates are delicious and prices are fantastic.  Every time we go we try something new and are never disappointed.  Always a pleasure to come to Quartino's and enjoy great food and great service.  Whether I get the tomato soup, the margarita pizza, or the meat ball sliders, I am always happy.  Oh and the chocolate fondue dessert is awesome too!  Thank you!!

I was really torn between giving Quartino 3 and 4 stars. I would definitely eat here again, but I just don't feel like it lived up to the hype.  I went on a Saturday night with my family. We didn't have a reservation, but were seated immediately at a table for four at 5:45pm. The restaurant is very cramped and it feels like they've tried to jam in as many tables as possible. It was  fairly dark and loud. My family had a hard time reading the menu and we had to talk fairly loud to be heard.  For food, we ordered the Margherita pizza, Cavatelli, Tuscan Sausage Risotto, and Beef Filets. I was very disappointed in the pizza. The basil had no flavor and it was very average. The Cavatelli and Risotto was good. The beef filets was probably the best thing that we ate.  Like I said, I would eat here again, but it wasn't as good as I was expecting from other reviews and comments from friends.

Really liked this place been here 3x with friends for a girls night out. Each single time the staff has been helpful and nice. They always recommend things on the menu and always so delicious! Food is brought out in a timely manner. Great place for a big group to share some small plates and a bottle of wine!

The ambiance here was great and our cocktails were fantastic, but I was slightly disappointed with our food.  Ordered a caprese salad which needed more balsamic glaze for the tomatoes. Had two pizzas that were some of the specialties and weren't impressed with either. The cheese and pepperoni ones I saw go by our table looked much better. Bolognese was consistent with something you'd get anywhere.

I'm surprised by the reviews for this restaurant.  I had a craving for Italian food, so came here based on the Yelp reviews.  The food was so disappointing.  The spaghetti pomodoro tasted like it was from a can and box and the bread was hard and cold.  The atmosphere is not my taste either, it's dated and out of place. It also seems to be a tourist spot.  For $23 (salad and pasta at lunchtime), I won't be returning.

This place is perfect. Amazing food, great service, and even reasonable price. Can't believe these can coexist.  I had Campania for pizza, Tagliatelle all a Bolognese and Tortellini with prosciutto for pasta, and Brodetto Ai Frutti Di Mare for entrée.  Campania and Tortellini with prosciutto were my favorites, because I had never seen them anywhere else before and were SO good. And another cool thing here is that you can order pretty much everything half and half. Definitely going to visit again soon!!

Quartino's is one of my favorite restaurants in life. The homemade goat milk ricotta, cavatelli, & zeppole are my go to dishes. I DREAM ABOUT THEM. You cant even say the "Q" word around me or mention Italian food because then I have to have Quartino's!! (& I am being completely serious) I love this restaurant, their wine selection is bomb, and staff is amazing. I could easily eat here every day for the rest of my life.. as long as they dont take those dishes off the menu! LOL   My only issue is that they dont allow you to call in ahead for take out orders but valet is usually nice and lets me throw my hazards on in the front while I wait for my food!

We stumbled on this place while wandering to try to find a place to eat. Great family feel. It has BUSY for a Tuesday which means it's a good place. Family style dining - share everything. The Brussels sprouts salad and tortellini were great. I didn't love the sauce on the gnocchi. We also sampled the pizza and it was excellent. It is not "Chicago" style though. It is "normal" which I like. If you want loud, family style Italian, go here.

Great place to go with a big group. Went with a bunch of colleagues after a long day of meetings. We were starving. This is Italian food, tapas style. Expecting tapas-sized portions, we ordered 13 different "small" plates and a pizza, as well as three desserts. All of this for seven people. Everything was absolutely delicious, from the got cheese ricotta to the gnocchi to short rib and roasted octopus. Not one item was subpar. My only complaint is that the items were served at an overwhelmingly fast pace. Not unheard of for a tapas place, but definitely faster than we could keep up. Wish we had been warned of the pace as well as the portion sizes, but that's honestly my only complaint about this place. I'd recommend ordering a few things at a time to keep the pace manageable. Still, we had a blast and a delicious meal, and fortunately the weather was warm for November, which was conducive to a nice walk back to the hotel. Reasonable prices for a place like this. Great wine selection too. Friendly service and lively atmosphere made for a great meal and fun way to blow off steam after a long day.

Visited this place last year when we were visiting (from Australia) and thought we would go and enjoy a meal again this visit. Staying nearby we actually dined here 2/4 nights we were in the city. First night we enjoyed a selection of small plates, including the dates, which are a must try. The sides were also a hit, including the brussel sprouts.  Second night we ordered entrees and sides. I had the asparagus risotto which was delicious and the perfect side. Again, an order of the brussel sprouts and spinach. The meal was fantastic.  The Manager spent 10 minutes or so also talking to us and sent out a shot of the housemade limoncello (complimentary) which we enjoyed. For a no-frills, consistant dining experience in the city, I certainly recommend this place. The staff are more than happy to accommodate requests and you can order smaller serves than what is listed on the menu.
Loved sharing the small plates around the table. Very friendly staff. Excellent ambiance. We will go back.  Good quality food

Quartino is a great place for someone indecisive. You can get a bunch of plates and share them. I went with a group of people so we shared the salumeria tasting, tagliatelle alla bolognese, penne alla vodka, sausage risotto, chocolate cake, and doughnuts. Everything was delicious and it was more than enough to feed five people. I have to say the doughnuts were probably my favorite part of the meal though.
This place is a great spot for a date of a group! Almost like Italian style tapas. Great for sharing! Pizza is great. Everything on the menu is Delish!

We found this place by searching Open Table for any restaurant that could accommodate our reservation for 14. We were given a list of choices and Quartino looked like it had potential. This place vastly exceeded our expectations. Wow! Yum! We ordered family style and shared lots and lots of stuff. Small plates, pastas, meat/cheese sampler plates, salads, etc. You name it, we ordered it. I can't say I loved everything I tried, but I will tell you I didn't hate anything. The house-made pastas were the winners for me, with the bolognese being my personal favorite of the night. The papardelle with braised beef tomato sauce was also damn good. I tried the duck prosciutto pizza, against my better judgment, and it was actually really delicious. I don't normally tolerate lettuce (arugula) on a pizza, but his thing was a winner. Everything was fresh and imaginative. We finished the evening with cappuccinos and zeppoles. Holy smokes, those tiny Italian donuts were phenomenal!  Our server was knowledgeable and informative and steered us in the right direction for the entire evening.  There were really zero defects, so 5 stars it is!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago! Amazing Italian food and the ambiance/decor here is outstanding. The service is always great and quick. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great Italian food in Chicago.

Walking distance from our hotel - my husband and I decided to stop in Quartino's for a late lunch after dropping off our luggages.  Perhaps I should have done my research and planned my meals better - we only learned that their lunch special offer (3 courses for 2 people $25) was only available Monday - Friday! Nevertheless the price was fair and the dishes were tasty.  Truffle mushroom risotto - creamy, buttery, perfectly cooked. Two cups worth - perfect to be shared for two! Brodetto - loaded with fish, clams, shrimp, and squid! All of which were beautifully cooked! Paired with two hearty, brick sized toasts. Perfect for soaking up every drop of the aromatic broth!  Lamb ragu rigatoni - a little too al dente for my taste. I prefer home made pastas over imported. Tasted fine but nothing to write home about. I wished I tried the pappardelle or the gnocchi instead! 3 dishes for 2 - along with tax and tip ~$60. Compared to $25 we could have gotten during week day lunch, my wallet def wasn't happy for my lack of planning. Nevertheless, a great starter meal in the city!

Ummm....how is it possible that Quartino is one of my favorite places in the city and I've never gave it a review!? Well any how, we tried it for the first time after a blackhawks game that went into over time. It was later and this was one of the few places that was still serving food. That's pretty much when we fell in love with this place. I generally do not recommend going here during dinner hours on weekends. The tables are a little bit closer together and when they 're busy, it's kinda really tight! This past weekend we were near a birthday party and the girls kept walking around to take pictures and kept sticking their butts in my partner's face. That's why I was beyond elated when they gave us the private dining room for my birthday. Everything here is great! The arugula salad, potato puree, stefano pizza, linguine with clams, the roasted baby octopus, are a few of my personal favorites.  I've honestly only had one visit when I had bad service. I've always have a great time when I come in for lunch, dinner or late night! And please do not forget their desserts!!

I did a good amount of research on restaurants planning my trip to Chicago. I was not let down with Quartino - the food and service was excellent. My only complaint is that I was limited by the size of my stomach. I would have ordered more if I physically was able to. The manager (presumably) didn't like the way our pizza looked when it came out so he had a new one made and provided us with prosciutto wrapped dates to tide us over. It was a nice gesture and they were really good. Our server was attentive and great at providing recommendations, including strategies on how to try as much as possible (you can order half-size portions). Below is a list of what I had and I would recommend everything. It's important to note the plates are smaller so you should expect to order 2-3 per person 1) Truffle Salame (really good), Taleggio cheese, and Pecorino Barone (served with apricot jam and pickled? vegetables) 2) Burrata 3) Prosciutto wrapped dates 4) Split pizza of Manzo and Soprano 5) Tagliatelle alla Bolognese 6) Beef filets  7) Zeppole donuts

This is the best Italian Restaurant in Chicago for a group setting. The food is made fresh, the vino list is huge, and it's affordable for any budget. The atmosphere is a bit loud, but the food will not disappoint.

My friends were visiting for a half marathon and we decided last minute to go here for a "pasta dinner". Thankfully snatched up an Open Table reservation a few hours before on a Saturday night. The place was LOUD and very busy! Thankfully we were seated right away and had an excellent waiter. The food is consistently good.  Our waiter was so crazed with the many other tables he was serving but still made sure to check in a lot! He was energetic and awesome about my dairy and onion allergies.

Mafioso style Chicago Italian restorante.  Excellent atmosphere taking you back in time. Portions are made to share. The taste is very authentic. The "100 lemon" limoncello and the limoncello martinis was excellent! Fast service and helpful, a lot of tables and cool looking bar.

Had a great meal here! It's such a fun concept. Italian tapas to share, with lots of choices and a great wine list. We sampled some of the house-cured salami and cheese and shared a bottle of wine (they will cork it for you if you don't finish it). Also tried several of the hot plates, including the caprese salad, sausage risotto, and eggplant parmesan. All were fabulous. We will definitely return.

This was our second visit to Quartino and it didn't disappoint.  We dined during our annual girls trip to Chicago.  All 5 of us ordered different dishes.  The kale and butternut squash salad was delicious as was the braised beef short rib.  The pappardelle was excellent and the calamari was cooked perfectly.  The eggplant Parmesan was good, but maybe a tad too cheesy.  Brussels sprouts were great; many places they're very salty, but these were perfect.  Pizza was good, but I'm not sure I would order it again.  There are better items on the menu.  The fondue cheese was excellent and the zeppolis were delicious!  We will be back again.
Went here as a first stop in my wine tour. Ehhhh, so loud, waiter was not so friendly. House wine was good, bread and cheese pretty standard, nothing special

I came here for a luncheon for our racing group. It's a cute place with some pretty delicious food. We were upstairs.  The staff was friendly and the waiters made sure your drink was always full. If you wanted more of something, all you had to do was ask. And if you are a meat eater but your friend is a vegetarian....not problem. They have something for everybody here. I really enjoyed the various bruschetta that they gave us, especially the cherry tomato and mushroom. (they are separate ones) We had an interesting ravioli with braised pork, but I really enjoyed the Cavatelli (?) with tomato sauce, basil and ricotta. Our waiter asked if we wanted another dish of that and we all said "yes!" The last part of our luncheon was a dark chocolate fondue with fruit and Biscotti to dip. THIS STUFF IS LIKE CRACK! It is so unbelievably good and it took all the power in me to not grab the mini pot and drink it.  I don't meant to put this paragraph right after the food paragraph, but you must go to their bathroom.....just to try the powdered soap. Seriously. And don't worry, there is no man/woman walking into the wrong bathroom. Just the first couple glass windows that you can see each other when you first walk in since the doors are right next to each other. We had a "wtf" moment with a guy in which we both looked at each other through the glass and he turned around to look on the door and make sure he was walking into the men's bathroom. lol.
My sister introduced me to this restaurant, and I loved it since the first time.  House-made pasta, and small plates to share make this a unique and memorable restaurant.

I highly recommend coming here for the daytime 2 for 25$ special.  You get a three course meal and can pick anything on the menu.  We asked the chef for gnocchi and lamb ragu for our second course which wasn't on the menu and he absolutely delivered.The wine offerings are the best I've seen in Chicago and the cocktails are out of this world! (Get the Espresso Martini, you won't regret it).  I also asked for zabaglione for desert, which again wasn't on the menu but the head chef made it for us personally.  Even though they brought two desserts out when I only asked for one they took it off the receipt.  Highly highly recommended.

Great service. Food comes out extremely fast. This was the first meal my boyfriend and I had in Chicago. The place is definitely pricey, but I would say worth it. Had the polenta fries like a few people on Yelp recommended and they were awesome

Solid 4 stars for amazing service + quality food. You really can't go wrong with dining here. Our pastas met our expectations and everything was affordable! We needed to dine somewhere quick because we had somewhere else to go within an hour and we made it out in time although it was during dinner time :)

Awesome pizza, Quattro Stagioni which was excellent, and the pasta dish Cavatelli, again quite good.  Atmosphere is a quite busy bustling, service great attentive and helpful.  Great food you will definitely enjoy.

Quartino is a pretty tight spot for Italian food. My boyfriend and I were looking for a good place to grab a bit to eat and Yelp suggested this place. With all the good reviews, we decided to make a reservation on OpenTable. I'm glad we did, it was slammed when we got there! We made a reservation for 8:00pm and arrived on time. We had to wait about 5 to 10 minutes for our table to get ready, but that's not bad compared to the 1.5 hour wait they had going on.  To start, my boyfriend and I ordered some red wine. I can't remember what we got, but it was pretty good. For our appetizer, we got the white bean paste/hummus with bread. The paste was very fresh and you can taste the white bean, but it was just so thick. It was almost impossible to remove from the baking sheet they had underneath. They also don't give you enough bread with it, so I ended up dipping my pizza crust in the white bean paste. We ordered pizza as the main course. Being from New Jersey, we ordered the Soprano. It has Veal Meatballs, Giardiniera (pickled vegetables), Basil, & Red Chilis. The veal meatballs are perfection! They are so delicious and I wish I could just eat bowls and bowls of it. The pickled veggies took some getting used to. After the first slice, I kind of liked them, plus they added some zing to the veal meatballs, which I really liked. The size of the pizza is perfect for two. My boyfriend and I each had 4 slices and we weren't too full.  Overall, had a very nice dinner at Quartino. If I'm ever back in Chicago, I don't know if I'll come here again. I may want to try other restaurants around the area first before coming back to this place. The veal meatballs deserve a 5 star though, get them if you can!

Everything they serve is Delicious and fresh the small plates to share are right up my alley. Pricing is reasonable and their Italian handmade pastas and cellos are by far the freshest and tastiest Ingredients provided  and served. Representative Alysia's customer service is outstanding and her knowledge and love for the food they serve and company she works for is represented boldly and gracefully.  We will be back again tomorrow night. This is definitely a must when I come into town.

Basic Italian food. Nothing here is bad but nothing is exceptional. It's good to come here if you like tapas-style dining and want to try a lot of things. The biscotti that came with the gelato was almost too hard to bite. Volare is a better option in the area although you may spend a little more.
What can I say? The food is always delicious, and they have a great wine list. Only complaint is that it's always super loud - so I would not take colleagues here if we needed to discuss something.

This place was perfect in Chicago. It is a tapas/small plates type of restaurant but definitely three dishes can fill you up. Every plate we ordered was amazing and rich in flavor. We would definitely go here again! The atmosphere has a lot of energy and very crowded but still great and quick service.
One of my favorite Italian restaurants in Chicago! Small portions are great to share with friends! I will always recommend Quartino's!

Delicious food. The short ribs were the winner. It might be my mouth but things seemed a touch salty (the pizza with the duck prosciutto was define bit saline). Joe was our waiter and was fantastic.  The manager came by to check on us and stuck around for maybe a long time (two or three times) and definitely seemed to be hitting on the gentlemen whom I was dining with. (Who wouldn't love such interest and focus and getting her card and giggling over their non-jokes? Hey manager, how bout don't make a huge todo about giving your digits via card to strangers, especially when the date of one is right there and the other is wearing a ring) I did not love it.  That part was a bit funny but didn't change how good the food was.
We had lunch based on Yelp reviews... So glad we came. Fun place, cool authentic Italian house

If you're indecisive in what to get, this place is for you! We had reservations at 9:30pm on a Friday night and I can see why it was needed. This place is beyond packed. But before I can start reviewing the food, I want to say the staffs work ethic and team work is admirable.  With that being said, this is a place where you can run a tab up high but at the cost of fresh, delicious plates you can share. Everything so far was delicious but the dish that stood out so far was the cavatelli. The al dente pasta with the fresh ricotta cheese with basil.  I highly recommend this place to any user around the area and will return on my next journey to this fine city I love to come with value and awesome experience with the staff and management...they care how to improve their service and customer service.

We came with a party of 7 and really enjoyed the tapas style.  The price was very reasonable and food was excellent.  The meat and cheese appetizer, pasta, pizza, and short rib were some of the highlights.

We needed a solid meal at 11pm and Quartino came through. The pizza didn't wow me but was filling (a good size), and the tapas were a decent size as well - larger than I expected. Everything tasted good - not outstanding - so a 3 star rating. The wait staff was friendly and energetic even late evening, and the place was bumping for being the middle of the night on a weeknight, so they're obviously doing something right!
I absolutely love this place. Reasonably priced, the pasta's are made from scratch, the deserts are great. The service was exceptional every time I went!  Downside is its very loud.
The cheese plate is great. Wine is a great value. The waitstaff are friendly. Ambiance is good. I've never had a bad experience here and that is saying a lot.
One of our favorite restaurants anywhere and we do a great deal of traveling. The tortellini and cheese selection is not comparable to any other place we have been to. Also have a great wine menu.

Quartino is Italian small plates. You get multiple dishes and share them among friends. You can also large carafes of wine (the wine we chose was $20/liter).  We went to Quartino with a group of 7 girls. Our server was super friendly and greeted us quickly. He came by often so we could order multiple rounds of small plates. Service was attentive. We always had water and bread even though the restaurant was full of lots of people celebrating.  Everything we ordered was very good. We had bruschetta, tortellini, wine, eggplant Parmesan, pizza, dessert, and more. Our server made great recommendations and helped pick out special things for our group.  I thought that my dinner was reasonable. It was $30 including tip and alcohol and dessert (we even had house made Limoncello- very good).  My only compliant is that the restaurant is very loud. It was difficult to hear the people across the table, and I like to be able to talk to my friends over dinner.  I would get reservations here and get the margarita pizza! Yum!

Our party of 6 dined here on a Sat night and it was hopping.  It was the night before the Chgo Marathon crazy pasta craving crowd I think.  The place has a cute outside patio area and two levels inside.  Decorated very old school Italian kitchen downstairs - upstairs becomes classic Godfather after dark with club music and lots of short skirts and stilettos.  Tables are close together, they really pack em in, and it's LOUD.  Which is one of the reasons why we chose Quartino, because we figured we might get loud and didn't want to disturb, nor offend.  We fit right in.  Our waiter was really nice and attentive.   This place has small plates, so everything is meant to be shared.  I had heard a lot about the pizza so we def ordered one of those "the Stefano", and lots of other things like pappardelle, orecchiette, veal meatballs, porchetta wrapped dates, risotto, calamari, etc.  We would finish a couple plates passed and order a couple more.  We dined for a couple hours.  It was good, the standout was the pappardelle for sure.  We also had like 5 different desserts and those were a good time.  Favorite was the Gran Coppa Quartino and Coppa al Banana.  Delicious end to a great meal. The bill for 6, no bottles of wine but plenty of drinks and lots of food was 333.00.  Not bad.

We had a dinner for about 70 people here Saturday night, and everything was absolutely wonderful.  The space was comfortable and the service was impeccable.  There were enough people to take care of us, and the wine and food just kept coming. I'll have to look at the menu to list everything we had, but it was all great. Not all places can handle a big crowd, but they did it extremely well.  The rest of the restaurant was packed, too, so it's obviously a favorite Chicago spot.  The couple of native Italians in our group said the food was exceptionally authentic.

Pros: HUGE space. If you have a big party, come here and they will seat you for sure AND bring out your food super fast. Our server was even nice enough to split our bill for us because my group was not good at math or something Cons: the food is just not that good. Sad but true. Had the parpadelle, which was too salty and missing the satisfying meatiness (that's what she said) of the ragu. The steamed clams were a miss too - they were small probably frozen clams. I guess I'm used to juicy Manila clams. Maybe Chicago doesn't do clams?? I do highly recommend the mussels at Publican though... Conclusion: I've definitely seen better. Will not be back. If you're craving Italian, head to Siena tavern few blocks away instead!

I am an animal-lover, especially when it comes to octopus! :P I LUV octopus. So, naturally I was really excited to try their octopus dish and I did. But, the octopus I got was completely ruined by overcooking. The tentacles were extremely chewy and sometimes even hard to swallow. I should say the flavors were good, so had the poor baby octopus not been overcooked it would have been great. I also got the vegetarian soup, which is was ok. I had to add olive oil and salt to get some satisfactory flavor in it. All in all, I was not impressed and certainly have had better italian soup and octopus.

I love this place, classic Italian done right. I leave here mouth-happy every time! We don't live in Chicago but we come here every time we're in town. Come hungry, order apps, wine and dessert, it's worth it!

A restaurant that has good food and an awesome experience. The plates are smaller so sharing is the way to go. Plus you get to try lots of different things! All the pastas are incredible. I got the pomodoro but on gnocchi instead of spaghetti. Came with my family (party of 7) and it made the experience even better. We started with the bruschetta which was fair, but we also tried the meatballs which were amazing. Small but so good! Each of us got a pasta dish and a pizza for the table to split. Perfect amount of food. For dessert, we got the donuts, banana dessert and chocolate lava cake. Each better then the next. I will be back very soon!

Absolutely delicious! This place is huge but reservations are definitely recommended. Prices are very reasonable too. I like Quartino because it's a great place for a big (and I mean BIG group i.e. 18 people) or just a table for 2. It is tapas but the portions are quite large. I reccomend the salads, pizzas, and you must must MUST get the braised pork shank!  Service is great too!

With Yelp help we went to try this Italian Tappas restaurant.  Sat upstairs outside.  Plenty of heaters present to take the chill out of outside dining. Prompt service even though it was packed! Waiter very knowledgeable, and attentive. Nothing turns me off more then when you go into a Italian restaurant and the staff can't pronounce the name of Italian cheeses or dry meats, or Italian dishes.  Sorry, being Italian it's just bothers me.  We were just in the mood for a small tasting.  Bread was brought out immediately. Evoo and Balsamic vinegar was on the table already along with grated cheese. We got the antipasto.  We chose the 25.00 plate which satisfied our craving for something lite.  Wish I was hungry, because everything looked amazing!  Our choice of provolone, Asiago, olives, caponata, artichokes, beet salad, and prosciutto and dry duck prosciutto! Excellent!  Ottimo posto, ottimo cibo, ottimo servizio (Great place, great food, great service)

Loooove this place. Its Sangrias are both equally good and its aged cheeses are deliciously memorable. I love the creative spins on traditional items, like meatballs with golden raisins and the bacon wrapped dates were AWESOME!

The food is good and the atmosphere is great. It can be loud so expect that when it is busy. The flavors are unique and the quality is consistent. We tried five dishes between the two of us and found them all to be good in their own way. A favorite was the tortellini. The service was good also. When I am back in Chicago I will be returning. This Italian charm makes the list. I recommend ordering a plate or two at a time if splitting. Then move to the next choice. The sizes are perfect for getting enough to justify the price and yet leaving room to try another dish. I am not really into sweets but the zeppole are great.

This place is fantastic and authentic. The service is superb and the prices well below what you would expect from the quality of the cuisine. Nice wine selection in varying quantities and like the food priced fairly. This is my go-to Italian joint when I'm in Chicago.

Excellent food, very fresh, fun ambiance. Every dish our group of 10 had was very good, with interesting flavors and fresh ingredients. Their house-made pastas are delicious and their thin-crust pizzas are excellent. Gnocchi with pesto and asparagus was really good. It was a little over-crowded, but we went on a Friday night and there were tons of people waiting to get in, so that's understandable.
Best calamari, amazing pasta, great menu! Looking forward to come back ! Enjoyed watching the Italian movie .
When I need a good, reliable, fun Italian meal, I always head to Quartino.

Worth. It.  If you can, sit outside. Wonderful people watching. Food is spectacular and the service is even better. We ordered the Quattro Fammiggia pizza and choc fondue with strawberries. Such a great combo. Will come back next time I'm in Chicago.

Came here for a family reunion and had a mixed experience. It was extremely crowded and we got sat next to a really loud bachelorette party. No one could hear over the screaming girls and it felt like my ears were going to bleed (they were seriously that loud). After 15 minutes of sitting through this (they never learned how to use their inside voices), we asked if something could be done. The manager came out and apologized for the noise and offered to move us. Our table and the three tables next to us joked that the loud girls should either be asked to leave or asked to stop drinking. But anyway, I was happy with the accommodations of being allowed to move tables since the noise was so extreme it was ruining the table's mood. Ironically, we were sat next to another bachelorette party with the same amount of girls, but they spoke like normal people so we could also have conversations! Yay parents who correctly taught their children how to speak at normal levels!  Very pleased with the service.  The food was okay. We ordered a sausage pizza and margharita pizza, both decent but not outstanding. We ordered about 10 other dishes, all just as standard. The worst was the shrimp scampi, which blatantly tasted like frozen shrimp. The best thing we ordered was the calamari, which was extremely tender. Overall, the service was great but the food fell short. Probably won't return.

Great ambiance, great prices, great food. I've been here many times and love it. It's also really good for groups since it's fun to share many different of their small plates. Good street-side outdoor seating too.

First thing to assault your senses is the noise level. From start to finish the only mode of communication with anyone is shouting. Service was attentive but hectic. An off-flavor permeated the olives and other vegetables in the sampler appetizer. Mushroom risotto was incredibly bland and with an inferior texture. Not creamy. This is a gimmick restaurant.

I have been here now 3 times - not sure what the hype is about. The atmosphere is awesome - but basically if you care about what you eat - I think this place sucks. Service is prompt and quick though.

You can order half order for most items, which I find to be awesome. I ended having 4 half orders and it was fun sampling different dishes. I was so full at the end. Had to skip the pizza to save room for other dishes. The wine prices are very reasonable, and they serve the wine in little carafes like they do in Italy! The atmosphere is bustling on the louder side, and I enjoyed it. Lots of seafood/fish options. I definitely will come back!
Good pizza, interesting ambiance. As a soccer fan, I love the soccer jerseys the staff wears. Really great crowd!

The first thing I noticed when we walked into Quartino was all of the Serie A soccer jerseys that the staff were wearing. My excitement was tempered quite a bit, though, when we sat down at the bar and the staff we encountered admitted to not really knowing too much about Italian soccer...or soccer at all. The soccer fan/player in me was fine with that, I guess, but my bigger disappointment was with the food. The prosciutto-wrapped dates were decent, but didn't really hit the spot, and the margherita pizza we ordered had a crust that I wouldn't typically associate with Neapolitan pizza. It was overcooked and dry. We ended up only eating a few pieces and taking it to go and giving it to homeless person. It was definitely very disappointing. The plus sides of our visit were the nice staff and good wine list, but in a city with so many great restaurants - let alone Italian options - I don't see any need to return to Quartino. The interior is very dated, and the entire vibe and staff attitude is of a place that's real draw is the prime location in a tourist-heavy area, as opposed to the actual food. Based on other reviews, I'm thinking we should've ordered some pasta, but when the first parts of our meal fell flat, we didn't feel the need to stick around for more.
I love this place. It's one of the best restaurants in the loop that have quality/price balance. Food selection is broad, and the food actually tastes fantastic. Simple and good dining.

This place is fantastic!  Love the shared food setting.  The olive oil and parm on the table is AWESOME.  Nothing I tried was bad... and I went to a big group birthday party in a private room in the middle of the restaurant--perfect setting and great ambiance.  Server was extremely attentive and the overall bill including wine was reasonable for a big amount of food and drink!  You won't be disappointed.

Our server, Derrick, was AWESOME! He helped me pick out an awesome dish that the kitchen would make vegan and he recommend a great wine to pair with the dish.  The portions and prices were a lot better than we expected so that's always a great surprise. I will bring my friends and family here for years to come!
Poindexter our waiter was a jerk! Had fun because of the people I was with- but when a waiter takes a glass of wine out of your hand ...not excited to go back!

This is fast becoming my favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago; but I've only lived here for two months. The calamari was crispy and authentic Italian fried calamari. Their piece de resistance is the totelini - it melts in your mouth and might be the cheese. Whatever it is it's just heavenly.. This was my second visit but it's still as memorable and the sea food steamed in a tomato broth was just as delicious... A must visit for the lovers of Italian cuisine..

My friend made reservations here for four at 7pm. We were seated right away and got a corner booth. It was nice at first because we were secluded in our own privacy, but then we were at a loss to flag any waiter's attention when paying. We were in a rush to see the fireworks at Navy Pier, but failed to get our check and pay in a timely manner, so missed out on that. Now back to the important matter of food, we ordered the Salumeria Tasting ($25), which came with two salumi , two formaggi, three spuntini (sicilian caponata: eggplant salad, olives and capers / roasted peppers: hand charred, capers, garlic and evoo / artichokes campobasso: baby artichokes, onions, carrots and evoo), and an assortment of olives (black, green and red ones). I couldn't really remember the other types of salumi and formaggi that we chose, but overall it wasn't memorable. To pair our cheese and meat platter, of course we added a liter of wine. We originally asked for a bottle of Rosso, but the waiter insisted we get one liter for the four of us ($20). For starters, we also ordered the dates wrapped in pancetta ($7) and poleta fries ($8.50). I would say that these two were the best dishes. Both were flavorful and tasty, except you're not given much and it's gone within minutes. We also added the Brodetto Ai Frutti Di Mare seafood dish ($16.50), which came with shrimp, clams, calamari, octopus and whitefish simmered in aqua pazza with san marzano tomatoes. It came topped with two garlic toasts, which was good dipped in the sauce. It could've use more flavor as it was a bit watered down. This place just isn't something I'm in favor of. In addition, everything totaled up pretty pricey. There's definitely a nice Italian feel to the restaurant, but the service and food did not please me.

Go here all the time and great for Sunday dinner. Very reasonably priced especially for river North, great wine, service is attentive and always on point. Favourite dishes are the veal meatballs and parpadelle Al sugo de manzo. Great for a casual dinner
Love this place! It's inexpensive and a lively atmosphere. The servers are great. Super friendly and accommodating.  Food is lavish and is always a must when I visit Chicago!

Had a great experience while I was in Chicago for a wedding.  Sat at the bar ordered a couple different things and had a couple drinks. The waitresses were all kind. Bar tender gave some good food suggestions.  Overall A+

This was a solid Chicago dining experience. We chose it because of its proximity to our hotel and its overall Yelp rating. We also liked the idea of tapas style dining. We ordered a liter of Sangiovese and a Salumeria Tasting. We chose: Sicilian caponata (eggplant salad), roasted peppers, salamette, spianata, prosciutto, taleggio and pecorino. My husband could eat this way every night, and especially loved the spianata. The meats are cured in house. I loved the eggplant salad. It was fresh, light and perfectly seasoned. We also shared an order of rigatoni with lamb sugo and burrata. It was spectacular! We ordered a margherita pizza (for our kids) and zeppoli with chocolate sauce to go. They disappeared quickly, so I'm guessing they were good as well! Our server was friendly and attentive and the manager stopped by our table to say hello and make sure everything was to our liking. The tables are close together and it gets quite loud once the dining room is fully seated. But if you embrace the community atmosphere, you'll have an enjoyable experience.

Thoroughly enjoyable! Bellied up to the bar after a long tradeshow, ordered the bacon wrapped, goat cheese stuffed dates drizzled in honey and a veal slider - both great! Bartenders were both extremely helpful and knowledgeable, made great suggestions... Also had duck prosciutto- say whaaaat?!?! Awesome! Cavatelli and eggplant caponata - delish!! Too stuffed for dessert...damn! Must return!

This place was great. We went sat night about eight. We made a reservation in open table reservation like fifteen Mins before we got there and glad we did cause we walked right past the hoards of people outside waiting. This place reminded us of Italy. Great food, service and prices. We had an excellent bottle of wine for $20. People complain about drinking out of the little cups but that is how they do it in Italy in our experience when we traveled there. We had the pancetta wrapped dates, amazing!
